source_info.text:
【0】INDICATION:  ___ man with left rib fracture and right pneumonia,
evaluate lungs and volume status.

【1】COMPARISON:  Portable AP chest radiograph ___.

【2】PA AND LATERAL CHEST RADIOGRAPH:  In comparison with the study of ___, there is improved opacification in the right upper lobe above the level
of the minor fissure, which may reflect resolving pneumonia.  There is some
opacification within the right middle lobe with silhouetting of the right
heart border, which is stable since ___ and may reflect unchanged
consolidation.  The opacification in the right lower lobe has improved since
___.  Area of opacification in the retrocardiac region noted on
___ is improved in this study.  There is trace loculated
left-sided pleural effusion.  Metallic fixation devices are seen along several
left posterior ribs.

【3】IMPRESSION:
1.  Resolving right upper lobe pneumonia.  Stable right middle lobe
opacification may represent stable right middle lobe pneumonia. 
2.  Loculated left pleural effusion.
3.  Resolving retrocardiac opacification.

【0】EXAMINATION:  LIVER OR GALLBLADDER US (SINGLE ORGAN)

【1】INDICATION:  ___ s/p liver transplant ___ who was admitted to ___ with
altered mental status, tremors and ___ with hyperkalemia.  // Assess for
hepatic arterial thrombus

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Grey scale and color Doppler ultrasound images of the abdomen were
obtained.

【3】COMPARISON:  Doppler ultrasound ___

【4】FINDINGS: 

【5】LIVER: The transplant hepatic parenchyma appears within normal limits.  The
contour of the liver is smooth.  There is a tiny hyperechoic structure in or
adjacent to the peripheral left lobe which may represent postoperative change,
fat in the falciform fissure, or tiny hemangioma.  This structure measures 0.7
x 0.9 x 0.4 cm (images 7 through 9).  A small round focal fluid collection is
also noted in the region of the gallbladder fossa.  This fluid collection
measures 1.6 x 1.9 x 1.6 cm and may represent a postsurgical hematoma.  There
is no ascites.  A small right pleural effusion is noted.

【6】BILE DUCTS: There is no intrahepatic biliary dilation.  The CHD measures 2 mm.

【7】PANCREAS: The pancreas is not well visualized due to overlying bowel gas.

【8】SPLEEN: Normal echogenicity, measuring 14.8 cm.

【9】KIDNEYS:  No hydronephrosis is seen on limited views of the kidneys.

【10】DOPPLER EXAMINATION:  The main portal vein is patent with hepatopetal flow. 
Turbulent flow is again noted at the portal vein anastomosis with peak
systolic velocity of 107 cm/sec (previously 223 cm/sec).  The right and left
portal veins are patent with hepatopetal flow.  The hepatic veins and IVC are
patent.  Appropriate arterial waveforms with sharp upstrokes are seen in the
hepatic arteries with resistive indices of 0.61, 0.59 and 0.62 in the main,
right and left hepatic arteries respectively.

【11】IMPRESSION:

【12】1. Patent hepatic vasculature.  Turbulent flow is again noted at the portal
vein anastomosis however peak systolic velocity has improved measuring 107
cm/sec on today's exam.
2. No biliary dilatation seen in the transplant liver.
3. Tiny peripheral echogenic structure noted in the left lobe of the liver
which may represent postoperative change, focal fat or tiny peripheral
hemangioma.
4. Small round fluid collection incidentally noted in the region of the
gallbladder fossa.  This may represent a postsurgical hematoma.
5. Small right pleural effusion noted.  No ascites.
6. Splenomegaly.

text.text: (images 7 through 9)

source_info.text:
【0】EXAMINATION:  VIDEO OROPHARYNGEAL SWALLOW

【1】INDICATION:  ___ year old man with concern for aspiration // swallowing study

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Oropharyngeal swallowing videofluoroscopy was performed in
conjunction with the speech and swallow division. Multiple consistencies of
barium were administered.

【3】DOSE:  Fluoro time: 2 min, 21 seconds.

【4】COMPARISON:  None available.

【5】FINDINGS: 

【6】Barium passes freely through the oropharynx and esophagus without evidence of
obstruction.

【7】There is penetration with nectar consistency barium, without gross aspiration.
However, during consecutive sips of thin barium, there was evidence of gross
aspiration.

【8】IMPRESSION: 

【9】Gross aspiration with consecutive sips of thin barium, and penetration with
nectar consistency liquid.

【10】Please refer to the speech and swallow division note in OMR for full details,
assessment, and recommendations.

text.text:
【10】Please refer to the speech and swallow division note in OMR for full details,

assessment, and recommendations.

source_info.text:
【0】MRI OF THE LEFT THIGH WITH CONTRAST PERFORMED ON ___.

【1】CLINICAL HISTORY:  ___ female with metastatic leiomyosarcoma of the
left thigh.  Status post chemotherapy.

【2】COMPARISON:  ___.

【3】TECHNIQUE:  Multiplanar, multisequence MR imaging through the left thigh
before and after gadolinium administration, including a subtraction sequence.

【4】FINDINGS:  There is again a mass in the proximal left adductor magnus muscle,
abutting the semimembranosus tendon and semitendinosus muscle.  The mass has
decreased in size compared to the previous examination, currently measuring
4.3 x 4.3 x 7.3 cm (previously 5.9 x 5.4 x 6.9 cm).  The mass is again high
signal on T2, and heterogeneously high signal on T1, likely representing a
hemorrhagic component.  The degree and thickness of rim enhancement has
decreased in the interval.  There is a single residual nodular region of
peripheral enhancement measuring 6 mm in diameter located at the deepest, most
medial aspect of the mass.  The mass is separate from the neurovascular
bundle.  There is a small amount of edema surrounding the tumor.

【5】No new masses.  The bone marrow signal is normal.   There is no associated
lymphadenopathy.

【6】The pubic symphyis is normal.  No hip joint effusion.  The visualized muscles
and tendon origins and attachments about the left hip are unremarkable. 

【7】IMPRESSION:  Interval reduction in size and enhancement of the left thigh mass
as described above.

【0】EXAMINATION:  ANKLE (AP, MORTISE AND LAT) RIGHT

【1】INDICATION:  ___ year old woman with R distal tib/fib fx (please include all
the hardware)  // assess fx        assess fx

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Frontal, oblique, and lateral view radiographs of the right ankle.

【3】COMPARISON:  Multiple radiographs the ankle most recent ___

【4】FINDINGS: 

【5】A medial plate and multiple screws transfix a fracture of the distal tibia. 
There is known but less well visualized fracture of the fourth to last
transfixing screw.  Additionally, the third to last medial screw shows
angulation near the neck at the level of the plate.  There is increasing
bridging callus formation and the fracture lines are becoming less
conspicuous.  Overall alignment is unchanged.

【6】There is also a lateral plate and multiple screws along the fibula also
crossing the syndesmosis.  There is no acute fracture.  The ankle mortise is
congruent.  Overlying skin staples have been removed.

【7】IMPRESSION: 

【8】Continued healing of distal tibial and fibular fractures.  Fracture of the
fourth to last medial screw as before.  Angulation of the neck of the third to
last medial screw which may be bent or broken.

【0】EXAMINATION:  CT ABD AND PELVIS WITH CONTRAST

【1】INDICATION:  ___ with RLQ pain, tenderness// eval for appendicitis

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Single phase split bolus contrast: MDCT axial images were acquired
through the abdomen and pelvis following intravenous contrast administration
with split bolus technique. IV Contrast:  130 mL Omnipaque. Coronal and
sagittal reformations were performed and reviewed on PACS. Oral contrast was
not administered.

【3】DOSE:  Total DLP (Body) = 516 mGy-cm.

【4】COMPARISON:  None.

【5】FINDINGS: 

【6】LOWER CHEST: Imaged lung bases are clear.  The imaged portion of the heart is
unremarkable.

【7】ABDOMEN:

【8】HEPATOBILIARY: Liver enhances normally without focal concerning lesion.  Main
portal vein is patent.  No biliary ductal dilation.  Gallbladder is normal. 
Common bile duct is not appear dilated.

【9】PANCREAS: Pancreas enhances normally without focal lesion or ductal dilation. 
No signs of pancreatitis.

【10】SPLEEN: Normal in size.  No focal lesion.

【11】ADRENALS: Normal.

【12】URINARY: The kidneys are of normal and symmetric.  There is asymmetric
cortical enhancement, with relative ___ of the right kidney. 
Moderate right hydroureteronephrosis is noted, with urothelial enhancement
along the course of the right ureter.  There is a right UVJ stone, measuring 4
mm.  There is minimal right perinephric fat stranding.  No perinephric fluid
collection is noted.  There are bilateral, hypodense renal lesions, the
largest in the upper pole of the left kidney, most likely represents a cyst. 
The others are too small to accurately characterize.

【13】GASTROINTESTINAL: The stomach is unremarkable.  Small bowel loops demonstrate
normal caliber, wall thickness, and enhancement throughout.  The colon and
rectum are within normal limits.  The appendix is normal.

【14】PELVIS: There is no free fluid in the pelvis.

【15】REPRODUCTIVE ORGANS: Aside from prostatic calcifications, the reproductive
organs are unremarkable.

【16】LYMPH NODES: There is no retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy.  There
is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.

【17】VASCULAR: There is no abdominal aortic aneurysm.  Moderate atherosclerotic
disease is noted.

【18】BONES: There are no worrisome osseous lesions or acute fracture.  There are
bilateral pars defects at L5, without abnormal alignment.

【19】SOFT TISSUES: The abdominal and pelvic wall is within normal limits.

【20】IMPRESSION:

【21】1. Right UVJ 4mm calculus resulting in mild-to-moderate right
hydroureteronephrosis. Superimposed infection is a concern and correlation
with urinalysis is recommended.
2. Normal appendix.
3. L5 spondylolysis without spondylolisthesis.

【22】RECOMMENDATION(S):  Urinalysis

【0】EXAMINATION:  RENAL U.S.

【1】INDICATION:  ___ year old woman with L CVAT// eval for renal stone

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Grey scale and color Doppler ultrasound images of the kidneys were
obtained.

【3】COMPARISON:  Ultrasound dated ___.

【4】FINDINGS: 

【5】The right kidney measures 10.4 cm. The left kidney measures 11.4 cm.  There is
a 7 mm echogenic focus in the anterior interpolar right kidney without
posterior acoustic shadowing.  Similar 6 mm echogenic focus is noted in the
upper pole of the left kidney.  There is no hydronephrosis.  There is no
evidence of a solid renal mass.  Normal cortical echogenicity and
corticomedullary differentiation are seen bilaterally.

【6】The bladder is moderately well distended and normal in appearance.  Bilateral
ureteral jets are demonstrated.

【7】IMPRESSION: 

【8】No hydronephrosis.  Subcentimeter echogenic foci in the kidneys as described
are indeterminate and may represent small nonobstructive parenchymal calculi.

【0】EXAMINATION:  ABD (SINGLE VIEW ONLY) IN O.R.

【1】INDICATION:  Intraoperative cholangiogram.

【2】FINDINGS: 

【3】40 intraoperative images were acquired without a radiologist present.

【4】I ntraoperative cholangiogram with retrograde contrast filling of the biliary
tree shows a small, smoooth constant filling defect   within the right biliary
tree at the origin of a superiorly-directed subsegmental duct (series 1, image
13). Its unchanged position and appearance of multilpe images suggests this is
not an air bubble and may be a stone. Note peripheral ducs on the left are
excluded from view of this study.

【5】IMPRESSION: 

【6】Intraoperative images were obtained during operative cholangiogram, which
demonstrating a small filling defect within the right biliary tree. Please
refer to the operative note for details of the procedure.

【7】NOTIFICATION:   The findings were discussed by Dr. ___ with Dr.
___ On the telephone on ___ at 11:55 AM, 15 minutes after
the discovery of the findings.

【0】INDICATION:  ___ year old woman with LEFT SHOULDER PAIN  // LEFT SHOULDER PAIN

【1】COMPARISON:  None.

【2】IMPRESSION: 

【3】No acute fractures or dislocations are seen. There are mild degenerative
changes of both the AC and glenohumeral joints.  The acromion is slightly
inferior tilting. Visualized left lung apex appears grossly clear.  There are
no abnormal soft tissue calcifications.

source_info.text:
【0】INDICATION:  Cough and fever, evaluate for pneumonia.

【1】COMPARISON:  Chest radiographs from ___.

【2】FINDINGS:  The right venous infusion catheter ends near the superior
cavoatrial junction.  The cardiac and mediastinal contours are normal.  There
are unchanged calcified lymph nodes in the AP window.  Nodular opacities in
the retrocardiac area correlate with findings on CT from ___. 
One of these nodules was previously biopsied and demonstrated organizing
pneumonia.  The lungs are otherwise clear.  There are no pleural
abnormalities.

【3】IMPRESSION:
Persistent nodular opacities in the retrocardiac area are likely organizing
pneumonia as determined by recent biopsy.  Continued surveillance of these
lesions is recommended to ensure resolution.

【0】EXAMINATION:  CT ABD AND PELVIS WITH CONTRAST

【1】INDICATION:  ___ year old transgender man with metastatic leiomyosarcoma s/p
primary debulking, now on chemo  // assess for interval change

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Single phase contrast: MDCT axial images were acquired through the
abdomen and pelvis following intravenous contrast administration.
Oral contrast was not administered.
Coronal and sagittal reformations were performed and reviewed on PACS.

【3】DOSE:  Acquisition sequence:
   1) Stationary Acquisition 5.0 s, 0.5 cm; CTDIvol = 24.1 mGy (Body) DLP =
12.0 mGy-cm.
   2) Spiral Acquisition 8.5 s, 65.6 cm; CTDIvol = 12.3 mGy (Body) DLP = 804.2
mGy-cm.
 Total DLP (Body) = 816 mGy-cm.

【4】COMPARISON:  CT abdomen pelvis ___

【5】FINDINGS: 

【6】LOWER CHEST: Please refer to separate report of CT chest performed on the same
day for description of the thoracic findings.

【7】ABDOMEN:

【8】HEPATOBILIARY: The liver demonstrates homogenous attenuation throughout. 
There is no suspicious focal lesion.  There is no evidence of intrahepatic or
extrahepatic biliary dilatation.  The gallbladder is within normal limits,
probable gallbladder diverticulum inferiorly (6:68 602:79).  There is a 5 mm
soft tissue nodule adjacent to the inferior tip of the liver (601:51),
unchanged.

【9】PANCREAS: The pancreas has normal attenuation throughout, without evidence of
focal lesions or pancreatic ductal dilation.  There is no peripancreatic
stranding.

【10】SPLEEN: The spleen shows normal size and attenuation throughout, without
evidence of focal lesions.  Unchanged 1.1 cm soft tissue nodule adjacent to
the anterior inferior spleen.

【11】ADRENALS: The right and left adrenal glands are normal in size and shape.

【12】URINARY: The kidneys are of normal and symmetric size with normal nephrogram. 
There is no evidence of solid renal lesions.   There is no perinephric
abnormality.  There is no hydronephrosis or hydroureter.  The urinary bladder
is unremarkable.

【13】GASTROINTESTINAL: The stomach is unremarkable in appearance Small bowel loops
demonstrate normal caliber, wall thickness, and enhancement. There is a
central colonic anastomosis seen which is grossly unchanged.  There is a large
amount of fecal material in the right colon.  Rectus diastasis with bulging of
the colon anteriorly again noted.  The appendix is not visualized.

【14】PELVIS:  There is no free fluid in the pelvis.

【15】REPRODUCTIVE ORGANS: Not visualized, presumed surgically removed.

【16】LYMPH NODES: There is no retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy.  
There is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.

【17】VASCULAR: No significant atherosclerotic disease is noted.  There is no
abdominal aortic aneurysm.

【18】BONES: There is no evidence of worrisome osseous lesions or acute fracture. 
Bone island noted in the left femoral neck

【19】SOFT TISSUES: The abdominal and pelvic wall is within normal limits.

【20】IMPRESSION:

【21】1. No evidence of disease progression.  Peritoneal nodule inferior to the
liver and spleen are unchanged in appearance.
2. Please see the separate report of the CT chest for description of the
intrathoracic findings.

【0】PA AND LATERAL CHEST, ___

【1】HISTORY:  Persistent cough for several months.

【2】IMPRESSION:  PA and lateral chest compared to ___:

【3】Normal heart, lungs, hila, mediastinum and pleural surfaces.

【4】Mild thoracic kyphosis is longstanding.  No compression fracture.  No evidence
of intrathoracic malignancy or active infection.

【0】EXAMINATION:  CHEST (PORTABLE AP)

【1】INDICATION:  ___ year old woman with B cell lymphoma on chemo, p/w from home w/
BRBPR, now with guaiac + stool (no frank BRBPR or melena observed here). She
is now acutely very SOB, orthostatic with BP to 82/48, HR 121 standing.  //
eval for interval change    eval for interval change

【2】COMPARISON:  Comparison to prior study dated ___ at 16 58

【3】FINDINGS: 

【4】Portable AP upright chest film ___ at 11:03 is submitted.

【5】IMPRESSION: 

【6】Right Port-A-Cath unchanged in position.  Overall cardiac and mediastinal
contours are stable.  Lungs remain well inflated without evidence of focal
airspace consolidation, pleural effusions, pulmonary edema or pneumothorax. 
Calcified right hilar lymph nodes are again seen suggestive of prior
granulomatous infection.

【0】EXAMINATION:  LIVER OR GALLBLADDER US (SINGLE ORGAN)

【1】INDICATION:  ___  w/abdominal pain, ___ s/p left lobe hepatectomy, new liver
lesions on CT today w/one that has near occlusion of portal vein, please
further assess degree of occlusion  // ___ w/abdominal pain, ___ s/p left lobe
hepatectomy, new liver lesions on CT today w/one that has near occlusion of
portal vein, please further assess degree of occlusion

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Grey scale and color Doppler ultrasound images of the abdomen were
obtained.

【3】COMPARISON:  CT abdomen/ pelvis from ___.

【4】FINDINGS: 

【5】LIVER:  The patient is status post left hepatectomy.  Background hepatic
parenchyma appears normal.  There are several echogenic masses throughout the
liver, better evaluated on CT from the day prior. The contour of the liver is
smooth.  There is no ascites.  The main portal vein cannot be visualized,
likely related to compression and occlusion by a mass, as seen on CT.  The
main hepatic artery, right portal veins, right hepatic artery, and right
hepatic vein are patent with normal waveforms.

【6】BILE DUCTS: There is no intrahepatic biliary dilation. The CBD measures 4 mm.

【7】GALLBLADDER: The gallbladder is surgically absent.

【8】PANCREAS: The pancreas is not visualized secondary to overlying bowel gas.

【9】SPLEEN: Normal echogenicity, measuring 11.9 cm.

【10】KIDNEYS:  Limited views of the right kidney demonstrate no stone, mass, or
hydronephrosis.

【11】RETROPERITONEUM: Visualized portions of aorta and IVC are within normal
limits.

【12】IMPRESSION:

【13】1. Main portal vein not visualized, likely related to compression and
occlusion by a mass as seen on CT from the day prior.  The main hepatic
artery, bright portal veins, right hepatic artery, and right hepatic vein are
patent with normal waveforms.
2. Several liver masses are better evaluated on recent contrast-enhanced CT.

【0】HISTORY:  Left elbow pain.

【1】LEFT ELBOW, THREE VIEWS.

【2】The AP and oblique views are slightly atypical in positioning, which may
reflect limitations in the patient's range of motion.  No lucent or sclerotic
fracture line or displaced fracture fragment is detected.  The joint spaces
are preserved and congruent on the lateral view, without gross degenerative
change.  There is an elbow joint effusion.  A small (2.5 mm) calcification
superimposed over the elbow joint may represent a loose body.  No donor site
is detected.

【3】IMPRESSION:  Joint effusion.  If there is a history of trauma, then the
possibility of an occult intra-articular fracture should be considered.  A
small loose body noted.

【0】PREOP PA AND LATERAL CHEST, ___

【1】HISTORY:  Preop surgical evaluation.

【2】IMPRESSION:  PA and lateral compared to ___ through ___:

【3】Large region of consolidation in the left lower lobe has been present at least
to some degree since ___, when chest CT showed a large region of
atelectasis.  Whether this is atelectasis alone or the patient has developed a
hypostatic pneumonia in the adjacent lung is not determinable from the
conventional radiographs alone.  The right lung is clear.  The heart is top
normal size.  Small right pleural effusion is present.  There is no pulmonary
edema.  A right PIC line ends close to the superior cavoatrial junction.

【4】Dr. ___ was paged at 9:45 a.m. and we discussed the findings 5 minutes
later.

【0】EXAMINATION:  CHEST (PORTABLE AP)

【1】INDICATION:  ___ year old man with hypoxic resp failure, intubated// interval
change

【2】IMPRESSION: 

【3】In comparison with the study of ___, the right subclavian PICC line is
been pulled back to the lower SVC.  Other monitoring and support devices are
unchanged.  Cardiomediastinal silhouette is stable and there again is
pulmonary vascular congestion with bilateral pleural effusions and compressive
basilar atelectasis, more prominent on the right.

【0】PORTABLE CHEST, ___

【1】COMPARISON:  ___.

【2】FINDINGS:  Heart size is normal.  Aorta is mildly tortuous.  Lungs are clear
except for small linear focus of atelectasis at the left lung base.  Mildly
distended loops of bowel in upper abdomen are incompletely evaluated on the
chest radiograph examination which could be more fully assessed with standard
abdominal views if warranted clinically.

【3】IMPRESSION:
Minimal linear left basilar atelectasis with otherwise clear lungs.

【0】EXAMINATION:  CHEST (PA AND LAT)

【1】INDICATION:  ___ year old man s/p pericardial window with left effusion// eval
for interval change

【2】IMPRESSION: 

【3】Comparison with the study of ___, the cardiac silhouette appears slightly
less prominent than the left hemidiaphragmatic contour is sharply seen. 
However, there is opacification along the lateral chest wall with a
configuration raising the possibility of a loculated collection
The pulmonary vascular congestion has essentially cleared.  No evidence of
acute pneumonia.

【0】INDICATIONS:  ___ woman with hemachromatosis.  Question extent of iron
overload.

【1】COMPARISONS:  None.

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Multiplanar T1- and T2-images of the abdomen were obtained on a
1.5 Tesla magnet, including dynamic high-resolution 3D imaging obtained prior
to, during, and following the uneventful intravenous administration of 0.1
mmol/kg of gadolinium-DTPA. IDEAL sequences for fat-water separation were also
obtained.

【3】Multiplanar 2D and 3D reformations were reviewed on a separate workstation.

【4】FINDINGS:  The signal intensity values and enhancement pattern of the liver
appear normal, without MR imaging evidence for iron overload.  The
gallbladder, pancreas, adrenal glands, kidneys, and spleen are within normal
limits.  The visualized bowel is unremarkable.  There is no lymphadenopathy or
free fluid.  Visualized osseous structures are also within normal limits.

post-gadolinium T1 and T2-weighted images of the lumbar spine were obtained.

involvement of the pedicles of L3.

not appear to be significantly changed since the prior study.

joints and ligamentum flavum but without canal or foraminal stenoses.

joints and ligamentum flavum but without canal or foraminal stenoses.

【26】The conus medullaris is normal in signal intensity with no abnormal
enhancement.  It normally ends at the T12/L1 level.

【27】Within the right kidney is an irregularly-shaped lesion.  This lesion measures
approximately 1.2 cm in size and seen on the CT of the torso from ___.

【28】IMPRESSION:  Multiple sclerotic metastases involving the cervical, thoracic,
lumbar spine as well as the left ilium, not significantly changed compared to
the prior studies.

【29】No significant change in the minimal left lateral epidural enhancement at the
C7/T1 level, which may represent epidural extension of tumor Vs.
asymmetrically prominent veins.

【30】Multiple hepatic metastases in an irregularly shaped 1.2 cm lesion of the
right kidney as well as in atrophic pancreas and enlarged pancreatic duct. 
Please refer to the CT of the torso from ___ for full description of these
findings.

【31】No evidence of cord compression or pathologic compression fractures.

consistent with volume loss in the left lower lobe and probable left effusion.

【0】HISTORY:  Left hand injury.

【1】LEFT HAND, THREE VIEWS.

【2】No localizing history is available.  Allowing for this, there is a comminuted

【3】RIGHT HAND, THREE VIEWS.  Findings called to the ordering physician, ___

【0】INDICATION:  ___ male with cancer and known brain metastases diagnosed

was administered.

acute hemorrhage within a known metastatic lesion.  There is also acute
hemorrhage within the left basal ganglia metastatic lesion (2A:14). In
addition there is increased effacement of the sulci in the right hemisphere
without significant shift of the normally midline structures.

anterior ethmoid air cell.  Soft tissues are otherwise unremarkable. Osseous

frontal lobe and left basal ganglia.

for further evaluation.

metastatic lesions in the left frontal, left parietal and right parietal
cortices.

【9】4.  Interval development of left sphenoid and anterior ethomoid sinus disease.

on ___.

source_info.text:
【0】CHEST RADIOGRAPH

【1】INDICATION:  Questionable pneumonia.

【2】COMPARISON:  ___.

【3】FINDINGS:  As compared to the previous radiograph, there is unchanged evidence
of atelectasis at the left lung base, potentially combined to a small pleural
effusion.  Newly appeared is a parenchymal opacity at the right lung base that
might reflect atelectasis, given the removal of the endotracheal tube and the
nasogastric tube.  Overall, the lung volumes have slightly decreased, which
might support this hypothesis.

【0】PA AND LATERAL CHEST, ___ AT 15:08 HOURS

【1】HISTORY:  Suspected multiple sclerosis flare.

【2】COMPARISON:  Multiple priors, the most recent dated ___.

【3】FINDINGS:  Consistent with prior examination, the lungs remain well expanded
and clear.  The mediastinum is unremarkable.  The cardiac silhouette is within
normal limits for size.  No pleural effusion or pneumothorax is seen.  The
visualized osseous structures are unremarkable.

【4】IMPRESSION:  No acute pulmonary process.

【0】INDICATION:  ___ woman with history of PCOS, now with irregular,
painful and heavy menses.

【1】COMPARISON:  Pelvic ultrasound ___.

【2】LMP:  ___.

【3】TECHNIQUE:  Transabdominal and transvaginal ultrasound of the pelvis were
performed, the latter done to better assess the endometrium and adnexa.

【4】FINDINGS:  The uterus is anteverted measuring 8.2 x 5.1 x 4.5 cm.  A 2.7 cm
anterior intramural fibroid in the body of the uterus, was not seen in the
prior study.  The endometrium is heterogeneous and thickened measuring 13 mm. 
The ovaries are unremarkable.  A 2.3 cm right paraovarian cyst, is unchanged. 
There is no pelvic free fluid.

【5】IMPRESSION:
1.  Heterogeneous thickened endometrium, may in part relate to the patient's
menstrual cycle.  However, a focal endometrial lesion such as a polyp is not
excluded.
2.  Normal ovaries and a simple right paraovarian cyst.
3.  Fibroid uterus.

【0】EXAM:  MRI of the brain.

【1】CLINICAL INFORMATION:  Patient is status post fall and subarachnoid
hemorrhage, now noted to have a left cavernous sinus mass, for further
evaluation.

【2】TECHNIQUE:  T1 sagittal and axial and FLAIR T2 susceptibility and diffusion
axial images were obtained before gadolinium.  T1 axial and MP-RAGE sagittal
images acquired following gadolinium.  Correlation was made with the previous
CT of ___ and ___.

【3】FINDINGS:  As noted on the previous CT, there is subarachnoid hemorrhage in
the left frontal region along the sulci.  A small left frontal subdural an
interhemispheric subdural are also seen without mass effect.  There is no
midline shift.  There is no acute infarct.

【4】There is a lobulated left cavernous sinus mass identified as seen on the CT.
The mass measures 2.5 x 1.5 cm and extends inferior to the left cavernous
carotid without encircling it.  The mass also seemed to be extending towards
the left foramen ovale.  There is no dural enhancement identified.  The mass
produces slight defect in the anterior portion of the left Meckel's cave.
These findings are suggestive of a schwannoma more likely than a meningioma.
The intense enhancement and the lobulated appearance is less suggestive of
metastatic disease or perineural spread of tumor.

【5】IMPRESSION:
1.  Left frontal subarachnoid hemorrhage and small left frontal and
interhemispheric subdural hemorrhages.
2.  Lobulated left cavernous sinus mass which is more likely to be a
schwannoma from imaging characteristics.

【6】MRA OF THE HEAD:
The head MRA demonstrates normal flow in the arteries of anterior and
posterior circulation.  No evidence of vascular occlusion or stenosis or an
aneurysm identified.  The mass described on the MRI is seen to be extending
inferior to the left cavernous carotid.  The mass does not appear to be
encircling the carotid or communicating with it.

【7】IMPRESSION:  Normal MRA of the head.  No vascular occlusion, stenosis or an
aneurysm seen.  The left cavernous sinus mass appeared to be extending below
the left cavernous carotid.

【0】HISTORY:  Ileostomy, acute abdominal pain.  Evaluate for free air or
obstruction.

【1】COMPARISON:  CT ___.

【2】ABDOMEN, SUPINE AND LEFT LATERAL DECUBITUS:  Staples overlie the lower abdomen
and pelvis.  There are no dilated loops of small or large bowel. No free air
or pneumatosis is evident.  Coarse calcifications are present within the
pelvis, which corresponds to a calcified fibroid.  Multilevel degenerative
changes are noted throughout the lumbar spine.

【3】IMPRESSION:  No evidence of free air or obstruction.

【0】STUDY:  CTA chest with and without contrast and reconstructions.  CT abdomen
and pelvis with contrast and reconstructions.

【1】INDICATION:  Known liver mass with chest pain, shortness of breath, and
abdominal pain.

【2】COMPARISON:  Outside hospital CT abdomen and pelvis (Southcoast) ___.

【3】TECHNIQUE: MDCT axially acquired images were obtained from the thoracic inlet
to the upper abdomen without contrast. CT of the chest was then performed
after the uneventful intravenous administration of 130 ml Optiray 350 contrast
material. Multiplanar reformatted images were obtained and reviewed.  CT of
the abdomen and pelvis were also obtained with contrast and reconstructions.

【4】CT CHEST WITH CONTRAST:  No dissection flap is present within the thoracic
aorta to suggest dissection.  There is calcified atherosclerotic plaque
involving the coronary arteries and aortic valve of unknown hemodynamic
significance. No pericardial effusion is present.  No axillary, mediastinal,
or hilar adenopathy is detected per CT size criteria.  Median sternotomy wires
are noted surrounding the sternum.  No filling defects are identified within
the pulmonary arteries; however, bolus is such that the subsegmental arteries
cannot be fully evaluated.  There is moderate centrilobular emphysematous
changes within the lungs.  Mild hypoventilatory changes are noted within the
dependent portions of the lungs.  There is linear opacity within the right
upper lobe most suggestive of atelectasis.  Of note, evaluation of the chest
is limited given flank hitting the gantry and arm within the field of view.

【5】CT ABDOMEN WITH CONTRAST:  Evaluation is limited given streak artifact from
arm within the field of view and abutting the gantry.  There is again noted to
be an infiltrating mass involving the majority of the right lobe of the liver
with sparing of portions of segment VI.  The left lobe appears relatively
spared; however, phase of contrast is not optimized for evaluation of the
liver.  Cholecystectomy clips are noted consistent with previous
cholecystectomy.  An aortic stent graft is present with limbs extending into
the iliac branches.  The celiac axis, SMA, and ___ appear patent.  The kidneys
enhance and excrete symmetrically without hydronephrosis.  The adrenal glands
are unremarkable.  There is further progression of thrombus within the left
portal vein with extension into the main portal vein.  The left portal vein is
patent.  No free fluid or free air is present within the abdomen.

【6】CT PELVIS WITH CONTRAST:  The bladder is minimally distended with urine and
thus not well evaluated.  The prostate gland, seminal vesicles, rectum, and
sigmoid colon are unremarkable.  No free fluid or free air is present within
the pelvis.

【7】OSSEOUS STRUCTURES:  No suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions are identified.

【8】IMPRESSION:

【9】1.  No evidence of aortic dissection or pulmonary embolism.  However, the
subsegmental pulmonary arteries cannot be fully evaluated on this phase of
contrast.

【10】2.  Infiltrating hepatic lesion involving the majority of the right lobe with
relative sparing of segment VI.  However, phase of contrast is not optimized
for full evaluation of the liver and optimal evaluation with triphasic CT
versus MRI recommended.  Further progression of portal vein thrombosis
involving the right portal vein with new extension into the main portal vein.

【11】3.  Coronary artery calcifications.  Calcification of the aortic valve of
unknown hemodynamic significance.

【12】4.  Emphasematous changes.

【0】INDICATION:  ___ year old man with ards// infection, ards

【1】TECHNIQUE:  AP portable chest radiograph

【2】COMPARISON:  ___

【3】FINDINGS: 

【4】The tip of an endotracheal tube projects over the mid thoracic trachea and an
enteric tube courses to the stomach.  The tip of the right internal jugular
central venous catheter projects over the upper to mid SVC.

【5】There are low bilateral lung volumes with diffuse bilateral airspace
opacities, appearing somewhat decreased particularly at both lung bases. 
There are small bilateral pleural effusions present.  No pneumothorax.  The
size of the cardiac silhouette is unchanged.

【6】IMPRESSION: 

【7】Interval placement of an enteric tube which projects over the stomach.

【8】Increased aeration in both lower lungs however diffuse bilateral airspace
consolidations persist.

【0】INDICATION:  ___ female with early pregnancy.  Assess viability.

【1】PRIOR SCAN:  ___.

【2】LMP:  ___.

【3】Transabdominal and transvaginal ultrasound were performed, the latter for
better evaluation of the endometrium and adnexa.  There is an intrauterine
gestational sac with a single live embryo with a crown-rump length of 6 mm
corresponding to a gestational age of 6 weeks 2 days.  This corresponds
satisfactorily with age by dates of 6 weeks 3 days.  The uterus and adnexa are
normal.

【4】IMPRESSION:  Single live intrauterine pregnancy.  Size equals dates.

【0】CHEST RADIOGRAPH

【1】INDICATION:  Status post colectomy, history of pneumonia and fluid overload. 
Assessment for interval change.

【2】COMPARISON:  ___, 
FINDINGS:  As compared to the previous radiograph, there is a newly occurred
plate-like atelectasis at the right lung bases.  Otherwise, the radiograph is
unchanged.  Small left pleural effusion restricted to the costophrenic sinus,
small retrocardiac atelectasis.  Minimal overhydration cannot be excluded.  No
focal parenchymal opacity suggesting pneumonia.  Unchanged size of the cardiac
silhouette.  Unchanged monitoring and support devices.

【0】INDICATION FOR EXAM:  ___ woman with hematuria.  Please evaluate for
the presence of GU malignancy.

【1】COMPARISON EXAMS:  None available.

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Multidetector CT-acquired axial images from the lung bases to the
pubic symphysis acquired without and after IV contrast administration.  Oral
contrast was not given.  Coronal and sagittal reformats provided.

【3】CT ABDOMEN WITH AND WITHOUT CONTRAST:  The imaged lower chest is unremarkable.

【4】The liver enhances homogeneously with no cystic or solid lesions.  There is no
intra- or extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilation.  The patient is status post
cholecystectomy.  The portal and splenic veins appear patent.

【5】The adrenal glands, pancreas, and spleen enhance normally and contain no focal
lesions.  The kidneys exhibit normal parenchymal contrast enhancement,
although image acquisition was slightly late to opacify the intrarenal
collecting system.  There appear to be multiple parapelvic cysts in the left
kidney (4:31).  The ureters and renal pelvises are not dilated and follow a
normal course to the bladder.  There are no radiopaque stones within the GU
tract.  There are no abnormally enhancing masses to suggest renal malignancy.

【6】The stomach, duodenum, and small bowel are normal in course and caliber with
no evidence of obstruction or mass.  There is no retroperitoneal or mesenteric
lymphadenopathy identified.  There is no ascites or peritoneal free fluid or
air.

【7】There are scattered atherosclerotic calcifications in the abdominal aorta and
iliac arteries.  There is no evidence of aortic aneurysm or dissection.  The
main arterial branches are patent.

【8】CT PELVIS WITH AND WITHOUT IV CONTRAST:  The colon is normal in course and
caliber with no obstructing mass or evidence of inflammation.  The rectum and
sigmoid colon are unremarkable.  The appendix is visualized and is normal.

【9】The urinary bladder is normal with contrast filling the bladder completely. 
There is no hyperdense mass seen on non-contrast views, and there is no
filling defect.  The uterus contains multiple clusters of calcifications
(4:71) which are consistent with old leiomyomas.  The bilateral adnexae are
unremarkable.  There is a serpentine linear string of intermittent
calcifications which seem to follow the course of small pelvic veins and
likely represents old thrombosis.  Several benign phleboliths are also seen. 
There is no pelvic free fluid, cystic mass, or solid mass.  There is no pelvic
or inguinal lymphadenopathy identified.

【10】SKELETAL STRUCTURES:  There are degenerative changes of the imaged spine. 
There are no concerning blastic or lytic lesions.

【11】IMPRESSION:
1.  No abdominal or pelvic pathology to explain patient's hematuria.
2.  Multiple left renal parapelvic cysts.
3.  Calcified uterine fibroids.

【0】HISTORY:  ___ female with right lower quadrant pain.  Please evaluate
for gallstones.

【1】COMPARISON:  MRCP ___.

【2】ABDOMINAL ULTRASOUND:  The liver is homogeneous in echotexture, without
evidence of a focal liver lesion.  The gallbladder is collapsed, and
demonstrates no evidence of cholelithiasis.  No focal liver lesion is
identified.  There is no intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation.  The main
portal vein is patent, with antegrade flow.  The spleen measures 10.6 cm, with
normal echogenicity.  Limited views of the aorta are unremarkable.  The
pancreatic head is unremarkable, but the remainder of the pancreas is obscured
by bowel gas.  There is no peripancreatic fluid or ascites.

【3】Adjacent to the right lobe of the liver, a large, heterogeneous mass
demonstrates continuity with pelvic fibroids seen inferiorly.  Given the size,
this is difficult to measure, but not clearly enlarged since the prior MRCP
exam.  According to the patient, recent (outside) dedicated pelvic ultrasound
demonstrated stability of multiple fibroids.

【4】IMPRESSION:

【5】1)  No evidence of cholelithiasis.

【6】2)  Large uterine fibroid extending into the right mid abdomen adjacent to the
inferior right liver margin.

【0】INDICATION:  Screening.

【1】COMPARISON:  Analog study dated ___.

【2】BILATERAL DIGITAL SCREENING MAMMOGRAM:  The breasts are predominantly fatty,
without dominant mass, suspicious clustered microcalcifications, or
architectural distortion.  There are widespread bilateral scattered dermal
calcifications.

【3】IMPRESSION:  No specific mammographic evidence of malignancy.  

【4】BI-RADS 2 - benign findings.

【0】INDICATION:  ___ woman with L5/S1 radiculopathy.

【1】COMPARISON:  MRI L-spine dated ___.

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Sagittal T1, T2 and axial T2 images were obtained without
contrast.

【3】FINDINGS:  The lumbar spine is straightened.  Vertebral body height and
alignment are grossly maintained.  Since the prior exam, intervertebral discs
demonstrate progressive loss of T2 signal and height with intervertebral disc
herniations and markedly progressive ___ type 1 and 2 endplate changes.

【4】At level L2/L3, there is minimal broad-based disc bulge as well as posterior
osteophytes that mildly encroach on the thecal sac.  The right neural foramen
is mildly narrowed by facet joint arthropathy. There is marrow edema at the
end-plates without significant loss of height of the body. 

【5】At level L3/L4, there is left eccentric diffuse disc bulge with narrowing of
the left lateral recess but patent spinal canal.  The bilateral neural
foramina are mildly narrowed by facet joint arthropathy.

【6】At L4/L5, a roundish, 8 x 8 mm lesion is appreciated centered within the left
lateral recess and extending from the degenerative left facet joint.  Given,
its low T2 signal and fat isointensity on T1 the mass likely represents
extensive facet joint osteophytes, although a  synovial cyst with dense
contents is also high in the differential. The traversing left L5 nerve root
is displaced by this lesion.  The spinal canal is patent.  The left neural
foramen is moderately narrowed by facet joint arthropathy.

【7】At L5/S1, there is a median disc protrusion superimposed on a disc bulge.  The
left neural foramen is severely narrowed by facet joint arthropathy and left
foraminal protrusion.

【8】The conus terminates at L1 level.  Conus and cauda moreover demonstrate normal
morphology and intrinsic T2 signal.  The posterior elements are remarkable for
extensive facet joint arthropathy.

【9】IMPRESSION:  Progressive multilevel degenerative changes of the lumbar spine
as detailed above, most notably with a new mass extending from the left L4/L5
facet joint into the lateral recess, which may represent a large intraspinal
facet joint osteophyte versus a synovial cyst with dense contents. Marrow
edema at L2 and L3 bodies without significant loss of height of the body.

【0】HISTORY:  Right ring finger pain.

【1】FINDINGS:  The technologist noted that the patient was experiencing pain on
the left side and therefore images were obtained of this region.

【2】Three views show no evidence of acute bone or joint space abnormality and no
change from the study of ___.

【0】STUDY:  MRI of the cervical spine.

【1】CLINICAL INDICATION:  ___ woman with persistent neck pain and
rheumatoid arthritis.

【2】COMPARISON:  Plain films of the cervical spine dated ___.

【3】TECHNIQUE:  Sagittal T1, T2, and STIR sequences were obtained, axial
T2-weighted images were also performed.

【4】FINDINGS:  This is a partially limited examination due to patient motion.  The
visualized elements of the posterior fossa and the craniocervical junction are
grossly unremarkable.  The signal intensity throughout the cervical vertebral
bodies is slightly heterogeneous with areas of high signal intensity, likely
consistent with bone marrow replacement for fat.  The signal intensity
throughout the cervical spinal cord appears grossly unremarkable with no
evidence of focal or diffuse lesions to indicate spinal cord edema or cord
expansion.

【5】At C2/3 level, both neural foramina are patent with no evidence of spinal
canal stenosis.

【6】C3-4, demonstrates a posterior disc bulge, causing anterior thecal sac
deformity; however, no evidence of neural foraminal narrowing is identified.

【7】At C4/5 level, mild posterior disc bulge is identified, with no evidence of
neural foraminal narrowing or spinal canal stenosis.

【8】C5/6, demonstrates minimal posterior osteophytic formation, better depicted in
the sagittal T2 weighted sequence, causing minimal anterior thecal sac
deformity, there is no evidence of neural foraminal narrowing or spinal canal
stenosis.

【9】C6/7 level, demonstrates minimal posterior disc bulge with no evidence of
neural foraminal narrowing or spinal canal stenosis.

【10】The upper thoracic spine at the level of T2/3 demonstrates a Schmorl's node,
causing irregular contour of the superior endplate at T3.  The visualized
paravertebral structures are grossly unremarkable, the thyroid gland
demonstrates a focal area of low signal on the left thyroid lobe, possibly
representing a calcification, partially evaluated in this examination (image
21, series 5), if there is any clinical concern related with this finding,
correlation with  thyroid ultrasound is recommended.

【11】IMPRESSION:

【12】1.  Limited examination due to patient motion, despite this limitation,
grossly there is no evidence of focal or diffuse lesions throughout the
cervical spinal cord.

【13】2.  Multilevel disc degenerative changes throughout the cervical spine, more
significant at C3/4 level and causing anterior thecal sac deformity with no
frank evidence of nerve root compression.

【14】3.  Schmorl's node is identified at T2/3 level, causing irregular contour at
the superior endplate of T3, partially evaluated in this examination.

【15】4.  Focal area of low signal intensity identified on the left thyroid lobe,
possibly consistent with a small calcification, correlation with thyroid
ultrasound is recommended if clinically warranted.

【0】HISTORY:  Fracture.  Please image pelvis.

【1】Three radiographs of the pelvis and right hip demonstrate the patient to be
status post ORIF the proximal femur fracture seen on ___.  The right
femoral head contour is smooth.  Avulsion of the lesser trochanter is again
noted.  There is callus formation about the fracture site.  The distal
interlocking screw is at an angle when compared to the intramedullary nail,
similar to that seen on the intraoperative fluoroscopic view of ___. 
Correlation with surgical history is requested.  Mild degenerative change
involves the left hip joint and the symphysis pubis.  Assessment of the sacrum
and SI joints is limited by overlying bowel gas.  Phleboliths project over the
pelvis.  There is lateral bowing of the bilateral femora, of doubtful clinical
significance.

【0】INDICATION:  ___ year old woman with worsening arthritic pain// assess anatomy

【1】COMPARISON:  Radiographs from ___

【2】IMPRESSION: 

【3】No acute fractures or dislocations are seen. There is some irregularity of the
fifth middle phalanx which may relate to prior old trauma. There are
degenerative changes worse of the fifth DIP, third PIP, first IP, and first
CMC joints.  There is normal osseous mineralization.  There are no bony
erosions.

【0】EXAMINATION:  CT ABDOMEN

【1】INDICATION:  ___ year old man s/p liver transplant c/b hepatic abscess and has
3 biliary catheters in place and LFTs that are rising. Hepatic abscess
recently fell out and there is some drainage from his old drain site.// please
perform a CT scan of the liver to assess for resolution of hepatic abscess

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Multiphasic Liver: Multidetector CT of the abdomen was done
without and with IV contrast. Initially, the abdomen was scanned without IV
contrast. Subsequently, a single bolus of IV contrast was injected and the
abdomen was scanned in the early arterial phase, followed by a scan of the
abdomen in the portal venous phase, followed by a scan of the abdomen in
equilibrium phase (3-min delay).
Oral contrast was not administered.
Coronal and sagittal reformations were performed and reviewed on PACS.

【3】DOSE:  Acquisition sequence:
   1) Spiral Acquisition 7.5 s, 28.8 cm; CTDIvol = 4.6 mGy (Body) DLP = 126.2
mGy-cm.
   2) Stationary Acquisition 0.5 s, 1.0 cm; CTDIvol = 1.2 mGy (Body) DLP = 1.2
mGy-cm.
   3) Stationary Acquisition 6.0 s, 1.0 cm; CTDIvol = 13.9 mGy (Body) DLP =
13.9 mGy-cm.
   4) Spiral Acquisition 7.5 s, 28.8 cm; CTDIvol = 10.6 mGy (Body) DLP = 287.3
mGy-cm.
   5) Spiral Acquisition 7.5 s, 28.8 cm; CTDIvol = 10.5 mGy (Body) DLP = 284.2
mGy-cm.
   6) Spiral Acquisition 7.5 s, 28.8 cm; CTDIvol = 10.4 mGy (Body) DLP = 282.2
mGy-cm.
 Total DLP (Body) = 1,007 mGy-cm.

【4】COMPARISON:  CT dated ___

【5】FINDINGS: 

【6】LOWER CHEST: There is minimal subsegmental atelectasis in the right lower
lobe.  There is no pleural effusion.  Small pericardial effusion is unchanged

【7】ABDOMEN: Note is again made of a liver transplant.  Left hepatic lobe is again
noted to be atrophic.  The previously seen percutaneous transhepatic biliary
drainage catheters in the a right posterior biliary duct and left lateral
biliary duct have been removed in the interval.  A percutaneous biliary
catheter in the right anterior duct has been pulled back with the tip in the
proximal right anterior duct.  There is worsened mild intrahepatic biliary
duct dilatation.  There is an ill-defined heterogeneous gas containing
collection in the left lateral segment measuring 2.3 x 4.6 cm, previously 1.5
x 3.8 cm.  Left hepatic bile ducts surrounding this collection are slightly
more dilated compared to the prior study.

【8】There are ill-defined areas of heterogeneous arterial enhancement in the
periphery of the left lobe and right anterior segments of the liver which
become isointense to background parenchyma in the portal venous and delayed
phases and most likely represent transient hepatic attenuation differences. 
Defined 2 cm hypodensity in the periphery of the right anterior lobe (series
9, image 51) was not seen on the prior study and may represent an area of
early phlegmonous change.

【9】A stent is again noted in the main portal vein which remains patent.  The left
portal vein is again not seen and likely occluded.  Right portal vein branch
remains patent. Left hepatic vein is not seen and likely chronically occluded.
Right hepatic vein is attenuated in caliber but remains patent.

【10】The spleen is enlarged measuring 15 cm in craniocaudal length.  There is no
focal splenic lesion.

【11】10 mm right adrenal nodule is unchanged.  Left adrenal gland is unremarkable.

【12】The kidneys and pancreas are unremarkable.

【13】GASTROINTESTINAL: There is no bowel obstruction. There is no ascites.

【14】LYMPH NODES: There is no retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy.

【15】VASCULAR:  The proper hepatic artery and intrahepatic arterial branches are
attenuated caliber and not well seen.  Remainder of the celiac branches and
SMA are normal in caliber and patent.  Only the right hepatic vein is seen and
is patent.
Portal vein stent is patent.  SMV and splenic vein are patent.  There are
mildly dilated venous collaterals in the left upper quadrant.

【16】SOFT TISSUES: Multiple tracts are noted in the anterior and right lateral body
wall at the site of prior biliary catheter insertion.  There is no soft tissue
abscess.

【17】IMPRESSION:

【18】1. Interval removal of the left and right posterior biliary drainage
catheters.  Right anterior duct catheter has been pulled back with the tip now
located in the proximally within the right anterior hepatic duct.  There is
new mild intrahepatic biliary duct dilatation.
2. Slight interval increase in size of the heterogeneous gas containing
collection in the left lobe now measuring 2.3 x 4.6 cm.
3. New poorly defined hypodensity in the periphery of the right anterior
segment head represent an area of early phlegmonous changes.

【0】INDICATION: ___ y/o male with left groin/abdominal pain. Evaluate for abd
abscess or diverticulitis.  

【1】COMPARISONS: None available. 

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Axial helical MDCT images were obtained from the bases of the
lungs to the pubic symphysis after the administration of IV and oral contrast.
Multiplanar reformatted images in coronal and sagittal axes were generated.

【3】FINDINGS: The bases of the lungs are clear. The visualized heart and
pericardium are unremarkable.

【4】CT ABDOMEN:  The liver enhances homogeneously, without focal lesions or
intrahepatic biliary duct dilatation. The gallbladder is unremarkable and the
portal vein is patent. The pancreas, spleen and adrenals are unremarkable. 
The kidneys do not show solid or cystic lesions and present symmetric
nephrograms and excretion of contrast. 

【5】The stomach, small bowel and colon are within normal limits without evidence
of wall thickening or obstruction. The appendix is visualized and is not
inflammed.  The intra-abdominal vasculature is unremarkable.  There is no
retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymph node enlargement by CT size criteria.  No
ascites, free air or abdominal wall hernias are noted.

【6】PELVIC CT: The urinary bladder and terminal ureters are normal. There is no
ureteral dilatation concerning for nephrolithiasis. The prostate is not
enlarged. No pelvic wall or inguinal lymph node enlargement is seen. There is
no pelvic free fluid.

【7】OSSEOUS STRUCTURES:  No blastic or lytic lesion suspicious for malignancy are
present. 

【8】Coronal and sagittal images were reviewed confirming the axial findings.

【9】IMPRESSION: Unremarkable abdomen and pelvis CT. No evidence of diverticulitis
or appendicitis.

【10】DLP:  480.85 mGy-cm

【5】The stomach, small bowel and colon are within normal limits without evidence
of wall thickening or obstruction. The appendix is visualized and is not
inflammed.  The intra-abdominal vasculature is unremarkable.  There is no
retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymph node enlargement by CT size criteria.  No
ascites, free air or abdominal wall hernias are noted.

【6】PELVIC CT: The urinary bladder and terminal ureters are normal. There is no
ureteral dilatation concerning for nephrolithiasis. The prostate is not
enlarged. No pelvic wall or inguinal lymph node enlargement is seen. There is
no pelvic free fluid.

【7】OSSEOUS STRUCTURES:  No blastic or lytic lesion suspicious for malignancy are
present. 

【8】Coronal and sagittal images were reviewed confirming the axial findings.

【9】IMPRESSION: Unremarkable abdomen and pelvis CT. No evidence of diverticulitis
or appendicitis.

【10】DLP:  480.85 mGy-cm

source_info.text:
【0】EXAMINATION:  CT C-SPINE W/O CONTRAST

【1】INDICATION:  ___ with posterior midline neck tenderness after fall onto
occiput.

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Contiguous axial images were obtained.  Sagittal and coronal
reformatted images were generated.  No contrast was administered.
DLP:  738 mGy-cm
CTDIvol:  36 mGy

【3】COMPARISON:  Soft tissue neck CT ___

【4】FINDINGS: 

【5】Alignment is normal.  There is no evidence for a fracture or prevertebral
edema.  There is no evidence of spinal canal or neural foraminal narrowing. 
Visualized lung apices are clear. There is a poorly defined nodule or
conglomerate nodules in the left thyroid lobe, new compared to the ___ soft tissue neck CT, spanning approximately 3.4 cm craniocaudad and 2.2
cm transverse.

【6】IMPRESSION:

【7】1. No fracture or subluxation.
2. Large left thyroid nodule or conglomerate nodules, new compared to ___. Malignancy cannot be excluded.

【8】RECOMMENDATION(S):  Thyroid sonography is recommended, if not previously
performed elsewhere.

【9】NOTIFICATION:  Findings and recommendations regarding the thyroid gland were
emailed by Dr. ___ to the ___ QA nurses list at 11:13 on ___, as
this information was not included in the preliminary report.

【0】EXAMINATION:  CHEST (PORTABLE AP)

【1】INDICATION:  ___ year old man with esophageal tear intubated at OSH  // eval
ETT placed at OSH      eval ETT placed at OSH

【2】IMPRESSION: 

【3】In comparison with the study of ___, there is little overall change. 
The tip of the endotracheal tube lies approximately 5 cm above the carina.
Cardiac silhouette remains at the upper limits of normal or mildly enlarged
and there is no evidence of appreciable vascular congestion.  Elevation of the
left hemidiaphragmatic contour is again seen with retrocardiac opacification,
consistent with volume loss in left lower lobe and pleural effusion.
No evidence of acute focal pneumonia.

【0】EXAMINATION:  LIVER OR GALLBLADDER US (SINGLE ORGAN)

【1】INDICATION:  ___ EtOH cirrhosis, s/p liver transplant ___ c/b ___ MI;
admitted for hypoglycemia, course complicated by resp distress ___ dCHF s/p
CABG ___ w/ mild acute cellular rejection treated with steroids last week
with persistent elevated alk phos // assess vasculature and biliary system

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Grey scale, color and spectral Doppler ultrasound images of the
abdomen were obtained.

【3】COMPARISON:  Abdominal ultrasound ___

【4】FINDINGS: 

【5】Liver echotexture is normal. There is no evidence of focal liver lesions or
biliary dilatation. The common hepatic duct measures 0.2 cm.  The pancreatic
duct is slightly prominent, measuring up to 3 mm.  No adjacent parenchymal
abnormalities are identified on the limited images of the pancreatic head. 
There is a left pleural effusion.  Trace perinephric free fluid is also noted
around the right kidney.

【6】The spleen measures 11.9 cm and has normal echotexture.

【7】DOPPLER: The main hepatic arterial waveform is within normal limits, with
prompt systolic upstrokes and continuous antegrade diastolic flow. Peak
systolic velocity in the main hepatic artery measures up to 150 cm/sec. 
Appropriate arterial waveforms are seen in the right hepatic artery and the
left hepatic artery with resistive indices of 0.61, and 0.7, respectively. The
main portal vein and the right and left portal veins are patent with
hepatopetal flow and normal waveform. Appropriate flow is seen in the hepatic
veins and the IVC.

【8】IMPRESSION:

【9】1. Patent hepatic vasculature with appropriate waveforms.
2. No intrahepatic or extrahepatic biliary dilatation.
3. Left pleural effusion.

【0】INDICATION:  ___ man with history of esophageal cancer.

【1】COMPARISON:  ___.

【2】FRONTAL AND LATERAL CHEST RADIOGRAPHS:  The right subclavian central venous
line terminates in unchanged position.  Clips again are seen overlying the
mediastinum.  The cardiomediastinal silhouette is within normal limits.  The
pulmonary vasculature is normal.  There is mild improvement in bibasilar
atelectasis and a small right-sided pleural effusion.  The left-sided pleural
effusion has now resolved.

【3】IMPRESSION:  Resolving bibasilar atelectasis and resolved left-sided pleural
effusion.

【0】RIGHT KNEE, THREE VIEWS

【1】INDICATION:  ___ woman with right knee pain after fall.

【2】FINDINGS:  No acute fracture or dislocation is seen.  No lucent or sclerotic
lesion is noted.  No joint effusion is seen.  Mild degenerative change of the
right knee is noted including patellofemoral and medial compartment spurring.

【3】IMPRESSION:

【4】Mild degenerative changes of the right knee.

【0】EXAMINATION:  DUPLEX DOPP ABD/PEL

【1】INDICATION:  eval for TIPS patency, PVT, or cholecystitis

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Gray scale, color, and spectral Doppler evaluation of the abdomen
was performed.

【3】COMPARISON:  Abdominal ultrasound ___ and CT abdomen and pelvis ___.

【4】FINDINGS: 

【5】Liver:  The hepatic parenchyma is coarsened and nodular.  An echogenic lesion
in the left hepatic lobe measuring up to 0.8 cm was seen on the recent
abdominal ultrasound, but without definite correlate on CT.  There is no
ascites.
Bile ducts:  There is no intrahepatic biliary ductal dilation.  The common
hepatic duct measures 7 mm.
Gallbladder:  The gallbladder is distended and contains sludge.  There is
gallbladder wall edema, with the wall measuring up to 5 mm.
Pancreas:  The head, body and tail of the pancreas appear within normal
limits.
Spleen:  The spleen demonstrates normal echotexture, and measures 15.9 cm.
Kidneys:  The right kidney measures 9.8 cm.  No hydronephrosis.

【6】Doppler evaluation:

【7】The main portal vein is patent, with flow in the appropriate direction.
Main portal vein velocity is 39 cm/sec.
The left portal vein and right anterior portal veins are not well seen,
possibly related to technical factors.  The right posterior portal vein
demonstrates flow in the direction of the TIPS.

【8】The TIPS is patent throughout with wall to wall flow in the appropriate
direction.  Velocity in the proximal TIPS is 65 centimeters/second.  Velocity
in the mid TIPS is 117 centimeters/second.  Velocity in the distal TIPS is 106
centimeters/second.

【9】Right, middle and left hepatic veins are patent, with appropriate waveforms.

【10】IMPRESSION:

【11】1. Patent TIPS.
2. The right anterior and left portal veins are not well seen.  ___ be related
to technical factors.  If there is high clinical concern for portal vein
thrombus, a multiphasic liver CT could be obtained.
3. Distended gallbladder with sludge and gallbladder wall edema.  Wall edema
may be seen in the setting of cirrhosis, however correlation with clinical
examination is recommended to evaluate for signs of acute cholecystitis.
4. Cirrhotic liver with splenomegaly in keeping with portal hypertension.
5. Echogenic focus in the left hepatic lobe was described on the recent
abdominal ultrasound, possibly reflecting a hemangioma.  Attention on
follow-up imaging is recommended.

【0】EXAMINATION:  BILATERAL BREAST ULTRASOUND

【1】INDICATION:  Recent diagnosis of left breast cancer. Bilateral MRI showed
prominent left axillary lymph node an probable intramammary node in the far
lateral right breast.  Targeted ultrasound recommended for further evaluation.

【2】COMPARISON:  Breast MRI from ___.

【3】TECHNIQUE:  Targeted ultrasound of the left axilla and right lateral
breast/axilla was performed targeted to the areas of MR abnormalities.
Selected images were obtained.

【4】FINDINGS: 

【5】Ultrasound of the left axilla demonstrates multiple sonographically normal
lymph nodes. However, there is 1 lymph node that measures 12 x 8 x 12 mm and
has mild focal cortical thickening measuring up to 4.9 mm.  This lymph node is
felt to account for the abnormal lymph node seen on MRI.

【6】Ultrasound of the right far lateral breast/low axilla demonstrates an 11 x 3
by 5 mm lymph node with normal cortex and normal vascular echogenic hilum.
This is felt to account for the lesion questioned on MRI on the right. This is
located at 9 o'clock 14 cm from the nipple.  No worrisome cystic or solid mass
is seen on the right.

【7】IMPRESSION: 

【8】1.  Single left axillary lymph node with focal cortical thickening of 4.9 mm,
corresponding to area seen on MRI in the left axilla.
2. Normal right intramammary/ low axillary lymph node at 9 o'clock 14 cm from
the nipple, corresponding to area questioned on MRI on the right.

【9】RECOMMENDATION:  Fine needle aspiration of a left axillary lymph node with
focal cortical thickening.

【10】NOTIFICATION:  Findings reviewed with the patient at the completion of the
study.  Intervention was scheduled for later today. Dr. ___ notified as she
is scheduled to see the patient later today.

【11】BI-RADS:  4A Suspicious - low suspicion for malignancy.

source_info.text:
【0】HISTORY:  Right weakness beginning at 02:30.  

【1】COMPARISON:  Head CT from ___. 

【2】TECHNIQUE: Axial CT images were acquired through the head without intravenous
contrast.  Thereafter, images were acquired through the head and neck
following the uneventful intravenous administration of iodine based contrast. 
Multiplanar reformatted images including maximum intensity projection images
and dedicated 3 dimensional angiographic reconstructions were created.  CT
perfusion imaging is also performed.  

【3】CT HEAD: There is no intracranial hemorrhage, edema, mass effect or vascular
territorial infarction.  Ventricles and sulci are normal in size and
configuration.  There is a punctate focus of mineralization noted in the left
centrum semiovale (series 2, image 22).  There is mild mucosal thickening
inferiorly in the maxillary sinuses bilaterally.   Note is made of torus
mandibularis.

【4】CT ANGIOGRAM NECK: The aorta demonstrates a normal 3 vessel branching pattern.
The origins and courses of the vertebral arteries, common carotid arteries and
internal carotid arteries are normal.  Overall there are no luminal caliber
irregularities to suggest thromboembolic filling defects, dissection or
pseudoaneurysm. 

【5】Imaged portions of the lung apices are clear as are image soft tissue
structures of the neck.  Bony structures reveal no suspicious sclerotic or
lytic lesion.  Note is however made of mineralization of the ligamentum flavum
in the imaged portions of the upper thoracic and lower cervical spine.  

【6】CT ANGIOGRAM HEAD: Primary intracranial arterial structures demonstrate
appropriate contrast opacification.  Anatomy is conventional in orientation. 
There are no luminal caliber irregularities to suggest thromboembolic filling
defect, dissection or aneurysm. 

【7】CT PERFUSION HEAD:  Mean transit time, relative cerebral blood flow and
relative cerebral blood volume maps are all normal.  Specifically there is no
evidence of focal perfusion all abnormality.  

【8】IMPRESSION:
1. No acute intracranial abnormality, including no intracranial hemorrhage.  
2.  No occlusive thromboembolic arterial filling defect and no focal cerebral
perfusion all abnormality.  Note that if concern persists for ischemia /
infarction, MRI is the more sensitive modality for evaluation.

source_info.text:
【0】REASON FOR EXAM:  ___ woman with pericardial cyst, status post VATS
resection.

【1】TECHNIQUE:  Multi-detector helical scanning of the chest was obtained from
thoracic inlet to upper abdomen in supine position without administration of
IV contrast.  Axial images were reviewed in conjunction with coronal, sagittal
reformats and MIPs projections.

【2】RADIATION DOSE:  The total dose length product (DLP) is 343.30 mGy-cm.

【3】COMPARISON:  Exam is compared with chest CT of ___.

【4】FINDINGS:  The thyroid is unremarkable.  There is no peripheral or central
lymphadenopathy.  Great vessels have normal size.  Heart size is normal. 
There is no pericardial effusion.

【5】There is no pleural effusion.

【6】Event though this exam is not tailored for abdominal imaging, the upper
abdomen is unremarkable.

【7】BONES:  There are no bone lesions suspicious for malignancy or infection.

【8】LUNGS AND AIRWAYS:  Airways are patent to the subsegmental level bilaterally. 
Moderate biapical pleural parenchymal scarring is unchanged since ___.  6 mm right upper lobe ground-glass opacity (4:77), 9 mm left lower lobe
ground-glass opacity (4:154) are unchanged since ___.  Followup in
one year is recommended for this ground-glass lesion to rule out minimally
invasive adenocarcinoma.  The remainder of punctate mostly subpleural nodules
are unchanged since ___, and not concerning for malignancy (series
4: image 81, 82, 84, 101, 122, 147, 181).  Two lower lobe granulomas (4:163,
167) are unchanged since ___. Patients has had VATS resection of
left pericardial cyst, there is no evidence of lung scarring at the site of
surgery.

【9】IMPRESSION:
1. Patients has had VATS resection of left pericardial cyst, there is no
evidence of lung scarring at the site of surgery.
2.Two smaller than 1 cm ground-glass opacities in the right upper lobe and
left lower lobe are unchanged since ___.  These two ground-glass
opacities warrant followup in one year to assess interval changes to rule out
minimally invasive adenocarcinoma.
3.  All remainder punctate, mostly subpleural, lung nodules are unchanged
since ___ and not concerning for malignancy.

【0】PA AND LATERAL VIEWS OF THE CHEST

【1】REASON FOR EXAM:  Patient with fever status post auto transplant.

【2】There is mild cardiomegaly.  Right subclavian catheter tip is in the mid SVC. 
There is no pneumothorax or pleural effusion.  There is no evidence of
pneumonia.  The patient has known enlargement of the main pulmonary artery
suggestive of pulmonary hypertension.

【0】EXAMINATION:  CT SINUS W/O CONTRAST FOR SURGICAL PLANNING

【1】INDICATION:  ___ woman with probable right posterior etmoid air cell
mucocele which has gradually increased in size over a long period of time. 
Evaluate the posterior etmoid air cell mucocele for interval change.

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Helical axial images were acquired through the paranasal sinuses. 
Bone and soft tissue reconstructed images were generated.  Coronal and
sagittal reformatted images were also obtained.

【3】DOSE:  DLP:  664  mGy-cm; CTDI:  33 mGy

【4】COMPARISON:  MR orbit with contrast dated ___.
CT head dated ___.

【5】FINDINGS: 

【6】Post-surgical changes consistent with prior bilateral uncinectomies and
antrostomies are demonstrated.

【7】An opacity of soft tissue density occupying and expanding the right posterior
ethmoidal air cell, previously characterized on MRI as a mucocele, is overall
unchanged in size since ___ but appears to exhibit interval increased
hyperdense signal.  This hyperdense opacity enters into the right optic strut
(Series 6, Image 31).  There is indistinctness of the overlying superior as
well as lateral margin of affected right posterior ethmoidal sinus, suggesting
bony dehiscence, better seen on today's exam but overall stable from ___
(Series 8; Images 87-88).  There is compression and narrowing of the right
sphenoid recess by the hyperdense opacity. Associated bilateral dependent
aerosolized secretions in the sphenoid sinuses are slightly increased since
___.

【8】The frontal sinuses and maxillary sinuses are normally aerated, with no
mucosal thickening or air-fluid levels identified.  Bilateral neoostium are
patent. The cribriform plates are intact. There is no nasal septal defect. The
anterior clinoid processes are not pneumatized.  The posterior right lamina
papyracea is indistinct, as denoted above, suggesting dehiscence.  The left
lamina papyracea is intact. The nasal septum is essentially midline. The
sphenoid sinus septum is not midline with insertion upon the right posterior
clinoid process-dorsum sellae.

【9】IMPRESSION: 

【10】1.  Stable size of lesion in right posterior ethmoid air cell characterized on
MR as ___ mucocele.

【11】2.  Slight interval increase in CT density of the right posterior ethmoid air
cell mucocele.

【12】3.  Stable dehiscence of the superior and lateral margins of the right
posterior ethmoid air cell by the mucocele.

【13】4.  Slight interval increase in bilateral aerosolized sphenoid sinus
secretions.
