【0】INDICATION:  Shortness of breath.  Assess for pneumothorax or pneumonia.

【1】COMPARISON:  None.

【2】FINDINGS:  Frontal and lateral radiograph of the chest were acquired.  The
lungs are clear.  The heart size is normal.  The mediastinal contours are
normal.  There are no pleural effusions.  No pneumothorax is seen.

【3】IMPRESSION:  No acute cardiac or pulmonary process.

【0】CHEST, TWO VIEWS: ___.

【1】HISTORY:  ___ male with chest pain.

【2】FINDINGS:  Frontal and lateral views of the chest were compared to previous
exam from ___.  When compared to prior, there has been no
significant interval change.  Again seen is a right lung base opacity
localizing to the lower lobe on the lateral exam.  Elsewhere, the lungs remain
clear.  Pleural thickening versus prominent extrapleural fat seen laterally on
the right as well as regions of calcified pleura.  There is no pleural
effusion.  Cardiac silhouette is enlarged but stable.  Dual-lead pacing device
again noted as well as postoperative changes from median sternotomy.  Osseous
and soft tissue structures are unremarkable.

【3】IMPRESSION:  Persistent right basilar opacity, for which clinical correlation
is recommended regarding possibility of infection versus atelectasis.

【0】EXAMINATION:  CHEST (AP AND LAT)

【1】INDICATION:  History: ___ with hypoxia, etoh// ?cpd

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Upright AP and lateral views of the chest

【3】COMPARISON:  Chest radiograph ___, CTA torso ___

【4】FINDINGS: 

【5】Heart size is normal.  The aorta remains tortuous.  The thoracic aorta,
particularly the ascending aorta and aortic arch remains dilated, similar to
the prior exams, with multiple mediastinal clips again noted compatible with
prior coronary artery bypass and ascending aortic repair.  Hilar contours are
similar.  Lungs are hyperinflated without focal consolidation.  Mild airway
wall thickening is seen within the right upper and lower lobes, likely
reflective of known bronchiectasis and airway inflammation.  No pleural
effusion or pneumothorax is detected.  Multiple clips project over the right
clavicular region.  No acute osseous abnormality is visualized.

【6】IMPRESSION: 

【7】Unchanged dilatation of the ascending aorta and aortic arch status post
ascending aortic repair for prior aortic dissection.  Hyperinflated lungs
compatible with COPD/emphysema.  Mild airway wall thickening and
bronchiectasis in the right lung.

【0】EXAMINATION:  CTA CHEST AND CT ABDOMEN AND PELVIS

【1】INDICATION:  History: ___ with hypotension, hypoxia, history of malignancy. 
Evaluation for pulmonary embolism.

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Axial multidetector CT images were obtained through the thorax
after the uneventful administration of intravenous contrast in the arterial
phase.  Then, imaging was obtained through the abdomen and pelvis in the
portal venous phase. Reformatted coronal and sagittal images through the
chest, abdomen, and pelvis, and oblique maximal intensity projection images of
the chest were submitted to PACS and reviewed.

【3】DOSE:  Total DLP (Body) = 1,096 mGy-cm.

【4】COMPARISON:  Comparison to MRCP from ___.  Comparison to CT torso
performed at outside hospital from ___.

【5】FINDINGS: 

【6】CHEST:
HEART AND VASCULATURE: Study is moderately limited in the setting of motion
artifact.  Within these limitations, the pulmonary vasculature appears well
opacified to the subsegmental level without filling defect to indicate a
pulmonary embolus.  The thoracic aorta is normal in caliber without evidence
of dissection or intramural hematoma.  Minimal atherosclerotic calcification
along the aortic arch and descending thoracic aorta.  The heart, pericardium,
and great vessels are within normal limits.  Mild coronary artery
calcifications.  Trace pericardial effusion is seen.

【7】AXILLA, HILA, AND MEDIASTINUM: Mildly enlarged right lower paratracheal lymph
node measuring 1.3 cm (4:73).  Mildly enlarged right hilar lymph node measures
1.4 cm (4:92).  No axillary lymphadenopathy is present.

【8】PLEURAL SPACES: No pleural effusion or pneumothorax.

【9】LUNGS/AIRWAYS: Mild bibasilar atelectasis.  Patient is status post right upper
lobectomy.  Residual soft tissue seen at the right hilum is indeterminately
characterized, though likely postsurgical.  Lungs are otherwise clear without
masses or areas of parenchymal opacification.  The airways are patent to the
level of the segmental bronchi bilaterally.

【10】BASE OF NECK: A mildly enlarged thyroid contains few calcifications in the
left thyroid lobe.

【11】ABDOMEN:
HEPATOBILIARY: The liver demonstrates homogenous attenuation throughout. 
Multiple subtle hypodensities are seen within the liver, including a 2.0 cm
hypodensity with central hyperattenuation near the hepatic dome (05:14), a
large hypodense lesion within the left hepatic lobe measuring up to 9.3 cm
(05:21), and few peripheral lesions measuring up to 4.8 cm and 3.5 cm within
the right lobe (05:21, 05:30), findings concerning for possible metastases. 
These do not have significant mass effect upon vessels or cause bile duct
dilation.  There is no evidence of intrahepatic or extrahepatic biliary
dilatation.  The gallbladder is within normal limits.

【12】PANCREAS: The pancreas has normal attenuation throughout, without evidence of
focal lesions or pancreatic ductal dilatation. There is no peripancreatic
stranding.

【13】SPLEEN: Multiple hypodense lesions are seen scattered throughout the spleen,
with the largest near the hilum measuring up to 2.4 cm (05:20), concerning for
metastases.  The spleen shows normal size.

【14】ADRENALS:  The right and left adrenal glands are normal in size and shape.

【15】URINARY: The kidneys are of normal and symmetric size with normal nephrogram. 
There is a 4.5 cm simple cyst at the left lower renal pole and a 3.0 cm simple
cyst at the right upper pole.  Multiple additional subcentimeter hypodensities
are too small to characterize, though likely compatible with simple renal
cysts.  There is no evidence of focal renal lesions or hydronephrosis. There
is no perinephric abnormality.

【16】GASTROINTESTINAL: The stomach is unremarkable.  Small bowel loops demonstrate
normal caliber, wall thickness, and enhancement throughout.  The colon and
rectum are within normal limits.  The appendix is not visualized, however no
secondary signs of inflammation in the right lower quadrant.  There is no free
intraperitoneal fluid or free air.

【17】PELVIS:
The urinary bladder and distal ureters are unremarkable.  There is trace free
fluid in the pelvis.

【18】REPRODUCTIVE ORGANS: Patient is status post prostatectomy.

【19】LYMPH NODES: There is no retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy.  There
is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.

【20】VASCULAR: There is no abdominal aortic aneurysm.  Mild atherosclerotic disease
is noted.

【21】BONES AND SOFT TISSUES: There is no evidence of worrisome osseous lesions or
acute fracture.  Moderate multilevel degenerative change of the thoracolumbar
spine.  The abdominal and pelvic wall is within normal limits.

【22】IMPRESSION:

【23】1. Study is moderately limited in the setting of motion artifact.  Within
these limitations, no evidence of pulmonary embolism or acute aortic
abnormality.
2. Multiple subtle homogeneous hypodensities within the liver and spleen, are
most likely from lymphoma given their appearance and lack of mass
effect/obstruction in the liver.
3. Status post right upper lobectomy, with residual soft tissue seen at the
right hilum which is indeterminately characterized, though most likely
postsurgical.
4. Mildly enlarged right lower paratracheal lymph node and right hilar lymph
node.

【0】INDICATION:  History: ___ with fall.

【1】TECHNIQUE:  Three views of the left knee.

【2】COMPARISON:  None.

【3】FINDINGS: 

【4】No acute fracture or dislocation is identified. No significant degenerative
changes are present.  No joint effusion is seen.  No soft tissue
calcifications are identified. There are no concerning lytic or sclerotic
osseous lesions.

【5】IMPRESSION: 

【6】No acute fracture or dislocation.

【0】ULTRASOUND-GUIDED PERCUTANEOUS TRANSHEPATIC CHOLECYSTOTOMY

【1】INDICATION:  Severe COPD, CHF, here with RUQ pain and ACS suspects possible
cholecystitis 

【2】PHYSICIANS:  Dr ___, Dr ___

【3】Dr. ___ attending radiologist, was present throughout the critical
portions of the procedure.

【4】PROCEDURE:  

【5】The procedure, risks, benefits and alternatives were discussed with the
patient and written informed consent was obtained.  

【6】The gallbladder was imaged and a planned tract was marked. 

【7】A preprocedure timeout was performed discussing the planned procedure,
confirming the patient's identity with three identifiers, and reviewing a
checklist per ___ protocol.

【8】The skin was prepped and draped in the usual sterile fashion.  Under
ultrasound guideance 1% lidocaine was instilled for local anesthesia.

【9】An 8fr pigtail ___ catheter was advanced into the gallbladder and 70cc
sanguinous bile was removed. The drain was secured to the skin with a
Stat-Lock device.

【10】The patient tolerated the procedure well without immediate complication. 
Estimated blood loss was minimal.  Sample sent for C&S.

【11】Moderate sedation was provided by administering divided doses of Versed and
fentanyl throughout the total intra-service time of 15 minutes during which
the patient's hemodynamic parameters were continuously monitored by radiology
nursing personnel.

【12】IMPRESSION:

【13】1. Ultrasound-guided therapeutic percutaneous gallbladder drainage with
removal of  70cc sanguinous bile, completely emptying the GB lumen. 8fr drain
in place. No complications.
2. Prescence of sanguinous bile is consistent with hemorrhagic cholecystitis.

【0】HISTORY:  ___ male with left arm weakness, on heparin for recent
emboli which had initially caused left arm clumsiness.  Here to assess for
intracranial hemorrhage.

【1】COMPARISON:  CT head, most recently of ___ and MRI brain of ___.

【2】TECHNIQUE:  MDCT axial imaging was performed through the brain without
administration of IV contrast.

【3】NON-CONTRAST HEAD CT:  Encephalomalacic changes are again noted in the right
superior frontal lobe.  Punctate foci of presumed embolic infarct in the right
parietal and temporal lobes seen on MRI one day prior are too small to
visualize by CT. Otherwise, no evidence of acute intracranial hemorrhage, new
area of edema, mass effect, hydrocephalus, or acute large vascular territory
infarction is seen.  Minimal stranding in the scalp along the right vertex is
unchanged.  The orbits and skull appear unremarkable.  The visualized
paranasal sinuses and mastoid air cells remain well aerated.  Vascular
calcifications are noted along the carotid siphons and vertebral arteries
bilaterally.

【4】IMPRESSION:  No acute intracranial hemorrhage.  Unchanged CT exam.

【0】EXAMINATION:  CT HEAD W/O CONTRAST Q111 CT HEAD.

【1】INDICATION:  ___ hx CAD s/p CABG and PCI, HFrEF (35-40%) initially presented
with fall c/b SDH, triggered for hypoxia after CT scan and transferred to ICU
for hypoxic respiratory failure.  // increasing AMS, low grade fever, INR is
increasing (is on coumadin for PE) and latest 6.6 despite vitamin K - want to
r/o interval changes in CT / bleed.

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Contiguous axial images of the brain were obtained without
contrast.

【3】DOSE:  Acquisition sequence:
   1) Sequenced Acquisition 4.0 s, 16.0 cm; CTDIvol = 46.7 mGy (Head) DLP =
747.6 mGy-cm.
   2) Sequenced Acquisition 4.0 s, 2.0 cm; CTDIvol = 70.2 mGy (Head) DLP =
140.5 mGy-cm.
   3) Sequenced Acquisition 4.0 s, 2.0 cm; CTDIvol = 70.2 mGy (Head) DLP =
140.5 mGy-cm.
 Total DLP (Head) = 1,028 mGy-cm.

【4】COMPARISON:  Multiple prior CTs of the head, most recent ___.

【5】FINDINGS: 

【6】There is redemonstration of known resulting posttraumatic intraparenchymal
hematomas, that are essentially unchanged in size.  The previously described
subdural hematoma is resolving.  There are no new areas of hyperdensity to
suggest new hemorrhage.  There is no evidence of fracture, acute infarction,
worsening edema,mass or mass effect.  There is prominence of the ventricles
and sulci suggestive of involutional changes.

【7】Persistent opacification of the right posterior mastoid air cells.  The
visualized portion of the paranasal sinuses, and middle ear cavities are
clear.  The visualized portion of the orbits are normal, however the patient
is status post bilateral lens replacement.

【8】IMPRESSION:

【9】1. Little to no interval change in the known resolving intraparenchymal
hematomas.  No evidence of new areas of hemorrhage or infarction.
2. Resolving subdural hematoma.
3. Persistent opacification of the right posterior mastoid air cells as
described above.

【0】INDICATION:  Left shoulder pain.

【1】TECHNIQUE:  Left shoulder, 3 views.

【2】COMPARISON:  Left shoulder radiographs from ___ and ___.

【3】FINDINGS: 

【4】3 views of the left shoulder demonstrate a proximal humeral fracture with four
fixation screws.  The fracture line appears grossly unchanged compared to
prior radiograph.  There is no new fracture or dislocation.  No focal lytic or
sclerotic lesion is seen.

【5】IMPRESSION: 

【6】Fracture of the proximal left humerus status post ORIF with fixation screws,
without evidence of hardware related complication.

【0】INDICATION:  Nephrolithiasis.

【1】TECHNIQUE:  2 intraoperative fluoroscopic images were obtained without the
presence of the radiologist.

【2】Total fluoroscopic time: 0.03 min.

【3】COMPARISON:  Abdominal radiograph ___

【4】FINDINGS: 

【5】Intraoperative fluoroscopic radiographs demonstrate placement of a left
ureteral stent.  The known nephrolithiasis is not well visualized. For full
details, please see the operative note.

【0】REASON FOR EXAMINATION:  Evaluation of the patient with history of small cell
lung cancer after chemotherapy and radiation, assessment of disease response.

【1】COMPARISON:  ___ and ___.

【2】TECHNIQUE:  MDCT of the chest was obtained from thoracic inlet to upper
abdomen with subsequent 1.25- and 5-mm collimation axial images reviewed in
conjunction with coronal and sagittal reformats.

【3】FINDINGS:

【4】Since the prior study there is interval additional decrease in the right
paratracheal lymphadenopathy with the current ___ of 36.6 x 18.4 mm as
compared to 44 x 24.4 mm at the upper portion and 24 x 14.3 mm as compared to
19 x 30 mm at its portion.  There is also improved diameter of the right upper
lobe bronchus due to decreased peribronchial thickening.  The right subcarinal
lymph node has decreased in size as well.  Right hilar lymph node is currently
17 x 19 mm as compared to 20 x 22 mm.  Infrahilar lymph node, 2:28 is
currently 8.3 x 7.5 mm as compared to 12.8 x 11 mm.

【5】The right breast soft tissue appears to be decreased as well, from 45 x 33.5
mm to 41 x 24.5 mm.

【6】In right upper lobe, multifocal soft tissue opacities are redemonstrated with
also presence of interval decrease in size, for example at the level of the
apex from 50 x 22 mm to 45 x 15 mm, a nodule has decreased from 15 x 12.6 mm
to 9.3 x 8.3 mm.  Adjacent post-radiation changes appear to be decreased as
well.

【7】Minimal centrilobular nodules are noted in the upper lungs, decreased in size
since the prior examination.

【8】In the mediastinum no other lymph nodes are noted as well.  No lymph node in
the left hilus are present.  No axillary lymphadenopathy is seen.

【9】Liver, spleen, adrenals, pancreas, and imaged portion of the kidneys are
unremarkable.  Atherosclerotic changes of the aorta are present.

【10】Airways are patent to the subsegmental level bilaterally.

【11】No bone lesions worrisome for metastatic disease are definitely present. 
Compression fracture of T12 is noted, chronicity undetermined, moderate to
severe.  Since that was not demonstrated in ___ study is might be new
finding.  Extensive hemangioma in L1 is redemonstrated.

【12】IMPRESSION:
1.  Interval decrease in size of the bulk of the mediastinal lymphadenopathy,
right hilar lymphadenopathy as well as of the right upper lobe nodular lesions
and post-radiation changes.

【13】2.  New compression fracture of T12, but with no definitive presence of
metastatic involvement.

【14】3.  Decrease in size in the right breast mass, most likely consistent with
cyst aspiration, please review the dedicated study is obtained.

【0】EXAMINATION:  MRI CERVICAL, THORACIC, AND LUMBAR PT22 MR SPINE

【1】INDICATION:  *** CODE CORD *** History: ___ with known metastatic prostate
cancer to bone with L4-5 compression fx.  Evaluate for cord edema/compression
.

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Sagittal imaging was performed with T2, T1, and STIR technique. 
Axial T2 imaging was performed. Axial GRE images of the cervical spine were
performed.  After the uneventful administration of 7 mL of Gadavist contrast
agent, additional axial and sagittal T1 images were obtained.

【3】COMPARISON:  CT abdomen and pelvis from ___ and CTA chest from ___.

【4】FINDINGS: 

【5】CERVICAL:
There is 4 mm retrolisthesis of C4 on C5 and grade 1 (2 mm) anteroisthesis of
C7 on T1.  The alignment of the cervical spine is otherwise maintained.  The
vertebral body heights are maintained at all levels.  There are extensive
sclerotic and lytic osseous metastases involving all the cervical vertebral
bodies, likely from patient's prostate cancer.  The visualized cervical spinal
cord appears unremarkable.  No definite focal cord signal abnormality or cord
expansion is seen.

【6】The visualized posterior fossa structures appear unremarkable.  The
prevertebral, paravertebral and paraspinal soft tissues appear unremarkable.

【7】At C2-C3, bilateral neural foramen and spinal canal are patent.

【8】At C3-C4, there is central disc osteophyte complex with bilateral
uncovertebral and facet arthropathy causing mild bilateral
left-greater-than-right neural foraminal narrowing.  The spinal canal is
patent.

【9】At C4-C5, there is central disc osteophyte complex indenting the ventral
thecal sac.  Mild bilateral uncovertebral and facet arthropathy causing mild
bilateral neural foraminal narrowing.

【10】At C5-C6, there is central disc osteophyte complex indenting the ventral
thecal sac causing mild spinal canal stenosis.  Also seen is bilateral
uncovertebral and facet arthropathy causing mild-to-moderate bilateral neural
foramen narrowing.

【11】At C6-C7, there is central disc osteophyte complex indenting the ventral
thecal sac causing mild spinal canal stenosis.  Also seen is bilateral
uncovertebral and facet arthropathy causing moderate right and severe left
neural foraminal narrowing.

【12】At 7-T1, bilateral neural foramen and spinal canal are patent.

【13】THORACIC:
The alignment of the thoracic spine is maintained.  There is diffuse osseous
metastasis involving all the thoracic vertebral bodies, likely from patient's
known prostate cancer.  There is compression deformity along the superior
endplate of T1 vertebrae with minimal retropulsion of the osseous fragments. 
There is associated enhancing cortical expansion, highly suspicious for
underlying soft tissue lesion which mild spinal canal stenosis at that level.

【14】In the right anterior the epidural space spanning T4 through T7 is a subtle T2
hyperintense potentially enhancing focus measuring approximately 2 mm in
greatest thickness (series 4, image 9), which may represent prominent venous
structure versus epidural extension of soft tissue tumor.

【15】This is relatively unchanged compared to the prior CT from ___.

【16】The visualized thoracic spinal cord appears unremarkable without focal cord
signal abnormality or cord expansion within the confines of the pulsation
artifact.

【17】Partially visualized is large left-sided pleural effusion and small
right-sided pleural effusion.  The right-sided pleural effusion appears
increased compared to the prior CT chest.  The mediastinum appears grossly
unremarkable.

【18】There is loss of disc signal and height at multiple levels in keeping with
disc degeneration.  There is a central disc protrusion at T6-T7 indenting the
ventral thecal sac causing mild spinal canal stenosis.  Also seen is mild disc
bulge at T12-L1 indenting the ventral thecal sac.  There is mild-to-moderate
facet arthropathy at multiple levels.  Neural foramen however are patent at
all other levels.

【19】LUMBAR:
There 4 mm retrolisthesis of L3 on L4, 3 mm retrolisthesis of L4 on L5 and 3
mm anterolisthesis of L5 on S1.  The alignment of the lumbar spine is
otherwise maintained.  There is diffuse osseous metastasis involving all the
lumbar vertebrae from patient's known prostate cancer.  The vertebral body
heights are maintained.  The visualized lower spinal cord appears unremarkable
with the conus terminating at L1-L2.

【20】Partially visualized are multiple sub cm hepatic lesions which demonstrate
enhancement on postcontrast images and are new compared to the prior CT from
___ but partly visualized on the CTA chest from ___,
concerning for hepatic metastasis.  Further evaluation with dedicated imaging
can be performed as clinically indicated.

【21】Also seen is a 2.4 cm simple cyst in the interpolar region of right kidney
posteriorly.  There is another sub cm cyst in the right kidney.  There are
multiple septated perinephric cysts in the left kidney.

【22】There is mild congenital spinal stenosis.

【23】At T12-L1, there is mild disc bulge with bilateral facet arthropathy without
neural foramina or spinal canal stenosis.

【24】At L1-L2, there is broad-based disc bulge with bilateral facet arthropathy
causing mild bilateral neural foramen narrowing.  The spinal canal is patent.

【25】At L2-L3, there is broad-based disc bulge with bilateral facet arthropathy
causing mild right neural foramen narrowing.  The left neural foramen is
patent.  The disc bulge with epidural fat and ligamentum flavum thickening
contribute to moderate spinal canal stenosis.

【26】At L3-L4, there is broad-based disc bulge with bilateral facet arthropathy,
ligamentum flavum thickening and prominent epidural fat causing severe spinal
canal stenosis and moderate to severe bilateral neural foramen narrowing with
narrowing of bilateral lateral recesses impinging the traversing L4 nerve
roots.

【27】At L4-L5, there is broad-based disc bulge with bilateral facet arthropathy
causing indentation of ventral thecal sac without spinal canal stenosis.  Also
seen is moderate left and mild right neural foramen narrowing.

【28】At L5-S1, there is broad-based disc bulge with bilateral facet arthropathy
causing mild bilateral neural foraminal narrowing.  The spinal canal is
patent.

【29】IMPRESSION:

【30】1. Extensive osseous metastasis involving all the cervical, thoracic and
lumbar vertebral bodies with compression fracture along the superior endplate
of T1 with minimal retropulsion at that level causing mild spinal canal
stenosis.  There is enhancing cortical expansion of the posterior T1 vertebral
body compatible with pathologic fracture and underlying tumor.
2. There is a poorly defined 2 mm thick T2 hyperintense, potentially enhancing
right anterior epidural focus spanning the T4-T7 levels, which may represent
tumor versus prominent venous plexus.  Dedicated thoracic spine imaging could
be performed for high-resolution detail.
3. Multilevel multifactorial degenerative disease of the cervical spine, worst
at C6-C7 with moderate to severe bilateral neural foramen narrowing and mild
spinal canal stenosis as described above.
4. Mild degenerative disease involving the lower thoracic spine without neural
foramina or spinal canal stenosis at any level.
5. Multilevel multifactorial degenerative disease of the lumbar spine is most
prominent at L3-L4.  New there is severe spinal canal narrowing and severe
bilateral neural foraminal narrowing.  Additional changes as described above.
6. Large left and moderate right pleural effusion.  The right-sided pleural
effusion appears to have increased compared to the prior CT of the chest.
7. Incompletely evaluated multiple sub cm hepatic lesions, concerning for
hepatic metastasis.

text.text: (series 4, image 9),

There 4 mm retrolisthesis of L3 on L4, 3 mm retrolisthesis of L4 on L5 and 3

concerning for hepatic metastasis.  Further evaluation with dedicated imaging
can be performed as clinically indicated.

【21】Also seen is a 2.4 cm simple cyst in the interpolar region of right kidney
posteriorly.  There is another sub cm cyst in the right kidney.  There are
multiple septated perinephric cysts in the left kidney.

【22】There is mild congenital spinal stenosis.

【23】At T12-L1, there is mild disc bulge with bilateral facet arthropathy without
neural foramina or spinal canal stenosis.

【24】At L1-L2, there is broad-based disc bulge with bilateral facet arthropathy
causing mild bilateral neural foramen narrowing.  The spinal canal is patent.

【25】At L2-L3, there is broad-based disc bulge with bilateral facet arthropathy
causing mild right neural foramen narrowing.  The left neural foramen is
patent.  The disc bulge with epidural fat and ligamentum flavum thickening
contribute to moderate spinal canal stenosis.

【26】At L3-L4, there is broad-based disc bulge with bilateral facet arthropathy,
ligamentum flavum thickening and prominent epidural fat causing severe spinal
canal stenosis and moderate to severe bilateral neural foramen narrowing with
narrowing of bilateral lateral recesses impinging the traversing L4 nerve
roots.

【27】At L4-L5, there is broad-based disc bulge with bilateral facet arthropathy
causing indentation of ventral thecal sac without spinal canal stenosis.  Also
seen is moderate left and mild right neural foramen narrowing.

【28】At L5-S1, there is broad-based disc bulge with bilateral facet arthropathy
causing mild bilateral neural foraminal narrowing.  The spinal canal is
patent.

【29】IMPRESSION:

【30】1. Extensive osseous metastasis involving all the cervical, thoracic and
lumbar vertebral bodies with compression fracture along the superior endplate
of T1 with minimal retropulsion at that level causing mild spinal canal
stenosis.  There is enhancing cortical expansion of the posterior T1 vertebral
body compatible with pathologic fracture and underlying tumor.
2. There is a poorly defined 2 mm thick T2 hyperintense, potentially enhancing
right anterior epidural focus spanning the T4-T7 levels, which may represent
tumor versus prominent venous plexus.  Dedicated thoracic spine imaging could
be performed for high-resolution detail.
3. Multilevel multifactorial degenerative disease of the cervical spine, worst
at C6-C7 with moderate to severe bilateral neural foramen narrowing and mild
spinal canal stenosis as described above.
4. Mild degenerative disease involving the lower thoracic spine without neural
foramina or spinal canal stenosis at any level.
5. Multilevel multifactorial degenerative disease of the lumbar spine is most
prominent at L3-L4.  New there is severe spinal canal narrowing and severe
bilateral neural foraminal narrowing.  Additional changes as described above.
6. Large left and moderate right pleural effusion.  The right-sided pleural
effusion appears to have increased compared to the prior CT of the chest.
7. Incompletely evaluated multiple sub cm hepatic lesions, concerning for
hepatic metastasis.

【0】AP CHEST, 7:50 AM ON ___

【1】HISTORY:  Shortness of breath, question pneumonia or fluid overload.

【2】IMPRESSION:  AP chest compared to ___:

【3】1.  No change.  Moderate-to-severe left lower lobe consolidation, more likely
atelectasis than pneumonia.
2.  Small-to-moderate right pleural effusion layering posteriorly, unchanged.
3.  Heart size normal.  No pulmonary edema.
4.  Findings discussed with Dr. ___ by telephone at the time of this
dictation.

【0】INDICATION:  ___ year old woman with gastric ca s/p neodadjuvant  // baseline
before adjuvant treatment

【1】TECHNIQUE:  MDCT axial images were acquired through abdomen and pelvis
following intravenous contrast administration with split bolus technique.
Coronal and sagittal reformations were performed and submitted to PACS for
review.
Oral contrast was administered.

【2】DOSE:  DLP: 721 mGy-cm (chest, abdomen and pelvis.
IV Contrast:  100 mL Omnipaque

【3】COMPARISON:  None.

【4】FINDINGS:

【5】LOWER CHEST:

【6】Please refer to separate report of CT chest performed on the same day for
description of the thoracic findings.

【7】ABDOMEN:

【8】HEPATOBILIARY:  The liver demonstrates homogenous attenuation throughout. 
There is no evidence of focal lesions.  There is no evidence of intrahepatic
or extrahepatic biliary dilatation.  The gallbladder is within normal limits,
without stones or gallbladder wall thickening.
PANCREAS: The pancreas has normal attenuation throughout, without evidence of
focal lesions or pancreatic ductal dilatation.  There is no peripancreatic
stranding.
SPLEEN:  The spleen shows normal size and attenuation throughout, without
evidence of focal lesions.
ADRENALS:  The right and left adrenal glands are normal in size and shape.
URINARY: There is right-sided hydro nephrosis and there is a delayed
nephrogram on the right side.  The exact site of obstruction is difficult to
ascertain. However there is arguably soft tissue in the right mid ureter
(series 3, image 91, series 601b, image 25) .this hydronephrosis represents a
new finding.
GASTROINTESTINAL:  The patient is status post gastrojejunostomy.  There is
thickening of the efferent loop.  There is a feeding jejunostomy in situ. 
There is diffuse ascites.  Multifocal areas of apparent bowel wall thickening
are seen, nonspecific and on balance probably reflecting bowel collapsed. 
There is mild thickening of the peritoneum (series 3, image 81 )on the right
side for instance. Minimal nodularity is suggested in the left phrenico- colic
ligament (series 3, image 67) but there is no definitive no frank peritoneal
carcinomatosis or omental caking. There is a paucity of abdominal fat.
Appendix contains air, has normal caliber without evidence of fat stranding.
RETROPERITONEUM:  There is no evidence of retroperitoneal and mesenteric
lymphadenopathy.
VASCULAR:  There is no abdominal aortic aneurysm.  There is no calcium burden
in the abdominal aorta and great abdominal arteries.

【9】PELVIS:

【10】The urinary bladder and distal ureters are unremarkable.  There is no evidence
of pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.  There is no free fluid in the pelvis.
REPRODUCTIVE ORGANS: Reproductive organs are within normal limits

【11】BONES AND SOFT TISSUES:

【12】There is no evidence of worrisome lesions. Abdominal and pelvic wall is within
normal limits.

【13】IMPRESSION: 

【14】Interval development of significant ascites and also a right-sided
hydronephrosis.

【15】NOTIFICATION:   The impression above was entered by Dr. ___ on
___ at 10:28 into the Department of Radiology critical communications
system for direct communication to the referring provider.

source_info.text:
【0】CLINICAL INFORMATION:  ___ male with CHF with erythema and swelling of
the right foot.

【1】COMPARISON EXAM:  ___.

【2】TECHNIQUE AND FINDINGS:  There is normal response to augmentation,
compression, and normal color Doppler flow within the right common femoral,
superficial femoral and popliteal veins.  Normal color flow is seen within the
posterior tibial and peroneal veins of the right calf.  A normal respirophasic
waveform is seen in the bilateral common femoral veins.

【3】IMPRESSION:  No evidence of right lower extremity DVT.

【0】EXAM:  MRI brain.

【1】CLINICAL INFORMATION:  Patient with headaches.

【2】TECHNIQUE:  T1 sagittal and axial and FLAIR T2 susceptibility and diffusion
axial images of the brain were acquired before gadolinium.  T1 axial and
MP-RAGE sagittal images acquired following the administration of gadolinium. 
There are no prior similar examinations for comparison.

【3】FINDINGS:  There is no acute infarct identified.  There is no mass effect,
midline shift, or hydrocephalus.  A few scattered foci of T2 hyperintensity of
nonspecific nature are seen.  Otherwise, no significant focal abnormalities
are identified.  Following gadolinium, no evidence of abnormal parenchymal,
vascular, or meningeal enhancement seen.  The suprasellar and craniocervical
regions are unremarkable.

【4】IMPRESSION:  Except for a few tiny nonspecific foci of T2 hyperintensity, no
other significant abnormalities are seen on MRI of the brain with and without
gadolinium.  No mass effect, hydrocephalus, or midline shift seen.  No
enhancing lesions are identified.  No acute infarcts are noted.

【0】INDICATION:  ___ male status post motor vehicle collision with back
pain.  Evaluate for fracture.

【1】AP and lateral views of the lumbar spine without comparison show five non-rib-
bearing lumbar-type vertebral bodies. The vertebral body and disc heights are
maintained.  The SI joints are normal. Note is made of mild degenerative
change.

【2】IMPRESSION:  No fracture or subluxation.

【0】INDICATION:  ___ male status post MVA with chest pain.

【1】COMPARISON:  None.

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Contrast-enhanced axial images of the chest, abdomen, and pelvis
were obtained with multiplanar reformatted images.

【3】CT CHEST WITH CONTRAST:  The heart and great vessels are unremarkable and
there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.  No pathologically enlarged
axillary, mediastinal, or hilar lymphadenopathy is observed.  The lungs are
clear and there is no pneumothorax.  The airways are patent to the
subsegmental level bilaterally.

【4】CT ABDOMEN WITH CONTRAST:  The liver, gallbladder, spleen, pancreas, adrenal
glands, and kidneys appear normal.  There is no hydronephrosis or hydroureter.
Intra-abdominal loops of large and small bowel are of normal caliber and there
is no pneumoperitoneum or free fluid.  There are no pathologically enlarged
mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymph nodes and the abdominal aorta is of normal
caliber.

【5】CT PELVIS WITH CONTRAST:  The rectum, sigmoid colon, distal ureters and
bladder are normal.  There is no free pelvic fluid or pathologically enlarged
pelvic or inguinal lymph nodes.

【6】Bone windows reveal no fracture.  Moderate levoconvex thoracolumbar scoliosis
is centered at L2.

【7】IMPRESSION:  No acute traumatic changes.

【0】INDICATION:  ___ year old man with bacteremia (___) on vanc. please pull
line. hope to replace ___ if no evidence of infx. // pull HD line

【1】COMPARISON:  Comparison is made to tunneled line placement performed ___.

【2】TECHNIQUE:   OPERATORS: Dr. ___ radiology fellow) and Dr.
___ radiology attending) performed the procedure. Dr. ___,
___ radiologist, personally supervised the trainee during the key
components of the procedure and reviewed and agreed with the trainee's
findings. The procedure was performed at the bedside.

【3】ANESTHESIA:  1% lidocaine was injected in the skin and subcutaneous tissues
overlying the access site.

【4】PROCEDURE:  1. Removal of right internal jugular approach hemodialysis
catheter.

【5】PROCEDURE DETAILS:
The procedure was performed at the bedside.

【6】After confirming correct patient and procedure, the right upper chest and
lower neck was prepped and draped in the usual sterile fashion. 1% lidocaine
was instilled into soft tissue tunnel tract. Blunt dissection around the cuff
was carried out with forceps. Manual pressure was applied over the right
internal jugular vein, while gentle traction was applied to the tunneled
dialysis catheter. The tunneled dialysis catheter was removed without
difficulty, intact . Pressure was held over the right internal jugular vein
until hemostasis was achieved (3 minutes). A sterile dressing was applied to
the tunnel tract site. A portion of the tunneled catheter line tip was sent
for microbiology as requested.

【7】FINDINGS: 

【8】1. Existing right internal J approach tunneled hemodialysis catheter. No
evidence of local infection. Catheter removed intact.

【9】IMPRESSION: 

【10】Successful bedside removal of a tunneled right internal jugular vein
hemodialysis catheter. Catheter tip sent for microbiology

【0】INDICATION:  ___ man with contusions and occipital fracture, with
acute mental status change.

【1】COMPARISON:  CT head without contrast ___.

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Multidetector CT of the head was performed without intravenous
contrast.  Sagittal images were slightly limited by motion, hence repeat
imaging was performed.

【3】FINDINGS:  Again seen are extensive bifrontal hemorrhagic contusions, with
surrounding moderate vasogenic edema.  There is stable mild mass effect on the
frontal horn of both lateral ventricles.  A small amount of parafalcine
subdural hematoma in the frontal region, is unchanged.  Also seen are
bilateral temporal lobe hemorrhagic contusions with surrounding edema, stable
in appearance since the prior study.  Mild mass effect on the left temporal
horn is unchanged.  No new intracranial hemorrhage is detected.  The basal
cisterns are intact.  There is no significant shift of midline structures.  No
new parenchymal or extra-axial hematoma is seen.  Previously noted
intraventricular hemorrhage, is not appreciable in the current study.

【4】Again seen is a nondisplaced linear fracture through the occipital bone
extending from the base of the skull to the vertex.  Air-fluid level within
the right sphenoid sinus, and mild opacification of the left anterior ethmoid
air cells is noted.

【5】IMPRESSION:
1.  No significant interval change in the extensive hemorrhagic contusions and
surrounding edema in the inferior frontal lobes bilaterally.  Stable bilateral
temporal lobe hemorrhagic contusions.  Stable small parafalcine frontal
subdural hematoma.
2.  No evidence of herniation or significant interval change.

【0】STUDY:  Three views of the cervical spine ___.

【1】COMPARISON:  None.

【2】INDICATION:  Neck pain.

【3】FINDINGS:  The soft tissues of the neck are unremarkable.  The visualized lung
apices, proximal clavicle, and upper ribs are normal.  Patent airway.  Normal
prevertebral soft tissues.  On the AP view, multilevel mild uncovertebral and
facet hypertrophy.  On the lateral view, vertebral bodies C1 through C6 are
visualized.  No definite fractures in the visualized portions.  No
dislocation.  No listhesis.  Degenerative changes, endplate sclerosis, and
tiny anterior osteophytes at the C5-C6 and C6-C7 levels.  A coned-down view of
the C4 through C7 levels are noted as well.

【4】IMPRESSION:  Multilevel degenerative changes as above.

【0】EXAMINATION:  Chest radiograph.

【1】INDICATION:  History: ___ with generalized weakness  // Please evaluate for
evidence of pulmonary edema, pneumonia, effusion

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Chest AP and lateral

【3】COMPARISON:  Chest radiograph ___

【4】FINDINGS: 

【5】A right central venous line ends in the mid SVC.  The cardiomediastinal and
hilar contours are within normal limits.  There is platelike atelectasis in
the left midlung.  A retrocardiac opacity in the appropriate clinical setting
may represent pneumonia.  There is no fracture.

【6】IMPRESSION: 

【7】A retrocardiac opacity in the appropriate clinical setting may represent
pneumonia.

【0】INDICATION:  ___ man with AML status post allograft stem cell
transplant complicated by graft-versus-host disease with acute onset of
abdominal pain, nausea, and vomiting.  Assess for small-bowel obstruction.

【1】COMPARISON:  ___ abdominal radiograph.

【2】FINDINGS:  Supine and left lateral decubitus views of the abdomen demonstrate
a normal bowel gas pattern without evidence of ileus or obstruction.  The few
air-fluid levels seen on left lateral decubitus view are within normal limits.
No evidence of pneumoperitoneum or pneumatosis.  Irregular focus of radiodense
material overlying the L5 vertebral body is compatible with kyphoplasty. 
Radiodense focus overlying the right iliac wing may represent a harvest site.

【3】IMPRESSION:  Nonspecific bowel gas pattern without obstruction or ileus.

【0】EXAMINATION:  HIP (UNILAT 2 VIEW) W/PELVIS (1 VIEW) RIGHT

【1】INDICATION:  ___ year old man with pain in right hip  // etiology of pain

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Frontal view radiograph of the pelvis with additional frontal and
frog-leg lateral views of right hip

【3】COMPARISON:  None

【4】FINDINGS: 

【5】There is no fracture or dislocation.  There is mild degenerative change of
both femoral acetabular joints.  There is no suspicious lytic or sclerotic
lesion.  Small calcification adjacent to greater trochanter consistent with
calcific tendinitis or bursitis.  Spinal orthopedic hardware noted.

【6】IMPRESSION: 

【7】Mild femoral acetabular joint degenerative change bilaterally.

【8】Right gluteal calcific tendinitis.

【0】HISTORY:  ___ female with history of right vertebral arterial
dissection.

【1】COMPARISON:  MRI and MRA ___.

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Non-contrast head CT followed by CT angiogram of the neck and head
including circle of ___ after Optiray IV contrast with multiplanar
reformats.

【3】NON-CONTRAST HEAD CT:  There is no evidence of intracranial hemorrhage, shift
of normally midline structures, mass effect, hydrocephalus, or vascular
territorial infarction.  The normal gray/white matter distinction is
preserved.  The paranasal sinuses and mastoid air cells are clear.  There is
no osseous or surrounding soft tissue abnormality.

【4】CT ANGIOGRAM OF THE NECK, HEAD, AND CIRCLE OF ___:  Please note that due to
technical difficulties, 3D reconstructions could not be performed and are not
currently available for evaluation.  Based upon the axial source images and
coronal and sagittal reformatted images, the anterior and posterior
circulations including circle of ___ are patent without evidence of
stenosis, dissection, occlusion, aneurysm or vascular malformation.  The
visualized lung apices are clear.

【5】IMPRESSION:  Study is somewhat limited for technical reasons causing delay in
creation of 3D reconstructions.  Review of source axial images and coronal and
sagittal reformatted images shows no evidence of acute infarction or vascular
abnormality.

【6】ADDENDUM: Processed images are now avialble. They confirm the impression of
patent vessels with no evidence of stenosis or dissection. If there is
clinical concern of dissection, MR is more reliable, and much more sensitive
than CTA.

【0】STUDY:  MRI of the lumbar spine.

【1】CLINICAL INDICATION:  ___ female patient with history of low back
pain.

【2】COMPARISON:  No prior examinations of the lumbar spine are available.

【3】TECHNIQUE:  Sagittal T1, T2 and axial T2-weighted sequences were obtained
throughout the lumbar spine.

【4】FINDINGS:  The T12 vertebral body demonstrates a heterogeneous area on the
left side, with high signal intensity, likely consistent with a non-expansile
hemangioma.  The alignment and configuration of the lumbar vertebral bodies
appear maintained.  At L5 vertebral body, there is a focal area of high signal
intensity on the anterior aspect of the vertebral body, likely consistent with
the non-expansile hemangioma.  The conus medullaris terminates at the level of
T12/L1 and appears normal.

【5】T12/L1 level demonstrates disc desiccation with no evidence of neural
foraminal narrowing or spinal canal stenosis.

【6】At L1/L2 level, there is minimal posterior disc bulge with no evidence of
spinal canal stenosis or neural foraminal narrowing.

【7】L2/L3 level appears grossly normal.

【8】At L3/L4, there is minimal posterior biconvex disc bulge and moderate
articular joint facet hypertrophy and ligamentum flavum thickening resulting
in mild bilateral neural foraminal narrowing (image 6 series #4).

【9】L4/L5 level demonstrates disc desiccation, posterior central disc protrusion,
causing anterior thecal sac deformity, additionally there is moderate
articular joint facet hypertrophy resulting in moderate spinal canal stenosis.
The T1-weighted sequence demonstrates vacuum phenomena in the intervertebral
disc space.

【10】At L5/S1 level, there is disc desiccation and mild posterior diffuse disc
bulge, possibly contacting the traversing nerve roots bilaterally (image #19
series #4).  There is also moderate articular joint facet hypertrophy, the
sacroiliac joints are unremarkable.  Mild epidural lipomatosis is noted at the
level of S1 and S2 levels in the sacrum.  The visualized paravertebral
structures are grossly normal.

【11】IMPRESSION:

【12】1.  Areas of high signal intensity are visualized in the bone marrow at T12
and L5 vertebral bodies, likely consistent with non-expansile hemangiomas.

【13】2.  Multilevel disc degenerative changes throughout the lumbar spine, more
significant at L4/L5 with a posterior disc protrusion, articular joint facet
hypertrophy causing significant spinal canal stenosis and bilateral neural
foraminal narrowing.

【14】3.  Disc degenerative changes noted at L5/S1 level with posterior disc bulge,
possibly contacting the traversing nerve roots with associated bilateral
articular joint facet hypertrophy as described in detail above.

【0】EXAMINATION:  CHEST (PORTABLE AP)

【1】INDICATION:  ___ year old man with right malignant effusion s/p pleurodesis.//
Evaluate for change in pneumothorax, acute process.      Evaluate for change
in pneumothorax, acute process.

【2】IMPRESSION: 

【3】Compared to chest radiographs ___ through ___.

【4】Right lower lobe is now densely consolidated and there is new mild edema in
the right lung.  These could be due to recent pleurodesis.  No right
pneumothorax.  Basal pleural drainage tube in place.

【5】Left lung clear.  Heart size top normal increased since 6 5 accompanied by
enlarging mediastinal veins suggesting interval volume overload.

【6】Right supraclavicular central venous catheter ends in the right atrium.

【0】EXAMINATION:  BILATERAL DIGITAL DIAGNOSTIC MAMMOGRAM INTERPRETED WITH CAD AND
RIGHT BREAST ULTRASOUND

【1】INDICATION:  Focal pain in the right breast for one month, status post
TAH/BSO, patient reports history of tender lipomas in her left thigh

【2】COMPARISON:  Comparison to prior imaging dated ___, ___,
and ___.

【3】TECHNIQUE:  CC, lateral and MLO views of both breasts and spot compression CC
and MLO views of the left breast were obtained.  Subsequently, ultrasound of
both breasts in the area of concern as indicated by the patient on the right
and in the area of concern on mammography on the left was performed.  This
study was interpreted with the aid of the ___ computer aided detection
system.

【4】FINDINGS: 

【5】Tissue density:  A-  The breast tissues are predominantly fatty with minimal
residual fibroglandular tissue.  A small mass in the outer slightly inferior
left breast is seen and was further evaluated with ultrasound.  Nodular
asymmetry in the medial left breast did not persist on additional imaging and
is felt to most likely correspond to a tortuous vessel. However, this area was
also further evaluated with ultrasound.  In the right breast just medial to
the nipple corresponding to the area of pain as indicated by the patient is
identified a 3.5 cm encapsulated fatty mass suggestive of a lipoma.  This was
further evaluated with ultrasound.  No suspicious grouped microcalcifications
or areas of distortion are appreciated in either breast.

【6】Ultrasound of the right breast from ___ o'clock 1-8 cm from the nipple in the
area of concern as indicated by the patient was performed.  At 4 o'clock 1-2
cm is identified a 3.9 x 1.7 x 0.6 cm homogeneous isoechoic encapsulated mass
consistent with a benign finding such as a lipoma.  Clinical follow-up is
recommended at this time.  Any decision to biopsy at this time should be based
on the clinical assessment.

【7】Ultrasound of the left breast from ___ o'clock 1-15 cm from the nipple and
from ___ o'clock 1-15 cm from the nipple in the areas of concern on
mammography was performed.  At 4 o'clock 12 cm from the nipple is identified a
0.6 x 0.6 x 0.3 cm simple cyst which is felt to correspond to the mammographic
finding.  Incidental note was also made of a homogeneously isoechoic
encapsulated mass at 3 o'clock 14 cm from the nipple measuring 2.2 x 0.9 x 1.4
cm, most likely representing a lipoma.  No solid suspicious mass is seen.

【8】IMPRESSION: 

【9】3.9 x 1.7 x 0.6 cm probable lipoma in the right anterior breast just medial to
the nipple corresponding the area of pain as indicated by the patient. 
Clinical follow-up is recommended.  Any decision to biopsy at this time should
be based on the clinical assessment.

【10】No specific mammographic evidence of malignancy.

【11】RECOMMENDATION:  Clinical followup.  Annual screening mammography.

【12】NOTIFICATION:  Findings discussed with the patient at the time of imaging.

【13】BI-RADS:  2 Benign.

【0】HISTORY:  Two areas of nodularity seen on screening mammogram.  Evaluate.

【1】COMPARISON:  ___.  The patient has outside mammograms from
___, which are not available for review.

【2】UNILATERAL DIGITAL DIAGNOSTIC MAMMOGRAM WITH ICAD COMPUTER-AIDED DETECTION:
Additional views of the left breast were obtained.  There is a well-
circumscribed round 4-5 mm nodule in the anterior central slightly lateral
left breast, which persists on today's spot images.  No other masses are
identified.  Benign coarse calcification is seen in the central outer left
breast at mid depth.

【3】ULTRASOUND:  Targeted left breast ultrasound demonstrates two simple anechoic
cysts.  The first is located at the 3 o'clock position, 1 cm from the nipple
measuring 5 x 4 x 5 cm in size.  This likely corresponds to the nodule on
mammogram.  Additionally, there is also a simple anechoic cyst at the 12
o'clock location, 1 cm from the nipple measuring 5 x 4 x 4 mm in size.  There
are no discrete solid masses identified.

【4】IMPRESSION:  Two simple cysts seen within the left breast on ultrasound, one
of which at 3 o'clock position corresponds to the nodule on mammogram.
Findings discussed with the patient following the exam.  The patient can
return to annual screening mammogram.

【5】BI-RADS 2 - benign findings.

【0】EXAMINATION:  FINGER(S),2+VIEWS LEFT

【1】INDICATION:  ___ year old man with 2d hx of swollen/painful L ringer finger
after jamming it while playing basketball. Finger now discolored, diminished
ROM.  // fracture?

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Left ring finger three views.

【3】COMPARISON:  No previous left finger or hand radiographs on PACs record for
comparison.

【4】FINDINGS: 

【5】Left ring finger is imaged from the distal metacarpal through the distal tuft.
There is faint linear lucency sub 10 Ding be pole are base of the middle
phalanx, consistent with a nondisplaced molar plate fracture.  The MCP PIP and
DIP joints remain congruent. No other fracture and no subluxation or
dislocation is detected. There is probable mild soft tissue swelling best
correlated with physical exam. No radiopaque foreign body is detected.

【6】IMPRESSION: 

【7】Nondisplaced volar plate fracture at the base of the left ring finger middle
phalanx.

【8】NOTIFICATION:   The impression and recommendation above was entered by Dr.
___ on ___ at 22:40 into the Department of Radiology critical
communications system for direct communication to the referring provider. 
Email sent to Dr. ___ at the same time.

【0】INDICATION:  Neck pain.  Question loose hardware.

【1】COMPARISON:  ___ CT cervical spine.

【2】THREE VIEWS, CERVICAL SPINE IN FLEXION AND EXTENSION

【3】On sagittal images, the skull base to the C7 vertebral body is clearly
visualized.  The patient is status post posterior fusion of C7 through T4 with
corpectomy of the T2 vertebral body with an interbody fusion device.  Given
the limited evaluation secondary to overlying soft tissue it is difficult to
evaluate for abnormal motion on flexion and extension views at the C7 through
T4 levels.  No definite hardware loosening appreciated.  Mild degenerative
changes of the visualized cervical spine.

【0】HISTORY:  ___ female with endotracheal tube.  Evaluate ET tube.

【1】COMPARISON:  Most recent chest radiograph on ___.

【2】PORTABLE AP CHEST RADIOGRAPH:  ET tube is in place with the tip terminating at
36 mm above the carina.  Unchanged appearance of diffuse opacities in both
lungs, consistent with ARDS.  Persistent low lung volumes.  Right central line
is in place with tip terminating in mid SVC.  Nasogastric tube follows
appropriate courses below the diaphragm.  Fenestrated tube ends in the mid
esophagus.  Heart size is top normal.

【0】INDICATION:  Status post fall.

【1】COMPARISON:  No relevant comparisons available.

【2】TECHNIQUE:  This is a second read for outside study performed at ___
___ ___ at 1:29 p.m.  MDCT-acquired axial images from the
lung bases to the pubic symphysis were displayed with 5-mm slice thickness
with 80 mL Isovue intravenous contrast.  Coronal and sagittal reformats were
displayed with 5-mm slice thickness.

【3】CT ABDOMEN:  There is a 5-mm subpleural right lower lobe nodule (3:4) and a
3-mm left lower lobe nodule (3:5). There is no focal consolidation. No pleural
or pericardial effusion is seen. There is a small hiatal hernia.

【4】The liver, spleen, pancreas and bilateral adrenal glands are normal. Small
hiatal hernia is present. The patient is status post cholecystectomy. The
kidneys enhance symmetrically. A 1.1 cm hypodensity in the left lower renal
pole (3:33) is consistent with a simple cyst. The small and large bowel are
normal in course and caliber.  There is no free fluid and no free air.  No
mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy. Retroperitoneal clips are
possibly related to prior lymph node dissection. Extensive atherosclerotic
calcifications are seen in the aorta and its branches.  There is an abdominal
aortic aneurysm measuring 4.4 x 4.5 cm. The patient is status post right
inguinal hernia repair.

【5】CT PELVIS:  The rectum and bladder are normal.  Diverticula are seen in the
sigmoid colon without inflammatory changes.  Prostatic calcifications are
noted.  There is no free fluid and no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.

【6】BONE WINDOWS:  No lytic or sclerotic lesion suspicious for malignancy is seen.
Mild multilevel degenerative change is noted particularly in the lower lumbar
spine.

【7】IMPRESSION:
1.  No acute injury in the abdomen or pelvis.
2.  5-mm right lower lobe pulmonary nodule and 3-mm left lower lobe pulmonary
nodule. Per ___ criteria, followup with dedicated chest CT can be
performed at 12 months if patient has no risk factors for malignancy. If
patient has risk factors for malignancy, then dedicated chest CT is
recommended in 6 to 12 months.
3.  Abdominal aortic aneurysm measuring up to 4.5 cm.

【8】Findings posted to ED Dashboard at time of interpretation ___.

【0】EXAMINATION:  FEMUR (AP AND LAT) IN O.R. RIGHT; PELVIS AP ___ VIEWS

【1】INDICATION:  History: ___ with atraumatic R hip pain, acute on chronic// eval
R hip

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Single frontal view of the pelvis and five views of the right
femur.

【3】COMPARISON:  None.

【4】FINDINGS: 

【5】PELVIS: No fracture or dislocation.  Mild bilateral hip degenerative changes
are noted.  There are also degenerative changes of the imaged lumbar spine. 
There is a nonspecific, nonobstructive bowel gas pattern seen in the imaged
lower abdomen and pelvis.

【6】RIGHT FEMUR: No fracture is identified.  The patient is status post right
total knee arthroplasty.  No evidence of hardware loosening or periprosthetic
fracture.  There is no knee joint effusion.  Osseous mineralization is normal.
There are no suspicious osseous lesions.  No unidentified radiopaque soft
tissue foreign body.

【7】IMPRESSION: 

【8】No fracture or dislocation.  No evidence of right knee hardware complications.

【0】MR ENTEROGRAPHY.

【1】INDICATION:  Crohn's disease, history of phlegmon, query improvement on
antibiotics prior to starting anti-TNF.

【2】COMPARISON:  CT abdomen and pelvis ___ and MR enterography ___.

【3】TECHNIQUE:  Multiplanar T1- and T2-weighted imaging were acquired on a 1.5
Tesla magnet including dynamic 3D imaging obtained prior to, during, and after
the uneventful intravenous administration of 4 cc of Gadovist.  In addition,
900 cc of VoLumen were administered orally.  1 mg of intramuscular glucagon
was given to reduce bowel motion.

【4】FINDINGS:

【5】MR ABDOMEN:
Visualized liver, gallbladder, spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, and kidneys
are unremarkable.  There are no retroperitoneal masses or adenopathy.  No free
fluid.

【6】MR PELVIS:
Uterus and both adnexa are unremarkable.  The right ovary measures 15 x 26 mm
and the left ovary measures 10 x 21 mm (series 100, image 80 and image 75
respectively).  No pelvic free fluid.  No pelvic adenopathy.  Visualized
bladder is unremarkable.

【7】MR ENTEROGRAPHY:  
There is marked improvement in the degree of colitis when compared to prior MR
enterography and CT from ___ and ___ respectively.  Residual mild
hyperenhancement is noted in relation to the transverse colon (series 1102,
image 16) and distal descending colon (series 1102, image 19).  There is less
marked bowel wall thickening, edema, and mucosal hyperenhancement, however,
there is some residual engorgement of the vasa recta (series 100, image 46). 
There is better visualization of ___ fistula between the distal
transverse colon and distal descending colon (series 1101, image 27 and series
12, image 32).  

【8】No abnormal areas of bowel wall thickening, edema, or mucosal hyperenhancement
in relation to the small bowel loops.  The previously described phlegmonous
change surrounding the ileum has also resolved when compared to prior imaging.
There is no significant mesenteric adenopathy.  There is no intra-abdominal
abscess or collection identified.  No evidence for functional or mechanical
obstruction.  

【9】Bone marrow signal is normal and there are no osseous lesions.

【10】IMPRESSION:  

【11】There has been interval near-resolution of the previously described colitis
and associated phlegmon in relation to the colon with only minimal bowel wall
thickening and mucosal hyperenhancement identified in relation to transverse
and distal descending colon.  There is, however, a ___ fistula
identified between the distal transverse and distal descending colon which is
now better seen when compared to prior imaging studies (because of resolution
of the phlegmon).  No evidence for small bowel Crohn's disease.

source_info.text:
【0】EXAMINATION:  CTA HEAD AND CTA NECK Q16 CT NECK

【1】INDICATION:  ___ year old man with L anterior choroidal artery stroke// Assess
for vascular occlusion

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Contiguous MDCT axial images were obtained through the brain
without contrast material. Subsequently, helically acquired rapid axial
imaging was performed from the aortic arch through the brain during the
infusion of intravenous contrast material. Three-dimensional angiographic
volume rendered, curved reformatted and segmented images were generated on a
dedicated workstation. This report is based on interpretation of all of these
images.

【3】DOSE:  Total DLP (Body) = 583 mGy-cm.
Total DLP (Head) = 747 mGy-cm.

【4】COMPARISON:  MR head from ___ and CTA head and neck from ___.

【5】FINDINGS: 

【6】CT HEAD WITHOUT CONTRAST:
There is re-demonstration of a left caudate head and putamen infarct without
evidence of hemorrhagic transformation with surrounding adjacent edema and
mild mass effect on the frontal horn of the left lateral ventricle.
Additionally there is re-demonstration of focal right caudate head
hyperdensity is grossly unchanged from prior study given differences in
technique. There is no evidence of no evidence of acute infarction, or new
intracranial hemorrhage.  The ventricles and sulci are stable in size and
configuration.

【7】The visualized portion of the paranasal sinuses, mastoid air cells, and middle
ear cavities are clear. The visualized portion of the orbits are unremarkable.

【8】CTA HEAD:
There are multifocal stenoses in the bilateral anterior cerebral arteries most
pronounced in the A2 segments.  Moderate to severe stenosis of the mid basilar
artery as well short-segment moderate to severe stenosis of the left P1-P2
junction.  Overall the degree of stenosis is similar to unchanged from
examination of ___.  The remaining vessels of the circle of ___ and their
principal intracranial branches appear grossly normal without severe
stenosis,occlusion,or aneurysm formation.  The visualized proximal segments of
the anterior coronal arteries are patent.  The dural venous sinuses are
patent.

【9】CTA NECK:
Multifocal atherosclerotic calcifications are seen predominantly within the
bilateral common carotid arteries at the bifurcation and within the bilateral
carotid siphons with no evidence of stenosisorocclusion.  Mild atherosclerotic
calcification of the right carotid bifurcation does not result in stenosis of
the right cervical internal carotid artery by NASCET criteria.  Prominent
mixed calcified and soft plaque of the left carotid bifurcation is noted,
which also does not result in stenosis of the left cervical internal carotid
artery by NASCET criteria.

【10】There is mild narrowing of the distal right V 2 segment secondary to facet
arthropathy (series 3, image 192).  The vertebrobasilar system is right-side
dominant with the left vertebral artery diminutive throughout its course with
multifocal atherosclerotic calcifications demonstrated predominantly in the
distal aspect which results in multiple areas of severe stenosis in the left
V4 segments, unchanged from prior exam.

【11】OTHER:
The visualized portion of the lungs are clear.  The visualized portion of the
thyroid gland is within normal limits. There is no lymphadenopathy by CT size
criteria.  The visualized aerodigestive tract is unremarkable.  The main
pulmonary artery is enlarged measuring up to 3.8 cm suggestive of pulmonary
arterial hypertension.  No suspicious osseous lesions.  Multilevel cervical
spondylosis with unchanged 3 mm anterolisthesis of C4 on C5 and 2 mm
retrolisthesis of C5 on C6.  Severe loss of disc height at C5-C6 with endplate
sclerosis is noted.  A disc protrusion with intervertebral osteophytes at
C5-C6 results in mild spinal canal narrowing.  Uncovertebral facet arthropathy
at this level results in moderate neural foraminal narrowing.  Uncovertebral
facet arthropathy results in moderate bilateral C3-C4 neural foraminal
narrowing. Severe facet arthropathy of the right C4-C5 results in moderate to
severe neural foraminal narrowing.

【12】IMPRESSION:

【13】1. Re-demonstrated left caudate head and putamen infarct with associated edema
and mild mass effect on the frontal horn left lateral ventricle, similar in
appearance to prior study.  No hemorrhagic transformation identified.
2. Multifocal stenoses of the bilateral anterior cerebral arteries most
pronounced in the A2 segments.  Moderate to severe short-segment stenosis of
the left P1-P2 junction.  This appears similar to prior exam.
3. Right-sided dominant vertebrobasilar system with a diminutive left
vertebral artery and multifocal atherosclerotic calcifications resulting in
multiple severe stenoses of the distal left vertebral artery and mid to distal
basilar artery.  This appears similar to prior exam.
4. There is prominent mixed calcified and soft plaque of the left carotid
bifurcation.  However no stenosis of the cervical internal carotid arteries by
NASCET criteria.
5. Enlarged main pulmonary artery measuring up to 3.8 cm suggestive of
pulmonary arterial hypertension.
6. Additional findings as described above.

【0】EXAMINATION:  CT SINUS W/O CONTRAST FOR SURGICAL PLANNING

【1】INDICATION:  ___ year old woman with h/o chronic sinustis.  // fusion protocol
r/o chronic sinusitis.

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Helical axial images were acquired through the paranasal sinuses. 
Bone and soft tissue reconstructed iamges were generated. Coronal reformatted
images were also obtained

【3】DOSE:  DLP: 588 mGy-cm; CTDI:  26 mGy

【4】___

【5】FINDINGS: 

【6】There are soft tissue changes within right sphenoid sinus with  high density
material and sclerosis of the bony walls indicative of chronic sinusitis with
inspissated secretions. High-density material could be related to ongoing
infection and clinical correlation recommended. The appearance is not
significantly changed from the previous examination. Mild mucosal thickening
is seen in the left sphenoid sinus. Left maxillary sinus also demonstrates
mild mucosal thickening patent. Sinus drainage pathways are also patent with
no evidence of fluid levels or soft tissue changes within the frontal ethmoid
sinuses. There is deviated nasal septum to the right with narrowing of the
right nasal passage as before.

【7】IMPRESSION: 

【8】Chronic right sphenoid sinusitis with high-density material indicative of
inspissated secretions but clinical correlation recommended to exclude fungal
infection. Soft tissue changes have minimally decreased compared to the prior
study.

【0】MR CERVICAL SPINE WITH AND WITHOUT CONTRAST

【1】HISTORY:  ___ female with three weeks of neck pain and known herniated
cervical disc, status post epidural steroid injection earlier the same day,
now presenting with acute worsening of pain and weakness in the right upper
and lower extremities as well as urinary retention.  Patient is here to
evaluate for infection or progression of disc herniation.

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Multiplanar MRI of the cervical spine was performed with and
without intravenous gadolinium administration.

【3】COMPARISON:  None.

【4】FINDINGS:

【5】The study is markedly limited by patient motion artifact.  The
cervicomedullary junction is unremarkable.  There is slight reversal of the
normal cervical lordosis at C4-5 likely secondary to patient positioning or
muscle spasm.  Bone marrow signal intensity is homogeneous on all imaging
sequences.  There is preservation of vertebral body and intervertebral disc
space height.  The spinal cord demonstrates grossly normal intrinsic signal
intensity; however, evaluation of the cord is limited by motion.  There is no
significant STIR signal abnormality to suggest bone marrow edema or
ligamentous injury.  There is marked circumferential polypoid mucosal
thickening involving the left maxillary sinus.

【6】There is probable calcification or ossification of the posterior longitudinal
ligament extending from C3 through 7 which effaces the ventral thecal sac.

【7】There is mild spinal canal narrowing from C4-5 through C6-7 secondary to the
thickened posterior longitudinal ligament and probable posterior disc
osteophyte complexes.

【8】Folowing administration of intravenous contrast, there is no evidence of
abnormal enhancement or fluid collection.

【9】IMPRESSION:
1.  Severely limited evaluation of the spinal cord and spinal canal secondary
to patient motion artifact.  Mild narrowing of the spinal canal from C4-5
through C6-7 likely secondary to a combination of ossified posterior
longitudinal ligament and posterior disc osteophyte complexes.  No gross
signal abnormality is identified; however, a repeat study may be obtained for
further evaluation if clinically indicated. Ct may be helpful to evaluate the
ossified PLL.

【10】2.  No evidence of abscess or fluid collection.

of intravenous contrast.  Coronal and sagittal reformatted images were also

region.  However, there is no soft tissue gas to suggest Fournier's gangrene. 
Please note that the scrotum was not evaluated on this study.

【6】There is mild colonic diverticulosis, without evidence of acute
diverticulitis.  Incidental note is made of a 1.6 x 1.4 cm hyperdense nodule
along the posterolateral aspect of the bladder wall, concerning for
transitional cell carcinoma.

【7】There is an 11 x 8 mm left inguinal lymph node that is likely reactive. 
Vascular calcifications are noted within the iliac arteries bilaterally
secondary to atherosclerosis.  There is mild fatty atrophy of the psoas
muscles bilaterally.  On bone windows, degenerative changes seen within the
visualized osseous structures.  No blastic or lytic lesions are identified. 
No acute fractures are seen.

【8】IMPRESSION:
1.  Left inguinal subcutaneous edema, likely reflecting cellulitis. No
evidence of Fournier's gangrene though the scrotum was not included in the
imaged field.  Given this, if there is continued clinical concern,
ultrasonography or CT through the scrotum may be performed. 

【9】2.  1.6 x 1.4 cm hyperdense nodule along the posterolateral aspect of the
bladder wall, concerning for transitional cell carcinoma. Urology consult is
recommended. 

【10】3.  Mild colonic diverticulosis without evidence of acute diverticulitis.

【0】INDICATION:  ___ woman with wrist radiograph ___.

【1】LEFT WRIST RADIOGRAPH, THREE VIEWS AND DEDICATED SCAPHOID VIEWS, THREE VIEWS: 
No fracture or dislocation is seen in the left wrist, especially the left
scaphoid.  There is mild soft tissue swelling overlying the dorsal wrist. The
scapholunate interval is normal.

【2】IMPRESSION:  No acute abnormality.

【0】HISTORY:  Pes planus.

【1】Three radiographs of bilateral feet are submitted.

【2】RIGHT FOOT:  Mild degenerative change is seen to involve the talonavicular and
first tarsal-metatarsal joints.  Mineralization is normal.  There is pes
planus.  No periarticular erosion.  Atherosclerotic calcifications are
evident.

【3】LEFT FOOT:  There is soft tissue loss involving the medial aspect of the
forefoot at the level of the first metatarsophalangeal joint.  No tracking
subcutaneous emphysema is identified.  There is prominence of the soft tissues
overlying the lateral aspect of the fifth MTP joint with associated equivocal
soft tissue loss.  Again, no tracking subcutaneous emphysema is identified. 
There is pes planus.  The joint spaces are otherwise unremarkable without
periarticular erosion.  Atherosclerotic calcifications are noted.  Assessment
is slightly limited by overlying dressing material.

【4】IMPRESSION:

【5】Bilateral pes planus.

【6】Soft tissue prominence with probable associated soft tissue loss overlying the
first and fifth metatarsophalangeal joints as described.  No underlying
osseous change is evident to suggest osteomyelitis.

measures 11.3 cm in size.  There is a cystic lesion in the mid pole of the
right kidney with increased through transmission which could represent a
parapelvic cyst. A punctate echogenic focus is seen anterior to this lesion
and could represent fat/vessel.  Another focus of hyperechogenicity is seen in
the inferior pole of the right kidney with some posterior acoustic shadowing,
measuring about 4 mm in size.

【5】There is no hydronephrosis or solid renal masses.

【6】The urinary bladder appears within normal limits.

【7】IMPRESSION:  
Nonobstructive calculus in the lower pole of the right kidney.

There is a bulbous area of bony prominence along the inferior glenoid/inferior

related to remote trauma.

neck/glenoid, not fully characterized. If clinically indicated, this could

【1】CLINICAL INDICATION:  ___ male with high-grade partial-thickness
rotator cuff tear.

【2】TECHNIQUE:  MRI examination of the right shoulder was performed without
gadolinium contrast in the following sequences:  Axial proton-density fat
saturation, coronal proton-density, coronal T2 fat saturation, sagittal T1,
and sagittal T2 fat saturation.

【3】___.

【4】FINDINGS:

【5】There is motion that limits the sensitivity of this exam.  Allowing for this,
there is tendinosis and fraying of articular surface of the anterior leading
edge fibers of the supraspinatus tendon as before (___).  There has been no
significant progression.  Mild tendinosis of infraspinatus is present (5:14). 
The teres minor and subscapularis tendons are grossly intact.  

【6】There is mild tenosynovitis of the long head of the biceps tendon (4:11).  The
biceps tendon courses within the bicipital groove.  The biceps labral anchor
is intact.  Increased fluid intensity signal within the superior labrum
courses posterior to the biceps labral anchor and is consistent with a SLAP
tear (5:11).  The remaining labrum is intact.

【7】Subchondral cystic change and edema within the humeral head at the
infraspinatus insertion (5:13) has increased.  Mild degenerative change is
also present at the acromioclavicular joint with capsular hypertrophy and
effacement of the underlying fat.

【8】Muscle bulk is adequate without edema or atrophy.  

【9】No focal masses are seen in the suprascapular or spinoglenoid notches. 
Subcutaneous tissues are normal without edema.  There is no axillary
lymphadenopathy present.

【10】IMPRESSION:

【11】1.  SLAP tear.

【12】2.  Stable tendinosis with fraying of the anterior leading edge fibers of the
supraspinatus tendon.

【13】3.  Mild biceps tenosynovitis.

【14】4.  Mild AC joint degenerative change.

【0】CHEST RADIOGRAPH

【1】INDICATION:  Hepatitis B and hepatitis C cirrhosis with encephalopathy,
questionable infection.

【2】COMPARISON:  ___.

【3】FINDINGS:  As compared to the previous radiograph, the pre-existing mild
pulmonary edema has completely resolved.  On today's image, there is no
evidence of fluid overload or pulmonary edema.  The lung volumes remain low. 
There is moderate cardiomegaly and tortuosity of the thoracic aorta.  No
pleural effusions on the lateral than on the frontal image.  No evidence of
pneumothorax.  Minimal atelectasis at both lung bases, but no evidence of
infectious changes.

【0】INDICATION:  ___ woman with recurrent follicular on rituximab, recent
dexamethasone with fever, right middle lobe infiltrate on chest radiograph for
further evaluation, concerning for pneumonia, PCP.

【1】TECHNIQUE:  Unenhanced MDCT of thorax was performed using a standard
department protocol.  Contiguous axial images at 5-mm and 1.25-mm slice
thickness were reviewed concurrently with coronal and sagittal reformats.  The
study was reviewed in conjunction with CT component of PET-CT study from
___.

【2】FINDINGS:

【3】AIRWAYS AND LUNGS:  The airways are patent to subsegmental bronchi.  Bilateral
lungs are remarkable for diffuse, ground-glass opacities distrubuted in both
upper and lower lobes.  There is no interstitial thickening or pleural
abnormality.  There are three solid nodules measuring 2.1 mm in the right
upper lobe (6:71), 5 mm in the left lower lobe (6:251) and a tiny subpleural
nodule in the left lower lobe (6:226).  Mild cylindrical bronchiectasis is
present in bilateral lower lobes.

【4】MEDIASTINUM:  The thyroid gland is normal.  Port-A-Cath through the right
central venous approach ends at the level of the lower SVC.  There are no
pathologically enlarged mediastinal, supraclavicular, or axillary lymph nodes.
The heart is normal in size and there is minimal pericardial fluid, which is
likely physiological.

【5】ABDOMEN:  The study is not designed for assessment of subdiaphragmatic
pathologies; however, limited views were remarkable for a 2.4 x 2.2 cm left
adrenal nodule with attenuation characteristics suggestive of adenoam.  The
right adrenal gland is normal.

【6】BONES:  There is no bone lesion concerning for malignancy or infection.

【7】IMPRESSION: 

【8】1. Diffuse ground-glass changes in both lungs.  Differential diagnosis include
PCP. Similar appearance can be caused by viral infection and is not specific
for single viral ogranism. This patter is very unlikely for bacterial or
fungal infection. 

【9】2. Three discrete solid nodules with largest 5 mm in the left lower lobe.
These nodules are unlikely to be related to infection, and can be evaluated on
subsequent CT imaging is considered to monitor infection.

【0】CLINICAL HISTORY:  ___ man with history of high-grade dysplasia of the
stomach.  Status post gastric resection.  Constant left upper quadrant pain.
