【1】TECHNIQUE:  Multiplanar CT images of the abdomen and pelvis were obtained
after administration of oral and intravenous contrast material.  A prior CT
study of the abdomen and pelvis dated ___ was available for
comparison.

【2】FINDINGS:

【3】LUNG BASES:  Lung bases are included and show minimal subsegmental atelectasis
in the left lower lung lobe with mild bronchiectatic changes.  No suspicious
pulmonary nodules or pleural effusions are seen.

【4】ABDOMEN:  The liver and spleen are normal in size.  No focal hepatic lesions
are identified.  The patient is status post partial gastrectomy.  No
abnormalities are identified in the left upper quadrant.  A calcified
gallstone is identified in the gallbladder.  There is no evidence for
cholecystitis.  The pancreas is unremarkable.  Both kidneys are normal in
size.  The adrenals are normal.  There is no evidence for hydronephrosis or
nephrolithiasis.  There is no retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy.
There is a 1.7 x 4.3 cm lipoma identified in the right lateral abdominal wall
(sequence 3, image 24) and there is mild dilation of the extrahepatic bile
duct, without identifiable cause measuring up to 8 mm.

【5】PELVIS:  The small and large bowel appear unremarkable.  There is sigmoid
colon diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.  The urinary bladder
is well distended and does not show any gross abnormalities.  The prostate is
mildly enlarged and measures 5.1 cm in the axial plane.  There is no pelvic
lymphadenopathy.

【6】Review of the images in bone window does not show any suspicious bony lesions.

【7】IMPRESSION:
1.  No explanation for the patient's left upper quadrant pain.
2.  Subsegmental atelectasis with associated bronchiectasis in the left lower
lung lobe.
3.  Calcified gallstone.
4.  Extensive sigmoid colon diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.

text.text: (sequence 3, image 24)
text.content:
【0】CLINICAL HISTORY:  ___ man with history of high-grade dysplasia of the
stomach.  Status post gastric resection.  Constant left upper quadrant pain. 
Evaluate for source.

【1】TECHNIQUE:  Multiplanar CT images of the abdomen and pelvis were obtained
after administration of oral and intravenous contrast material.  A prior CT
study of the abdomen and pelvis dated ___ was available for
comparison.

【2】FINDINGS:

【3】LUNG BASES:  Lung bases are included and show minimal subsegmental atelectasis
in the left lower lung lobe with mild bronchiectatic changes.  No suspicious
pulmonary nodules or pleural effusions are seen.

【4】ABDOMEN:  The liver and spleen are normal in size.  No focal hepatic lesions
are identified.  The patient is status post partial gastrectomy.  No
abnormalities are identified in the left upper quadrant.  A calcified
gallstone is identified in the gallbladder.  There is no evidence for
cholecystitis.  The pancreas is unremarkable.  Both kidneys are normal in
size.  The adrenals are normal.  There is no evidence for hydronephrosis or
nephrolithiasis.  There is no retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy.
There is a 1.7 x 4.3 cm lipoma identified in the right lateral abdominal wall
(sequence 3, image 24) and there is mild dilation of the extrahepatic bile
duct, without identifiable cause measuring up to 8 mm.

【5】PELVIS:  The small and large bowel appear unremarkable.  There is sigmoid
colon diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.  The urinary bladder
is well distended and does not show any gross abnormalities.  The prostate is
mildly enlarged and measures 5.1 cm in the axial plane.  There is no pelvic
lymphadenopathy.

【6】Review of the images in bone window does not show any suspicious bony lesions.

【7】IMPRESSION:
1.  No explanation for the patient's left upper quadrant pain.
2.  Subsegmental atelectasis with associated bronchiectasis in the left lower
lung lobe.
3.  Calcified gallstone.
4.  Extensive sigmoid colon diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.

source_info.text:
【0】INDICATION:  Woman with AML, ___ years status post strokes and left hemiplegia
and aphasia.  Projectile vomiting with meds or flush to G-tube which was
placed ___.  Evaluate for G-tube issue or GI issue.

【1】COMPARISON:  Same day abdominal radiograph.  CT abdomen and pelvis ___.

【2】G-TUBE CHECK:  Water-soluble contrast was injected through the G-tube, and
multiple fluoroscopic images were obtained in several projections.  The G-tube
balloon resides in the stomach.  Water-soluble contrast was gently hand
injected with subsequent opacification of the stomach without evidence of
extraluminal leak.  Contrast continued into the duodenum and proximal portion
of the jejunum.  Shortly after injection, gastroesophageal reflux of contrast
was seen to the level of the mid to upper esophagus.

【3】IMPRESSION:  
1. G-tube appears in appropriate position.  
2. Shortly after injecting water-soluble contrast, reflux was seen to the
level of the mid to upper esophagus.

【0】EXAMINATION:  CHEST (PA AND LAT)

【1】INDICATION:  ___ year old man with soft tissue mass x 7 wks// left leg soft
tissue mass, possible malignancy

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Chest PA and lateral

【3】COMPARISON:  None.

【4】FINDINGS: 

【5】There is no focal consolidation, pleural effusion, or pneumothorax.
Mediastinal and hilar contours are within normal limits.  Heart size is
normal.

【6】IMPRESSION: 

【7】No acute cardiopulmonary process.

【0】INDICATION:  Status post MVC.

【1】COMPARISON:  None.

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Multidetector CT-acquired axial images of cervical spine. 
Coronally and sagittally reformatted images were generated.  No contrast was
administered.

【3】FINDINGS:  There is no acute fracture or subluxation.  There are minimal
degenerative changes seen in the cervical spine.  The intervertebral disc at
C6-7 is reduced in height with corresponding endplates changes, and anterior
and posterior osteophyte formation at that level with minimal narrowing of the
spinal canal.

【4】The prevertebral soft tissue is not thickened.  The upper airway and trachea
are patent.  The thyroid is atrophic, otherwise unremarkable.  The visualized
lung apices are clear.

【5】IMPRESSION:  No acute fracture or dislocation.

【0】EXAMINATION:  RIGHT DIGITAL DIAGNOSTIC MAMMOGRAM INTERPRETED WITH CAD

【1】INDICATION:  ___ woman with history of left metaplastic carcinoma
treated with mastectomy, here for annual surveillance of the right breast.

【2】COMPARISON:  Prior studies from ___ and ___.

【3】TECHNIQUE:  CC and MLO views of the right breast were obtained. Computer aided
detection was utilized and assisted with interpretation.

【4】FINDINGS: 

【5】Tissue density: B - There are scattered areas of fibroglandular density.
There are vascular calcifications.  Benign intramammary lymph nodes in the
upper outer right breast are unchanged.  There is no developing mass,
unexplained architectural distortion or suspicious grouped microcalcifications
in the right breast.

【6】IMPRESSION: 

【7】No specific mammographic evidence of malignancy in the right breast.  Status
post left mastectomy.

【8】RECOMMENDATION(S):  Annual mammography.

【9】NOTIFICATION:  Findings reviewed with the patient at the completion of the
study.

【10】BI-RADS:  2 Benign.

【0】HISTORY:  ___ male with bilateral foot swelling and multiple joint
pain.

【1】STUDY:  Three views of the ankles bilaterally, three views of the feet
bilaterally.

【2】COMPARISON:  None.

【3】FINDINGS:

【4】ANKLES:  There is no fracture, dislocation or degenerative change at the
tibiotalar joints.  The ankle mortise appears normal bilaterally.  A small
posterior calcaneal enthesophyte is noted on the left.  There is no focal
lytic or sclerotic lesion.  Soft tissue swelling is noted over the lateral and
medial malleoli bilaterally.  No radiopaque foreign bodies are seen.

【5】FEET:  No fracture or dislocations are seen.  Mild degenerative changes are
noted at the right talo-navicular joint.  A spur is also seen at the right
talar neck.  Incidental finding of os naviculare is seen on the left.

【6】IMPRESSION:
1.  Soft tissue swelling over the ankle, without evidence of acute or chronic
injury, and likely represents lower extremity edema.
2.  Spurs at the left dorsal calcaneus and right talar neck.
3.  Mild right talo-navicular joint degenerative changes.

source_info.text:
【0】EXAM:  AP view of the pelvis and AP and lateral views of the left hip.

【1】CLINICAL INFORMATION:  Repeat x-rays of the left hip.

【2】___.

【3】FINDINGS:  AP view of the pelvis and AP and lateral views of the left hip were
obtained.  Again seen is evidence of prior curettage and packing of left
intertrochanteric lesion with evidence of bone graft.  The proximal left femur
is fixated with lateral plate and dynamic compression screw, without
significant change in alignment or evidence of hardware complication. 
Overall, there has been no significant interval change.

【4】IMPRESSION:  No significant interval change in post-surgical appearance of the
proximal left femur.  No evidence of hardware complication.

【0】EXAMINATION:  Chest x-ray PA and lateral

【1】INDICATION:  ___ year old woman with R spont ptx, CT to water seal this AM  //
please eval for interval change

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Chest PA and lateral

【3】COMPARISON:  Comparison is made to chest x-rays dated ___.

【4】FINDINGS: 

【5】Patient is status post chest tube to waterseal now with recurrence of a small
right apical pneumothorax.  Right pigtail pleural catheter is unchanged in
position.  The cardiomediastinal silhouette is normal.  The hila and pleura
are normal.  No focal consolidations or pleural effusions are seen.

【6】IMPRESSION: 

【7】Recurrent right apical pneumothorax.

【8】NOTIFICATION:   The findings were discussed with ___, M.D. by ___
___, M.D. on the telephone on ___ at 12:00 AM, 10 minutes after
discovery of the findings.

【0】EXAMINATION:  Chest radiograph, portable AP upright.

【1】INDICATION:  Pneumonia pleural effusions, pulmonary edema.

【2】COMPARISON:  Radiograph from ___, and CT from the prior day.

【3】FINDINGS: 

【4】Patient is status post coronary artery bypass graft surgery with sternotomy
wires that appear intact.  Cardiac, mediastinal and hilar contours appear
stable.  Lung volumes remain low.  Small right pleural effusion likely
persists, possibly decreased, however.  Small left pleural effusion is
probably unchanged.  Moderately extensive opacification of the right lung has
substantially improved.  Persistent minor left basilar opacification, also
improved, probably due to atelectasis.  No evidence of pneumothorax.

【5】IMPRESSION: 

【6】Substantial improvement in bilateral pulmonary opacities.

【0】INDICATION:  Preoperative evaluation, prior to cystoscopy.

【1】COMPARISON:  None.

【2】PA AND LATERAL CHEST:  Low lung volumes cause mild bronchovascular crowding
bilaterally.  Allowing for this, the lungs are otherwise clear without pleural
effusion or pneumothorax.  The pulmonary vascularity is normal.
Atherosclerotic calcifications involve the thoracic aorta.  The heart size is
normal.  Minimal degenerative changes of the thoracic spine are observed.

【3】IMPRESSION:  Low lung volumes without acute cardiopulmonary process.

【0】Upon reviewing this case with Dr. ___, from interventional
neuroradiology, we have noted a past history of myelodysplastic syndrome, as
indicated on the requisition for plain X-ray study of the spine from ___.
It is possible that this condition could have radiological manifestations
similar to that noted on this study, although chronic renal disease and
hyperparathyroidism should also be considered. Moreover, there is some
heterogeneous T2 signal in both iliac bones.  If there remains uncertainty as
to the diagnosis of the present bony lesions, perhaps a bone biopsy of the
iliac bone might be less complex technically than a spinal biopsy.
Radionuclide bone scan or PET CT scan would offer comprehensive assessments of
the skeleton, as well.

【0】HISTORY:  ___ woman with shortness of breath and chest pain and
history of renal clots in the past.

【1】CTA CHEST:  Helical imaging was performed from the thoracic inlet through the
upper abdomen after uneventful administration of 100 cc of Optiray 350. 
Sagittal, coronal, and right and left MIP oblique reformats were prepared.

【2】COMPARISON:  CTA chest, ___.

【3】FINDINGS:  There is no evidence of pulmonary embolism.  The thoracic aorta, 
heart and great vessels appear normal.  The heart appears normal in size
without pericardial effusion.

【4】Lung volumes are low with slight atelectasis and hypoventilatory changes. 
Incidental note is made of an azygous vein and fissure.  No nodules, masses,
or pleural effusions are present.  The airways are patent to the subsegmental
levels bilaterally.  There is no axillary, hilar, or mediastinal
lymphadenopathy.  The lobes of the thyroid appear normal.

【5】Although this examination is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic evaluation,
limited views of the spleen demonstrate heterogeneous enhancement, likely due
to the arterial phase of imaging.  The partially visualized left kidney
appears normal, and the partially visualized liver and gallbladder both appear
normal.

【6】BONE AND SOFT TISSUE WINDOWS:  There is a left-sided breast implant.  There
are no suspicious sclerotic or lytic lesions.

【7】IMPRESSION:  No pulmonary embolism, or traumatic aortic pathology.

【0】INDICATION:  Patient with cellulitis and history of HIV.  No IV access, on
vancomycin.  Please place PICC catheter.

【1】RADIOLOGISTS:  Drs. ___ performed the procedure.  Dr.
___ attending radiologist, was present and supervising throughout.

【2】PROCEDURE AND FINDINGS:  As no suitable superficial veins were visible,
ultrasound was used to localize the left basilic vein which was patent and
compressible.  The patient was prepped and draped in sterile fashion.  2 cc of
1% lidocaine were used for local anesthesia.  Under ultrasonographic guidance,
a 21-gauge needle was advanced into the left basilic vein, and a 0.018 guide
wire was advanced into the SVC under fluoroscopic guidance.  Hard copy
ultrasound images were obtained before and after venous access documenting
vessel patency. The needle was exchanged for a 4.5 ___ micropuncture
sheath, and a 4 ___ single lumen ___ catheter and wire were advanced
into the SVC under fluoroscopic guidance.  The wire was removed. The external
portion of the catheter was trimmed to 38 cm. The external portions of the
catheter were attached.  The line was flushed and StatLocked. The patient
tolerated the procedure well and there were no complications.

【3】IMPRESSION:  Successful placement of a 4 ___ single lumen ___ catheter
into the left basilic vein, with the tip in the distal SVC.  The line is ready
for use.

【0】EXAMINATION:  HEEL (AXIAL AND LATERAL) LEFT

【1】INDICATION:  ___ year old woman with pain intermittantly left heel inner aspect
attributed to stepping on piece of glass a week ago.  // ? foreign body/glass
left heel     ? foreign body/glass left heel

【2】IMPRESSION: 

【3】Lateral and axial views show no definite opacification in soft tissues.  The
underlying calcaneus is within normal limits.
If there is serious clinical concern for non-opaque glass in the plantar soft
tissues, ultrasound could be considered.

【0】HISTORY:  Screening.

【1】DIGITAL SCREENING MAMMOGRAM INTERPRETED WITH CAD:  There are scattered
fibroglandular densities.  Focal asymmetries in each breast are stable.  No
discrete mass, clustered microcalcifications or architectural distortion. 
Little change from ___, ___, or ___.

【2】IMPRESSION:  No evidence of malignancy.  BI-RADS 2 - benign findings.

【0】EXAMINATION:  CTA CHEST

【1】INDICATION:  ___ man with active pancreatic cancer and metastases to
the lung presenting with new onset shortness of breath, presyncope, and new
SOB and aflutter; evaluate for pulmonary embolus.

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Axial multi-detector CT images were obtained through the thorax
after the uneventful administration of 100 cc of Omnipaque intravenous
contrast.
Reformatted coronal, sagittal, thin slice axial images, and oblique maximal
intensity projection images were submitted to PACS and reviewed.

【3】DOSE:  DLP: 595 mGy-cm

【4】COMPARISON:  CT chest and abdomen and pelvis exams dated ___.

【5】FINDINGS: 

【6】CHEST:
Cardiovascular: The thoracic aorta and its major branches are within normal
limits without aneurysmal dilatation or dissection. The heart size is normal.
No pericardial effusion.

【7】Pulmonary:  Innumerous, bilateral masses consistent with metastases have
increased in both size and number since the prior exam. No focal
consolidation, pneumothorax, or pleural effusion. The airways are patent to at
least the subsegmental level. There is minimal bibasilar atelectasis.

【8】Pulmonary arteries:  The main, left, right, lobar, segmental, and subsegmental
pulmonary arteries appear patent. No evidence of pulmonary hypertension.

【9】Mediastinum:  Several enlarged lymph nodes are again seen at the level of the
supra-aortic branches, with diameters up to 2.4 cm, and are overall unchanged
(e.g. Series 2, Image 15).  At the level of the left thoracic inlet, the
large mass of coalescent lymph nodes previously described is again seen but
incompletely visualized (e.g. Series 2, Image 1).

【10】Hila:  No hilar lymphadenopathy.

【11】Bones and soft tissues:  There is diffuse bony demineralization. No suspicious
lytic or sclerotic bony lesions. Multi-level mild degenerative changes are
noted with loss of intervertebral disc height and anterior osteophytes. There
is mild anterolisthesis of C7 on T1. These soft tissues of the visualized
thorax are grossly unremarkable.

【12】ABDOMEN:  On this nondedicated exam, the incompletely visualized liver
demonstrates numerous hypodensities that are compatible with metastases and
also noted previously.

【13】IMPRESSION: 

【14】1.  No acute pulmonary embolism.

【15】2.  Interval increase in both number and size of numerous bilateral pulmonary
metastases.

【16】3.  Grossly stable mediastinal/thoracic inlet lymphadenopathy.

【0】STUDY:  CT of the paranasal sinuses.

【1】CLINICAL INDICATION:  History of fever and respiratory failure, the patient is
vent dependent.

【2】COMPARISON:  Prior head CT without contrast dated ___.

【3】TECHNIQUE:  Contiguous axial images were obtained throughout the paranasal
sinuses, coronal reformatted images were created.  The images were reviewed
using soft tissue and bone window algorithms.

【4】In comparison with the prior head CT, the previously noted mucosal thickening
at the dependent portion of the sphenoid sinus has been resolved, new mucosal
thickening is noted on the left lateral recess of the sphenoid sinus with
aerosolized secretions (4:29), the maxillary sinuses demonstrate mild mucosal
thickening on the right with no air-fluid levels identified.  The ostiomeatal
units are patent.  Mild nasal septum deviation towards the left is better
demonstrated in the coronal reconstructions.  The ethmoidal air cells are
grossly unremarkable.  The frontoethmoidal recesses are patent and the frontal
sinus appears normal.  The orbits, the visualized intracranial contents and
temporomandibular joints are unremarkable.  In comparison with the prior
study, there is also interval improvement in the aeration of the mastoid air
cells bilaterally.  NG tube is in place on the right.

【5】IMPRESSION:  Interval improvement in the previously noted mucosal thickening
in the posterior aspect of the sphenoid sinus, a new area of mucosal
thickening is noted on the lateral recess of the sphenoid sinus with
aerosolized secretions.  The remainder paranasal sinuses demonstrate normal
pneumatization and the mastoid air cells are clear.

【0】INDICATION:  Crush injury to both hands with primary areas of discomfort in
the right index finger and left thumb.

【1】BILATERAL HANDS, THREE VIEWS EACH:  No fracture or dislocation is identified. 
No focal lytic, sclerotic, or degenerative changes are seen.  No erosions are
identified.  Alignment is anatomic.  No radiopaque foreign bodies or soft
tissue calcifications are noted.  Joint spaces are preserved.

【2】IMPRESSION:  No fracture or dislocation.

【0】INDICATION:  Trauma

【1】COMPARISON:  None available.

【2】SINGLE FRONTAL CHEST RADIOGRAPH:

【3】Fine detail is obscured by an underlying trauma board.  Within these
limitations, the lungs are well expanded and clear.  The cardiomediastinal
silhouette, hilar contours, and pleural surfaces are normal.  No fractures are
noted.  The bilateral apices are excluded from view. Radio-opaque foreign
bodies are noted projecting over the left upper chest.

【4】IMPRESSION:
Foreign bodies project over the left upper chest, likely glass fragments. 
Correlate clinically. Otherwise, no traumatic chest injury noted.

【0】INDICATION:  Severe right knee pain.

【1】FOUR VIEWS OF THE RIGHT KNEE: There is no evidence of fracture or subluxation.
There are mild degenerative changes with joint space narrowing.  There is
somewhat atypical appearance of the enthesophyte in the anterolateral patella.
There is a focus of calcification within the quadriceps tendon.

【2】IMPRESSION:  Mild degenerative changes and enthesophyte formation.

【0】INDICATION:  ___ female with fall and head strike

【1】TECHNIQUE:  Multi detector CT images through the cervical spine were obtained
in the absence of intravenous contrast. Coronal and sagittal reformations were
generated and reviewed.
759 mGy-cm.

【2】DOSE:  75___

【3】COMPARISON:  CT neck dated ___.

【4】FINDINGS: 

【5】No acute subluxation or fracture is identified. Multilevel degenerative
changes are identified. Multiple diffuse disc bulging is identified
predominantly at the C3-C4, C5-C6, and C6-C7 levels (3:26, 40, 44). At the
C6-C7 level, there is moderate to severe central canal narrowing secondary to
a prominent disc bulge.
The greatest severe foraminal narrowing at C5-6 and C6-7 levels.
Prominent anterior osteophytes are noted at the C4 thru C6 levels. Mild loss
of disc space at these levels is identified. There is no abnormal prevertebral
swelling. Soft tissue windows demonstrates a thyroid gland within normal
limits. No  abnormal cervical adenopathy is seen. Lung apices are clear.
Minimal fluid in the sphenoid sinus.

【6】IMPRESSION: 

【7】CT C spine:

【8】No acute subluxation or fracture.  Multilevel, multifactorial degenerative
changes.
Note is made of multilevel disc bulging most prominent at the C6-C7 level
resulting in moderate to severe central canal stenosis.
Moderate to severe foraminal narrowing at C5-6 and C6-7 levels.
Correlate clinically to decide on the need for further workup or followup.

【0】INDICATION:  ___ year old man with hepatic hemangioendothelioma, now with
abdominal distension // please evaluate for ileus

【1】TECHNIQUE:  Abdominal radiograph, three views

【2】COMPARISON:  Comparison made to ___.

【3】FINDINGS: 

【4】Interval removal of the enteric tube.  Central line partially seen,
terminating in the cavoatrial junction.
Interval decrease in the degree of small bowel dilatation, with some
persisting air-fluid levels on upright film.  Unremarkable appearance of the
large bowel. No evidence of free intraperitoneal air.
Right pleural effusion with atelectasis/ consolidation, unchanged.
Pancreatic stent in situ, with multiple surgical clips in the left abdomen.
Osseous structures are unremarkable.

【5】IMPRESSION: 

【6】Interval decrease in the degree of small bowel dilatation and obstruction
compared to previous.
No interval change in the right pleural effusion with associated atelectasis
and consolidation.

【0】INDICATION:  ___ man with hemorrhagic left parietal bleed.

【1】COMPARISON:  Outside hospital CT head uploaded to PACS for comparison.

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Contiguous axial images of the head were obtained without
contrast.  After administration of intravenous contrast, MDCT images of the
head and neck were obtained in the arterial phase.  Multiplanar reformats,
MIPS, and volume-rendered images were generated and reviewed.

【3】FINDINGS:

【4】CT HEAD:  Again seen is a left parieto-occipital intraparenchymal hematoma
measuring 3.2 x 5.5 cm in the axial plane.  There is intraventricular
extension of the hemorrhage with layering of blood products within the
occipital horns of bilateral lateral ventricles.  There is no midline shift. 
No large vascular territorial infarction is seen.  Ventricles and sulci appear
age appropriate.  No fracture is identified.

【5】CTA NECK:  Imaged portions of the aortic arch demonstrates mild
atherosclerotic calcification.  There is a normal three-vessel takeoff from
the aortic arch.  Bilateral carotid arteries are patent with no evidence of
stenosis, occlusion, dissection or pseudoaneurysm formation.  Atherosclerotic
calcifications are seen at bilateral common carotid artery bifurcation.  The
left internal carotid artery measures 8 mm and 6 mm measured proximally at the
bifurcation and distally, respectively.  The right internal carotid artery
measures 6 mm and 5 mm measured proximally near the bifurcation and distally,
respectively.  The right vertebral artery is hypoplastic with likely
retrograde filling of the distal vertebral artery and non-opacification of the
proximal right vertebral artery.  Multilevel degenerative changes are seen in
the cervical spine.

【6】CTA HEAD:  Intracranial vertebral arteries and internal carotid arteries and
their major branches appear normal with no evidence of stenosis, occlusion, or
aneurysm formation.  Left vertebral artery is dominant.  Atherosclerotic
calcifications are seen in bilateral cavernous internal carotid arteries.  

【7】IMPRESSION:
1.  Left parieto-occipital intraparenchymal hematoma with intraventricular
extension as described above.  There is no hydrocephalus or midline shift.
2. Right vertebral artery is hypoplastic with retrograde filling of the distal
vertebral artery and non-opacification of the proximal right vertebral artery,
likely occluded.
2.  Unremarkable CTA of the head

【0】HISTORY:  Screening.  History of bilateral oophorectomy.  Family history of
breast cancer. 

【1】COMPARISON:  ___.

【2】HOLOGIC DIGITAL SCREENING MAMMOGRAM WITH TOMOSYNTHESIS:  Scattered
fibroglandular densities are identified.  No dominant mass, suspicious
microcalcifications, or unexplained architectural distortion is identified. 
There is no interval change.  Asymmetry in the medial left breast is stable
since at least ___, consistent with a benign entity.

【3】IMPRESSION:  No evidence for malignancy.

【4】BI-RADS 1 - negative.

【0】EXAMINATION:  CT C-SPINE W/O CONTRAST

【1】INDICATION:  ___ with fall head/strike// acute process

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Contiguous axial images obtained through the cervical spine
without intravenous contrast. Coronal and sagittal reformats were reviewed.

【3】DOSE:  Acquisition sequence:
   1) Spiral Acquisition 5.2 s, 20.3 cm; CTDIvol = 22.6 mGy (Body) DLP = 457.3
mGy-cm.
 Total DLP (Body) = 457 mGy-cm.

【4】COMPARISON:  None.

【5】FINDINGS: 

【6】Alignment is normal.  Degenerative changes include intervertebral disc height
loss and large anterior osteophytes.  There are lucencies through the bases of
these osteophytes throughout the cervical spine.  There is slight widening of
the lucency at the anterior inferior endplate of C4 with anterior vertebral
disc widening.  No definite prevertebral edema identified.  No definite acute
fracture.  No significant canal or foraminal narrowing.  There is no
prevertebral edema.

【7】Thyroid is enlarged and heterogeneous with apparent discrete nodule in the
right measuring up to 2.7 cm.  Pleural based scarring seen at the right lung
apex.

【8】IMPRESSION:

【9】1. Multilevel anterior osteophytes with lucencies which are likely chronic. 
There is however widening of one of these lucencies at the anterior inferior
endplate of C4 in associated anterior intervertebral disc height widening at
C4-5.  The acuity of this finding is uncertain and if there is concern for
acute injury based on patient's symptoms, MRI would be suggested.
2. No dislocation or definite acute fracture.
3. Heterogeneous thyroid with discrete right-sided thyroid nodule measuring up
to 2.7 cm.

【10】RECOMMENDATION(S):   Nonurgent thyroid ultrasound is suggested if not already
performed.

【0】INDICATION:  History: ___ with fever, altered mental status//?pneumonia
?pneumothorax

【1】TECHNIQUE:  Upright AP view of the chest

【2】COMPARISON:  Chest radiograph ___ and ___

【3】FINDINGS: 

【4】The right PICC has been removed.  Heart size is normal.  Mediastinal and hilar
contours are within normal limits.  The pulmonary vasculature is not engorged.
Lungs are clear without focal consolidation.  No pleural effusion or
pneumothorax is present.  No acute osseous abnormality is visualized.

【5】IMPRESSION: 

【6】No acute cardiopulmonary process.

【0】INDICATION:  ___ man status post CABG readmitted with shortness of
breath, rule out PE.

【1】COMPARISON:  Portable AP chest from ___.

【2】TECHNIQUE:  MDCT imaging of the chest from the thoracic inlet to the top
abdomen were obtained with and without contrast.

【3】CT OF THE CHEST WITH IV CONTRAST:  There is no significant hilar or axillary
lymphadenopathy. There is evidence of coronary bypass surgery using two bypass
graphs. There is mediastinal stranding consistent with the patient's history
of CABG. There is no pericardial effusion and the heart, pericardium and great
vessels are otherwise unremarkable.  There is trace left-sided pleural
effusion.

【4】Evaluation of the lungs demonstrates no evidence of pulmonary embolism
bilaterally.  A 4-mm nodule in the left lower lung (series 3 image 79) is
detected. There is also an area of focal atelectasis in this area. The airways
are patent to the level of the segmental bronchi bilaterally.

【5】In the imaged portion of the upper abdomen the visualized liver, spleen, and
stomach are unremarkable.

【6】IMPRESSION:
1) No evidence of pulmonary embolism.
2) Left lower lung nodule. Fleischer guidlines recommend ___ year follow up to
assess for stability.

source_info.text:
【0】EXAMINATION:  Chest radiograph, portable AP semi-upright

【1】INDICATION:  Acute hypoxia.

【2】COMPARISON:  ___.

【3】FINDINGS: 

【4】Patient is intubated.  Endotracheal tube terminates about 3.5 cm above the
carina.  Orogastric tube terminates in the stomach.  Right internal jugular
catheter terminates in the lower superior vena cava.  These lines, tubes and
drains are unchanged.  Lung volumes are still low.  Cardiac, mediastinal and
hilar contours appear stable.  No definite pleural effusion on the right. 
Layering pleural effusion on the left, difficult to quantify but not large. 
No pneumothorax.  Dense retrocardiac opacity is typical for atelectasis. 
Platelike opacity in the right midlung is also unchanged, very suggestive of
atelectasis.  A mild interstitial abnormality is very similar to the recent
prior study.

【5】IMPRESSION: 

【6】Similar mild interstitial pulmonary edema.  Persistent retrocardiac opacity
suggesting atelectasis, typical for that, although an infectious cause is not
excluded.  Left-sided pleural effusion, probably unchanged, difficult to
quantify although not large.

【0】INDICATION:  ___ female with a history of alcoholic cirrhosis who
presents for evaluation prior to liver transplant.

【1】COMPARISONS:  Chest radiograph from ___
and ___.

【2】TECHNIQUE:  PA and lateral radiographs of the chest.

【3】FINDINGS:  Cardiomegaly appears to be stable compared to studies dating back
to at least ___. The aorta is tortuous.  The hilar and mediastinal
contours are otherwise unremarkable.  The lungs are well expanded and clear. 
There is no pneumothorax or pleural effusion.  The spine again demonstrates
compression of multiple thoracic vertebral bodies, overall stable since the CT
from ___.

【4】IMPRESSION:  

【5】No acute abnormalities identified.

【0】EXAMINATION:  TIB/FIB (AP AND LAT) LEFT

【1】INDICATION:  ___ with fall with knee strike.// Fracture, primarily at the left
lateral knee, proximal left fibula

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Frontal and lateral view radiographs of the left tibia and fibula.

【3】COMPARISON:  No similar prior studies available for comparison.

【4】FINDINGS: 

【5】No fracture is detected in the tibia or fibula. No suspicious lytic lesion,
sclerotic lesion, or periosteal new bone formation is detected. No soft tissue
calcification or radio-opaque foreign bodies are detected. Limited assessment
of the knee and ankle joint is unremarkable.  Degenerative changes of the knee
including joint space narrowing, osteophyte complex formation.

【6】IMPRESSION: 

【7】No fracture or acute traumatic finding.

【0】CHEST RADIOGRAPH

【1】INDICATION:  Evaluation for nasogastric tube placement.

【2】COMPARISON:  ___, 2:46 p.m.  

【3】The course of the nasogastric tube is unremarkable.  The tip is positioned in
the middle parts of the stomach, the side port projects 8-9 cm distal from the
gastroesophageal junction.

【4】The pre-existing left basal atelectasis has minimally increased.  Otherwise,
the radiograph is unchanged, unchanged course of the left central venous
access line.

【0】EXAMINATION:  MRI AND MRA BRAIN AND MRA NECK PT11 MR ___

【1】INDICATION:  ___ year old man with headache, n.v// PLEASE INCLUDE DIFFUSION
SEQUENCE

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Three dimensional time of flight MR arteriography was performed
through the brain with maximum intensity projection reconstructions.

【3】2D time of flight MR angiography of the neck was performed.

【4】Brain imaging was performed with sagittal T1 and axial FLAIR, T2, gradient
echo and diffusion technique.

【5】Three dimensional maximum intensity projection and segmented images were
generated. This report is based on interpretation of all of these images. The
examination was performed using a 1.5T MRI.

【6】COMPARISON:  Prior CT head done ___

【7】FINDINGS: 

【8】MRI Brain:
There is no evidence of hemorrhage, edema, masses, mass effect, midline shift
or infarction.  Mild periventricular and deep white matter T2 and FLAIR
hyperintense changes are most likely sequela of microangiopathy.  The
ventricles and sulci are normal in caliber and configuration.  The pituitary
appears normal.  The craniocervical junction appears normal.  The orbits
appear normal.  Minimal mucosal thickening involving the paranasal sinuses. 
The intracranial arteries demonstrate normal T2 flow voids.  The CP angles
appear normal.

【9】MRA brain: The intracranial vertebral and internal carotid arteries and their
major branches are patent without evidence of stenosis, occlusion, or aneurysm
formation.

【10】MRA neck:  The common, internal and external carotid arteries are patent. 
There is no evidence of internal carotid artery stenosis by NASCET criteria. 
The origins of the vessels are suboptimally visualized, but this is technical
in nature.

【11】IMPRESSION:

【12】1. No intracranial mass, hemorrhage or infarct.
2. Mild periventricular and deep white matter changes are most likely sequela
of microangiopathy.
3.   No intracranial arterial occlusion, marked stenosis or aneurysm
formation.
4. There is no ICA stenosis by NASCET criteria.
5. The vertebral arteries appear patent.

【0】EXAMINATION:  MRI AND MRA BRAIN AND MRA NECK PT11 MR ___

【1】<mark>INDICATION:  ___ year old man with headache, n.v// PLEASE INCLUDE DIFFUSION

SEQUENCE</mark>
【2】TECHNIQUE:  Three dimensional time of flight MR arteriography was performed
through the brain with maximum intensity projection reconstructions.

【3】2D time of flight MR angiography of the neck was performed.

【4】Brain imaging was performed with sagittal T1 and axial FLAIR, T2, gradient
echo and diffusion technique.

【5】Three dimensional maximum intensity projection and segmented images were
generated. This report is based on interpretation of all of these images. The
examination was performed using a 1.5T MRI.

【6】COMPARISON:  Prior CT head done ___

【7】FINDINGS: 

【8】MRI Brain:
There is no evidence of hemorrhage, edema, masses, mass effect, midline shift
or infarction.  Mild periventricular and deep white matter T2 and FLAIR
hyperintense changes are most likely sequela of microangiopathy.  The
ventricles and sulci are normal in caliber and configuration.  The pituitary
appears normal.  The craniocervical junction appears normal.  The orbits
appear normal.  Minimal mucosal thickening involving the paranasal sinuses. 
The intracranial arteries demonstrate normal T2 flow voids.  The CP angles
appear normal.

【9】MRA brain: The intracranial vertebral and internal carotid arteries and their
major branches are patent without evidence of stenosis, occlusion, or aneurysm
formation.

【10】MRA neck:  The common, internal and external carotid arteries are patent. 
There is no evidence of internal carotid artery stenosis by NASCET criteria. 
The origins of the vessels are suboptimally visualized, but this is technical
in nature.

【11】IMPRESSION:

【12】1. No intracranial mass, hemorrhage or infarct.
2. Mild periventricular and deep white matter changes are most likely sequela
of microangiopathy.
3.   No intracranial arterial occlusion, marked stenosis or aneurysm
formation.
4. There is no ICA stenosis by NASCET criteria.
5. The vertebral arteries appear patent.

source_info.text:
【0】HISTORY:  ___ woman with 4 mm distal right ureteral stone on prior
images, question of hydro, question of right ureteral jet.

【1】COMPARISON:  Ultrasound and CT from ___.

【2】FINDINGS:

【3】There has been interval resolution of the previously seen right-sided
hydronephrosis.  No evidence of obstructive uropathy on current examination. 
No obvious hydroureter noted proximally or distally, although limited given
the sonographic limitations of the imaging the ureters.  The right kidney
measures 12.2 cm and the left kidney measures 12.2 cm.  There are a few tiny
echogenic foci that are non shadowing scattered along the corticomedullary
regions most notably on the left, measuring up to 4 mm.  These correspond with
the radiopaque nonobstructing tiny renal stones noted on prior CT. 
Additionally, there is a 6 mm anechoic cyst in the mid/lower left kidney.

【4】Urinary bladder is well distended without evidence of wall thickening or
intraluminal debris.  Bilateral urinary jets are seen.

【5】Postvoid images demonstrate postvoid residual of 20 cc.

【6】Incidental note of brightly echogenic liver parenchyma relative to the kidney
echotexture.

【7】IMPRESSION:

【8】1. Resolution of previously seen right hydronephrosis.  No evidence of current
obstructive uropathy.  Several scattered small nonobstructing renal stones are
again seen, most notably on the left.

【9】2. Bilateral urinary jets are seen.

【10】3. The visualized portions of the liver demonstrates increased echogenicity
most consistent with fatty deposition. More advanced liver disease can not be
excluded on this study.

【0】EXAMINATION:  SHOULDER (AP, NEUTRAL AND AXILLARY) TRAUMA RIGHT

【1】INDICATION:  ___ year old woman with R)SHOULDER PAIN  // R)SHOULDER PAIN

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Three views

【3】COMPARISON:  None available.

【4】FINDINGS: 

【5】Soft tissues:  The soft tissues are normal.

【6】Bone mineralization:  The bone mineralization is normal.

【7】Osseous structures:  No fracture or bony abnormality is seen.

【8】Articular surfaces: Mild hypertrophic change of the AC joint is seen.

【9】IMPRESSION: 

【10】Normal examination for age.

【0】INDICATION:  ___ year old man with sudden pain in left lower leg. Please eval
for ankle or lower leg fracture  // ? fracture in lower left leg and ankle

【1】COMPARISON:  Compared to radiographs of the left foot from ___.

【2】IMPRESSION: 

【3】No acute fractures or dislocations are seen. There is a 7 mm lucency within
the medial talar dome which may represent a subchondral cyst or osteochondral
lesion. If there is high concern, this could be further evaluated with CT or
MRI.  Vascular calcifications are seen. There is a calcaneal spur. There is
mild spurring of the anterior aspect of the tibiotalar joint.

【0】CLINICAL HISTORY  ___ year old woman with known aneurysm  // Please evaluate
for known aneurysm *Dr. ___ Please start at 9:30am, Annex bed

【1】EXAMINATION:  Patient had a giant ___ left ICA aneurysm status
post pipe line placement.  She is here for followup diagnostic catheter
angiography.  The following vessels were selectively catheterize injected: 
Left common carotid artery including Three dimensional rotational angiography
and postprocessing on separate work station with concurrent physician
supervision with images being used for final interpretation, right femoral
artery.
ANESTHESIA:  ANESTHESIA: Moderate sedation was provided by administrating
divided doses of 50 mcg of fentanyl and 1 mg of midazolam throughout the total
intra-service time of 20 min, during which the patient's hemodynamic
parameters were continuously monitored by an independent trained radiology
nurse. 1% lidocaine was injected in the skin and subcutaneous tissues
overlying the access site

【2】TECHNIQUE:  OPERATORS:  ___ and Dr. ___ physician
performed the procedure. Dr. ___ supervised the trainee during
the key components of the procedure and has reviewed and agrees with the
trainee's findings.

【3】PROCEDURE:  Patient's brought to the fluoroscopy suite, ID was confirmed via
wrist band.  She is placed supine on fluoroscopy table in a bilateral groins
were prepped and draped in usual sterile manner.  Time-out procedure was
performed per institutional guidelines.  Location the right mid femoral head
was located using anatomic and radiographic landmarks.  Micropuncture kit was
used to gain access to the right femoral artery after infusion of lidocaine
into the subcutaneous tissue.  Serial dilation was undertaken to a short 5
___ groin sheath connected to a continuous heparinized saline flush to be
inserted.  Next a stiff ___ 2 catheter connected to the power injection
also a continuous heparinized saline flush was advanced over the 0.038
glidewire is a reconstituted within left subclavian artery in used to select
the left common carotid artery.  Cervical biplane imaging was undertaken,
followed by intracranial biplane, 3 dimensional rotational angiography with
the with separate processing on a separate 3D workstation for final attending
physician interpretation supervision of the images along with magnified
biplane oblique views.  The catheter was then pulled back into the aorta and
fully removed from the body.  ___ projection of the right femoral artery
demonstrate level groin puncture be suitable for closure device utilization. 
A 6 ___ Angio-Seal was deployed results in excellent hemostasis.  At the
conclusion of the procedure, the patient was at their neurologic baseline
there is no evidence of thromboembolic complication.

【4】FINDINGS: 

【5】Left common carotid artery:  The carotid bifurcations well-visualized, there
is no significant vessel tortuosity or carotid bulb disease.  Of the
intracranial vessels visualized, the distal left ICA, proximal distal MCA and
ACA branches are well-visualized.  In the region of the lacerum ICA, there
continues to be a small remnant of the patient's previously seen giant ICA
aneurysm.  This is in a region where likely the proximal portion of the pipe
line stent, does not fully cover the aneurysm neck.  The remainder the giant
ICA aneurysm is has been completed obliterated otherwise.  There is no
evidence of thrombus formation, turbulent flow, or stenosis within the stents
itself.  No other aneurysms are identified.  Given the small remnant residual
aneurysm at the proximal and of the pipe plane stent, at treatment options
could include conservative observation this point is this is not within the
dura itself and on the occlude the cause significant problems, or deployment
of indicial biplane stem.  Will discuss further with the patient her family
regarding these treatment options.

【6】Right femoral artery, level the groin puncture suitable for closure device
utilization.

【7】IMPRESSION: 

【8】1.  Small remnant aneurysm neck at the proximal portion of the pipe line
construct, this is likely due to the fact that the proximal portion the
aneurysm neck is not fully covered by the flow diversion devices.  This region
is extradural in nature.  We will discuss further with the patient and the
family member with placement of additional pipe line is warranted versus
conservative observation and management.

【9】I, ___, was personally present, supervised common directly available
for all critical portions of the case.  I have reviewed the above images agree
with the findings as stated above.

【0】EXAMINATION:  CT HEAD W/O CONTRAST

【1】INDICATION:  ___ with s/p unwitnessed fall, rule out acute intracranial
process.

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Contiguous axial images of the brain were obtained without
contrast. Coronal and sagittal reformations as well as bone algorithm
reconstructions were provided and reviewed.

【3】DOSE:  Total DLP (Head) = 853 mGy-cm.

【4】COMPARISON:  None.

【5】FINDINGS: 

【6】There is no evidence of acute major infarction, hemorrhage, edema, or  large
mass. There is prominence of the ventricles and sulci suggestive of
involutional changes, age-advanced.  Minimal periventricular white matter
hypodensities are nonspecific, but likely reflect sequelae of chronic small
vessel ischemic disease.

【7】There is no evidence of acute fracture.  Patient is status post repair of a
prior left orbital floor fracture.  There is a small scalp hematoma at the
left frontoparietal region and in the left periorbital region.  Mucosal
thickening of the frontoethmoidal recess and the left ethmoid air cells are
noted.  The remaining visualized portion of the paranasal sinuses, mastoid air
cells, and middle ear cavities are clear.  The visualized portion of the
orbits are unremarkable.

【8】IMPRESSION:

【9】1. No acute intracranial process.
2. Small left frontoparietal hematoma and left periorbital swelling without
acute calvarial fracture.

【0】INDICATION:  History of ERCP and sphincterotomy on ___ for retained
common bile duct stones.  Now with pain reminiscent of prior, evaluate for
retained common bile duct stones or other etiology explaining abdominal pain.

【1】TECHNIQUE:  Multiplanar T1- and T2-weighted images were acquired on a 1.5
Tesla magnet, including dynamic 3D images obtained prior to, during, and after
the uneventful intravenous administration of 0.1 mmol/kg (22 mL) of Magnevist.
An oral solution containing 300 mL of 50% GastroMARK and 450 mL of 50%
Readi-Cat were administered to mark the bowel contents.

【2】COMPARISON:  Abdominal ultrasound from ___.

【3】FINDINGS:  No focal liver lesions are identified.  There is mild central
intrahepatic biliary duct dilatation as well as mild dilatation of the common
duct to 7 mm, although the duct tapers appropriately to the level of the
ampulla.  Within the lower common duct, there is a 1-mm non-obstructing stone
(5:18).  A possible second non-obtructing tiny stone is seen in the more
distal common duct (5:19).  There is no abnormal enhancement surrounding the
intrahepatic biliary ducts or common duct to suggest cholangitis.  The patient
is status post cholecystectomy.  The main pancreatic duct is normal in caliber
and the pancreas is otherwise unremarkable.  The spleen and adrenal glands are
normal appearing.  A 5-mm cyst is seen within the lower right renal pole.  The
kidneys are otherwise unremarkable.  There is no free fluid in the abdomen. 
No pathologically enlarged abdominal lymph nodes are seen.  The abdominal
aorta is normal in caliber, and its main branches are widely patent.  A
dilated left fallopian tube or left adnexal complex cystic lesion is not fully
imaged, but measures 4.1 x 1.9 cm in the coronal plane (2:21).

【4】IMPRESSION:
1.  Mild central intrahepatic and extrahepatic biliary duct dilatation with at
least one non-obstructing stone and possibly two non-obstructing stones in the
distal common duct.  No evidence of cholangitis.

【5】2.  Dilated left fallopian tube or left adnexal complex cystic lesion is not
fully evaluated but measures 4.1 x 1.9 cm.  Further evaluation with pelvic
ultrasound is recommended.

【6】3.  Tiny right lower renal pole cyst.

【7】These findings were reported to Dr. ___ by Dr. ___ at 2:43 p.m. via
telephone on ___.

【0】EXAMINATION:  CT HEAD W/O CONTRAST Q111 CT HEAD

【1】INDICATION:  ___ y/o F with PMH of pAfib on apixaban, MVP/MR, ___
disease, Graves disease s/p ablation with hypothyroidism, osteoporosis who
initially presented as a transfer from ___ for ablation and was then
found to be encephalopathic- unclear whether a change from baseline or not.
Fell with fractures in orbit and frontal sinus with mild ICH.// Worsening of
fractures or subarachnoid hemorrhage?

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Contiguous axial images of the brain were obtained without
contrast. Coronal and sagittal reformations as well as bone algorithm
reconstructions were provided and reviewed.

【3】DOSE:  Acquisition sequence:
   1) Sequenced Acquisition 16.0 s, 17.3 cm; CTDIvol = 46.4 mGy (Head) DLP =
802.7 mGy-cm.
 Total DLP (Head) = 803 mGy-cm.

【4】COMPARISON:  ___ noncontrast head CT.

【5】FINDINGS: 

【6】Overlying hardware streak artifact limits examination.

【7】There has been interval redistribution of the right-sided subarachnoid
hemorrhage to the right frontal sulci (2; 28) with decreased hyperdense blood
products noted in the right sylvian fissure.  There is small dependent
layering hyperdense blood products in the left occipital horn.  No new foci of
hemorrhage.  No large vascular territory infarction.  No midline shift. 
Prominence of ventricles and sulci suggestive of age-related involutional
changes.  Bilateral periventricular subcortical white matter hypodensities are
nonspecific but suggest chronic small vessel ischemic changes.

【8】Again, there is re-demonstration of the minimally displaced right frontal bone
fracture through the right frontal sinus.  Right orbital roof, lateral wall
fracture an comminuted right orbital floor fracture are again noted. 
Minimally displaced right zygomatic bone fractures also noted.

【9】The visualized portion of the mastoid air cells, and middle ear cavities are
clear.  There is trace soft tissue gas in the right lateral extraconal space. 
Large right periorbital swelling and hematoma is slightly increased from
prior.  Right maxillary, bilateral ethmoid air cell, and right frontal sinus
mucosal thickening and/or blood products is present.

【10】IMPRESSION:

【11】1. Overlying hardware streak artifact limits examination.
2. Interval redistribution of the previously seen right sylvian fissure
subarachnoid hemorrhage to the right frontal sulci and to the left ventricular
occipital horn.
3.  Within limits of study, no definite new foci of hemorrhage.

had the incidental finding of the left frontal AVM.  He underwent angiography
and functional MRI at ___.  After review of the films in consideration of his
rupture risk, a plan was made for embolization followed by resection.

【14】ANESTHESIA:  Patient was maintained under general endotracheal anesthesia

and independent observer.

【15】TECHNIQUE:  Embolization left frontal AVM

【16】COMPARISON:  ___ angiogram

【17】PROCEDURE:   The patient was identified and brought to the neuro radiology
suite.  He was transferred to the fluoroscopic table supine.  After smooth
induction general endotracheal anesthesia and placement of a Foley catheter,
bilateral groins were prepped and draped in standard sterile fashion.  A
time-out was performed.  The right common femoral artery was identified using
anatomic and radiographic landmarks.  The right common femoral artery was
accessed using standard micropuncture technique after infiltration of local
anesthetic.  A long 8 ___ sheath was introduced, connected to continuous
heparinized saline flush, and secured.

【18】Next a 125 cm Berenstein catheter was loaded inside a Cook shuttle guide
catheter.  There advanced over exchange length Glidewire through the aorta
into the aortic arch.  The wire was used to select the left internal carotid
artery.  The Berenstein catheter was positioned over the wire into the left
internal carotid artery.  The Cook shuttle guide catheter was positioned
within the left common carotid artery.  The exchange length Glidewire and the
Berenstein catheter were removed.  The guide catheter was double flushed and
connected to continuous heparinized saline flush as well as power injector. 
Vessel patency was confirmed via hand injection.  A roadmap was performed. 
The guide catheter was advanced into the left internal carotid artery over the
038 glidewire map guidance wire was removed.  Vessel patency was confirmed via
hand injection.

【19】The patient was loaded with ___ units of IV heparin.  Baseline and serial
aCTs were obtained the patient was re-dose as necessary to maintain a level
above 200.

【20】The superior roadmap was performed.  An 038 DAC intermediate catheter was
advanced over an echelon microcatheter loaded with a synchro 2 micro wire. 
The micro wire was advanced into the bifurcation the callosum marginal artery.
The DAC was advanced into A3 segment.  Microcatheter micro wire were removed. 
A new high magnification oblique roadmap was performed.

【21】An ___ detachable tip microcatheter was loaded with a Mirage micro wire. 
There advanced under roadmap guidance into the most superior division of the
ACA feeders to the AVM.  Micro wire was removed.  Hand injection through the
microcatheter revealed minimal filling of the AVM and quit shunting to the
vein.  This branch did not seem appropriate for embolization as there was
minimal gain in reduction of AVM nidus with significant risk of shunting to
the venous side.

【22】The micro wire was introduced.  It was then navigated into the next most
superior ACA feeders that was supplying the AVM.  The micro wire was removed. 
Micro injection revealed a more significant portion of the AVM filling.  The
microcatheter was flushed with 6 x 1 cc syringes of heparinized saline and
then prepared with DMSO.  Onyx embolization material was injected using
fluoroscopic guidance. Once there was evidence of a flash of embolic material
into the vein, embolization from this feeder was concluded. The microcatheter
was removed under fluoroscopic guidance after aspiration was applied to the on
Onyx syringe.  The 3 cm tip detached.  Follow-up angiogram was performed via
the guide catheter that showed decrease in flow to the AVM based on the
embolization.  The intermediate catheter was allowed to back bleed to clear
the catheter of any embolic material that remained.

【23】Fresh roadmap was performed.  Fresh ___  catheter was re-loaded with a
mirage wire and advanced into the middle feeder from the ACA to the AVM that
also supplied the anterior portion.  The micro wire was removed.  Micro
injection revealed contrast opacification of the AVM nidus.
The microcatheter was flushed with 6 x 1 cc syringes of heparinized saline and
then prepared with DMSO.  Onyx embolization material was injected using
fluoroscopic guidance. Once there was evidence of a flash of embolic material
into the vein that joined the previous material already in the vein,
embolization from this feeder was concluded. The microcatheter was removed
under fluoroscopic guidance after aspiration was applied to the on Onyx
syringe. The 3 cm tip detached. Follow-up angiogram was performed via the
guide catheter that showed decrease in flow to the AVM based on the
embolization.  The intermediate catheter was allowed to back bleed to clear
the catheter of any embolic material that remained.

【24】A fresh roadmap was performed. Fresh ___ catheter was re-loaded with MRIs
wire and advanced into the inferior feeder from the ACA to the AVM that
supplied the inferior portion of the nidus.  The micro wire was removed. Micro
injection revealed contrast opacification of the AVM nidus. The microcatheter
was flushed with 6 x 1 cc syringes of heparinized saline and then prepared
with DMSO.  Onyx embolization material was injected using fluoroscopic
guidance. Once there was evidence of reflux of embolic material, embolization
from this feeder was concluded. The microcatheter was removed under
fluoroscopic guidance after aspiration was applied to the on Onyx syringe. The
3 cm tip remained fixed to the catheter and was removed from the body
completely.  Follow-up angiogram was performed via the guide catheter that
showed decrease in flow to the AVM based on the embolization.  The
intermediate catheter was allowed to back bleed to clear the catheter of any
embolic material that remained.  Majority of the ACA contribution to AVM was
successfully embolized.  The intermediate catheter was removed.  The guide
catheter was retracted somewhat.  Standard AP and lateral power injections
were performed in order to rule out thromboembolic complications.

【25】The purpose of the intermittent diagnostic angiograms an order to prove the
location and contribution to the AVM as well as to assess for the extent of
embolization.  They were also used to provide baseline for comparison to runs
later the case to rule out thromboembolic complications.

【26】Next the guide catheter was removed.  Right common femoral angiogram was
performed via hand injection through the sheath.  The sheath was removed and
the arteriotomy was closed using a 6 ___ Perclose.  After awakening from
general anesthesia and extubation, the patient was removed from the
fluoroscopy table and remained at his neurologic baseline without any evidence
of thromboembolic complications.

Exodus pigtail catheter into the collection. The plastic stiffener and the

evaluation.
