【7】Pulse volume recordings show symmetrical amplitudes bilaterally, with
flattening at the level of the ankle and metatarsal regions.

【8】IMPRESSION:

【9】Significant bilateral tibial disease at rest, left greater than right.

【0】AP CHEST, 5:34 P.M.

【1】HISTORY:  ___ female with pericardial effusion.

【2】IMPRESSION:  AP chest compared to ___ through ___:

【3】The hugely dilated cardiac silhouette is even larger today than it has been
over the past five days.  Some of this could be due to supine positioning, or
the concurrent pericardial effusion and volume overload since there is more
mediastinal venous engorgement.  Pulmonary vascular plethora, mild pulmonary
edema and increase in the volume of moderate bilateral pleural effusion. 
There is no pneumothorax.  Nasogastric tube ends low in the stomach.  Right
PIC line ends close to the superior cavoatrial junction.  No pneumothorax.

【0】EXAMINATION:  MR CERVICAL SPINE W/O CONTRAST ___ MR ___ SPINE

【1】INDICATION:  C1 anterior arch fracture. Evaluate for ligamentous injury.

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Sagittal imaging was performed with T2, T1, STIR and diffusion
technique.  Axial T2 and gradient echo imaging were next performed.

【3】COMPARISON:  Outside hospital cervical spine CT ___.

【4】FINDINGS: 

【5】Small transverse fragment off the inferior portion of the anterior arch of C1
is better demonstrated on the prior CT examination.  No adjacent bony edema is
visualized.  Vertebral body alignment is preserved.  Vertebral body heights
are preserved. There is no marrow signal abnormality. The visualized portion
of the spinal cord is preserved in signal and caliber.  There is no evidence
of ligamentous injury.

【6】There is mild loss of T2 signal of multiple intervertebral discs.  The
intervertebral disc heights are relatively well preserved.

【7】Within the limits of this noncontrast study there is no evidence of infection
or neoplasm. There is no prevertebral soft tissue swelling. The visualized
portion of the posterior fossa, cervicomedullary junction, paranasal sinuses
and lung apicesare preserved.

【8】 At C2-3 there is no significant spinal canal or neural foraminal narrowing.

【9】At C3-4 there is no significant spinal canal or neural foraminal narrowing.

【10】At C4-5 there is no significant spinal canal or neural foraminal narrowing.

【11】At C5-6 there is no significant spinal canal or neural foraminal narrowing.

【12】At C6-7 there is no significant spinal canal or neural foraminal narrowing.

【13】At C7-T1 there is no significant spinal canal or neural foraminal narrowing.

【14】IMPRESSION:

【15】1. Small well corticated fragment off the inferior portion of the anterior
arch of C1 is better characterized on the prior CT examination.  No bone
marrow or soft tissue edema is seen within this area.  Given the appearance,
this likely represents a variant accessory ossicle of the anterior arch of C1,
rather than fracture.  No abnormal ligamentous or soft tissue signal is seen
at the craniocervical junction to indicate acute injury.
2. Otherwise no evidence of fracture or ligamentous injury.
3. No cord signal abnormality.
4. Significant spinal canal or neural foraminal narrowing.

【0】EXAMINATION:  MRI abdominal wall without contrast.

【1】INDICATION:  Unspecified abdominal pain  Workers comp ___
___- ___ DOCTORS ___ CASE ___.
INJURY DATE ___// Unspecified abdominal pain. Check for sports hernia or
oblique muscle injury .  Review of prior imaging studies indicates history of
GIST tumor of the stomach status post gastrectomy.  Now with vague abdominal
and right flank pain.

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Multiplanar, multisequence MR imaging of the right ventral
abdominal wall.  No intravenous contrast was administered.

【3】COMPARISON:  Targeted review of CT abdomen and pelvis ___

【4】FINDINGS: 

【5】The area of pain at the right anterolateral abdominal wall is outlined by
multiple skin markers.  The underlying abdominal wall musculature including
the right external and internal oblique muscles as well as transversus
abdominus are within normal limits, without soft tissue edema to suggest
muscle strain.  There is some motion artifact seen in the overlying
subcutaneous and underlying abdominal fat in this area.  Allowing for this,
the fat surrounding muscle is within normal limits.  No focal soft tissue
edema, focal soft tissue collection, encapsulated fatty mass, or non-fatty
soft tissue mass is detected in this area.

【6】Mild fatty infiltration/fatty atrophy of the inferior aspect of the right of
the inferior right rectus abdominus muscle is present (03:48, 03:40) and there
is evidence of prior midline abdominal surgery.

【7】Limited assessment of the kidney shows are multiple partially exophytic cysts
within the right kidney, measuring up to 2.9 cm in the lower pole.  These are
not fully evaluated on this study due to motion artifact and lack of IV
contrast, but appear unchanged compared with ___ CT scan.  Mild
right perinephric fat stranding is noted, similar to the ___ CT
scan.  Subcentimeter left renal cysts in the small included portion of the
left kidney are also noted, in keeping with findings on the previous CT. 
Small renal calculi would not be present on this examination.

【8】Bilateral adrenal glands demonstrate normal morphology and signal intensity.

【9】The visualized unenhanced liver appears grossly unremarkable.  There is no
intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation.  The gallbladder contains multiple
layering gallstones within the neck.  There is no pericholecystic fluid.

【10】Atherosclerotic plaque is noted in the abdominal aorta.

【11】Limited assessment of visualized small and large bowel is grossly
unremarkable.  No evidence of bowel obstruction.  The stomach is not
effectively evaluated on this examination.

【12】The partially imaged portions of the thoracic and lumbar spine also appear
grossly unremarkable.

【13】IMPRESSION:

【14】1. Structures of the right anterolateral abdominal wall, including the right
lateral abdominal wall musculature, are within normal limits.  No muscle edema
to suggest strain or contusion.
2. Cholelithiasis without evidence to suggest cholecystitis.
3. Multiple bilateral renal cysts, measuring up to 2.9 cm in the right lower
pole, unchanged compared with CT dated ___.

【15】RECOMMENDATION(S):  Please note that current examination was targeted to
evaluation of the symptomatic area in the right abdominal wall.  If there is
continued clinical concern for athletic pubalgia/sports hernia, then dedicated
sports hernia pelvic MRI is recommended.

【0】EXAMINATION:  LIVER OR GALLBLADDER US (SINGLE ORGAN)

【1】INDICATION:  ___ year old woman with rising transaminitis and Tbili since
getting her CT torso. Bedside US with increased wall thickness.  Cholecystitis
or obstruction?

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Grey scale and color Doppler ultrasound images of the abdomen were
obtained.

【3】COMPARISON:  CT torso of ___.

【4】FINDINGS: 

【5】LIVER: The hepatic parenchyma appears within normal limits. The contour of the
liver is smooth. There is no focal liver mass. The main portal vein is patent
with hepatopetal flow. There is no ascites.

【6】BILE DUCTS: There is no intrahepatic biliary dilation. The CBD measures 2 mm.

【7】GALLBLADDER: Two shadowing echogenic gallstones are identified in the
gallbladder fundus.  There is no gallbladder distention, wall thickening, or
pericholecystic fluid.

【8】PANCREAS: The imaged portion of the pancreas appears within normal limits,
without masses or pancreatic ductal dilation, with portions of the pancreatic
head and tail obscured by overlying bowel gas.

【9】KIDNEYS:  Limited views of the right kidney show no hydronephrosis.

【10】RETROPERITONEUM:  The visualized portions of aorta and IVC are within normal
limits.

【11】IMPRESSION: 

【12】1.  Cholelithiasis without gallbladder wall thickening, distention, or
pericholecystic fluid.
2.  No evidence of intrahepatic biliary dilatation.  Normal caliber CBD.

【0】EXAMINATION:  CT CHEST W/O CONTRAST

【1】INDICATION:  ___ year old man with CLL// Interval assessment for disease
progression/stability

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Multidetector helical scanning of the chest was performed without
intravenous contrast agent reconstructed as contiguous 5- and 1.25-mm thick
axial, 2.5-mm thick coronal and parasagittal, and 8 x 8 mm MIPs axial images.

【3】COMPARISON:  CT chest without contrast dated ___

【4】FINDINGS: 

【5】BASE OF NECK: Visualized portions of the base of the neck show no abnormality.

【6】HEART AND VASCULATURE: 4.3 cm ascending thoracic aorta and 3.2 cm descending
thoracic aorta are ectatic, unchanged from ___.  No focal thoracic
aneurysm. Moderate calcific atherosclerosis of the thoracic aorta, unchanged. 
Mild coronary artery and aortic valvular calcifications, unchanged.  Mild
cardiomegaly. The pericardium and great vessels are otherwise within normal
limits. No pericardial effusion is seen.

【7】AXILLA, HILA, AND MEDIASTINUM: Interval increase in number and size of
bilateral axillary lymph nodes compared to ___, measuring up to 1.2
cm.  No compromise of the major axillary vascular structures. Borderline
mediastinal lymphadenopathy, measuring up to 1 cm is unchanged.  No
mediastinal mass.  Evaluation for hilar lymph nodes is limited due to the lack
of intravenous contrast, but there is no gross hilar contour abnormality to
suggest lymphadenopathy.

【8】PLEURAL SPACES: No pleural effusion or pneumothorax.

【9】LUNGS/AIRWAYS: The airways are patent to the level of the segmental bronchi
bilaterally.  The lumen of the lobar bronchi are small, which may predispose
the patient towards bronchomalacia.  Mild bibasilar atelectasis.  Lungs are
clear without masses or areas of parenchymal opacification.

【10】SOFT TISSUE OF THE CHEST CAGE: No suspicious lesions identified.

【11】BONES: No suspicious osseous abnormality. There is no acute fracture.

【12】ABDOMEN:  Please refer to same day report on CT abdomen and pelvis for
description of subdiaphragmatic findings.

【13】IMPRESSION:

【14】1. Mild interval increase in number and size of bilateral axial lymph nodes,
measuring up to 1.2 cm, with no compromise of the major axillary vascular
structures.
2. Unchanged ectatic ascending and descending thoracic aorta with no focal
thoracic aneurysm.
3.  Please refer to same day report on CT abdomen and pelvis for description
of subdiaphragmatic findings.

【0】EXAMINATION:  CHEST (PORTABLE AP)

【1】INDICATION:  ___ year old man with SAH// Evaluate ETT position and for any
pulmonary congestion, edema or signs of pneumonia

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Portable chest AP.

【3】COMPARISON:  Multiple chest radiographs, most recent dated ___.  CTA
of the chest from ___ was also reviewed.

【4】FINDINGS: 

【5】Sternotomy wires are intact.  Endotracheal tube projects 4-5 cm above the
carina.  Nasogastric tube projects over the left upper quadrant.  Central
pulmonary vascular congestion with mild interstitial edema.  Trace right
pleural effusion.  No focal consolidation.  No pneumothorax. 
Cardiomediastinal silhouette is unchanged.

【6】IMPRESSION: 

【7】Central pulmonary vascular congestion with mild interstitial edema.

【0】SINGLE AP PORTABLE VIEW OF THE CHEST

【1】REASON FOR EXAM:  Status post VATS.

【2】Comparison is made with prior study ___.

【3】There are two new right chest tubes.  There is a small right pneumothorax. 
The cardiomediastinum is slightly shifted towards the right side.

【4】There is mild subcutaneous emphysema.  The left lateral CP angle was not
included on the film.  The left lung is grossly clear.  Cardiac size is
normal.  There is no change in the heterogeneous opacities in the right lung
with fibrotic appearance, nodular and a mid lung peripheral opacity.  Right
pleural effusion is small.

【0】INDICATION:  ___ year old woman with a ruptured anterior communicating aneurysm
s/p stent-mediated coiling. Evaluate for vaspospasm.

【1】TECHNIQUE:  Following an noncontrast head CT, axial multidetector CT images of
the head were obtained during intravenous contrast administration.  Maximal
intensity projection reformatted images, curved reformatted images, and 3D
volume rendered angiographic reformatted images were obtained and reviewed.

【2】DOSE:  DLP 1511 mGy cm

【3】COMPARISON:  Noncontrast head CT ___. Head and neck CTA ___.

【4】FINDINGS:

【5】NONCONTRAST HEAD CT  Streak artifact from the coil pack in the treated
anterior communicating artery aneurysm limits evaluation of the adjacent
levels.  Parenchymal hemorrhage in the posterior inferior right frontal lobe
is stable in size with possible slight decrease in density.  Subarachnoid
hemorrhage in the right greater than left sulci and in the right sylvian
fissure is stable. Small left subdural hematoma has decreased. 
Intraventricular blood has decreased in extent and density, but remains
present in the bodies and occipital horns of both lateral ventricles.  The
ventricles are stable in size. Right frontal approach ventriculostomy catheter
terminates near the right foramen of ___, unchanged.

【6】There is no evidence for new intracranial hemorrhage or acute major vascular
territorial infarction.

【7】Mucosal thickening and wall thickening is again seen in the maxillary sinuses,
indicating sequela of chronic inflammation.  There is persistent fluid with
aerosolized secretions and mucosal thickening in the sphenoid sinuses, as well
as fluid in bilateral mastoid air cells and middle ear cavities, which may be
related to prolonged supine positioning in the inpatient setting. Nasogastric
tube is partially visualized in the right naris and nasopharynx.

【8】HEAD CTA  Compared to ___, there is no change in the caliber of the
major intracranial arteries to suggest vasospasm.

【9】Calcified plaque is again seen in bilateral carotid siphons with some degree
of narrowing of the supraclinoid right internal carotid artery.

【10】Congenital hypoplasia of the A1 segment of the right anterior cerebral artery
is again seen.  There is are new small metallic densities in the mid A1
segment of the left anterior cerebral artery and in the proximal A2 segment of
the left anterior cerebral artery, consistent with the edges of the Neuroform
stent. Evaluation of the distal A1 segment of the left anterior cerebral
artery is limited by artifacts, but it appears patent. Bilateral A2 segments
are patent and unchanged in caliber.

【11】No flow-limiting stenosis is seen in the middle cerebral arteries or in the
posterior circulation. No additional aneurysm is seen.

【12】Major dural venous sinuses appear patent.

【13】IMPRESSION:

【14】1. Unchanged right frontal parenchymal hemorrhage and bilateral subarachnoid
hemorrhage compared to ___. Decreased small left subdural hematoma.
2. Decreased intraventricular hemorrhage. Stable ventricular size and stable
position of the ventriculostomy catheter.
3. No evidence for vasospasm.
4. Evaluation of the distal A1 segment of the left anterior cerebral artery is
limited by artifacts, but it appears patent. Bilateral A2 segments of the
cerebral arteries are patent.

【0】EXAMINATION:  CHEST PORT. LINE PLACEMENT

【1】INDICATION:  ___ year old woman with new left IJ  // left IJ placement  Contact
name: ___: ___

【2】COMPARISON:  ___, 05:10

【3】IMPRESSION: 

【4】As compared to the previous radiograph, the patient has received the new left
internal jugular vein catheter.  The course of the catheter is unremarkable,
the tip projects over the median, in the brachiocephalic vein.  No evidence of
complications, notably no pneumothorax. The appearance of the lung parenchyma,
the cardiac silhouette and the other monitoring and support devices is
constant.

【0】EXAMINATION:  TIB/FIB (AP AND LAT) LEFT

【1】INDICATION:  left tibia fx // eval fx

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Three views of the left tibia and fibula.

【3】COMPARISON:  Radiograph from ___ and ___.

【4】FINDINGS: 

【5】There is stable appearance of healed left distal tibial and fibular shaft
fractures. Ghost tracts are seen in the distal tibia. There are no new
fractures or dislocations are noted. Medial slant of the talar dome is similar
to prior exam. No new suspicious lytic or sclerotic osseous lesions are seen.

【6】IMPRESSION: 

【7】Stable appearance of healed distal tibia and fibula fractures.

【0】INDICATION:  ___ male maintained on Coumadin for atrial fibrillation
and history of CVA who was sent in from the nursing home with dark tarry
stools, course c/b aspiration.// evaluate for new aspiration pneumonia

【1】TECHNIQUE:  AP portable chest radiograph

【2】COMPARISON:  ___ from earlier in the day

【3】FINDINGS: 

【4】Low bilateral lung volumes.  The tip of the left PICC line projects over the
upper right atrium.  The enteric tube has been removed.

【5】Low bilateral lung volumes with unchanged consolidation in the left lower
lobe.  No pleural effusion or pneumothorax is identified.  The size of the
cardiac silhouette is unchanged.

【6】IMPRESSION: 

【7】The enteric tube has been removed.  Unchanged left lower lobe consolidations.

【0】STUDY:  Right hand, ___.

【1】CLINICAL HISTORY:  Traumatic amputation to second through fourth digits.

【2】FINDINGS:  Comparison is made to previous study from ___.

【3】There are percutaneous pins through the second and third distal fingers. 
There is traumatic amputation of the third digit at the middle phalanx and of
the fourth digit at the PIP joint. Fine bony detail is markedly limited by the
overlying cast and splint material.  Degenerative changes of the first CMC
joint are also noted.

【0】EXAMINATION:  CHEST (PORTABLE AP)

【1】INDICATION:  ___ year old man s/p MIE// eval for interval change

【2】IMPRESSION: 

【3】In comparison with the study of ___, the cardiomediastinal silhouette
is stable, as is the overall appearance of the heart and lungs.  Right chest
tube remains in place and there is no evidence of pneumothorax.
The left hemidiaphragm is not well seen, with the retrocardiac opacification
consistent with volume loss in the left lower lobe.
The left subcutaneous gas is essentially unchanged, as is the subcutaneous gas
along the right lateral chest wall.

【0】EXAMINATION:  CHEST PORT. LINE PLACEMENT

【1】INDICATION:  ___ year old woman with new PICC// New Rt. ___. 38cm PICC  
Contact name: ___: ___

【2】TECHNIQUE:  AP portable chest radiograph

【3】COMPARISON:  CT chest dated ___

【4】FINDINGS: 

【5】The tip of the right PICC projects over the cavoatrial junction.  There is no
pneumothorax.  Small bilateral pleural effusions are present with subjacent
atelectasis/consolidation, right greater than left.  Pulmonary vascular
congestion is new since prior.  The size of the cardiac silhouette is enlarged
and the thoracic aorta is noted to be tortuous.

【6】IMPRESSION: 

【7】The tip of the new right PICC projects over the cavoatrial junction.

【8】New pulmonary vascular congestion as well as relatively unchanged pleural
effusions and subjacent atelectasis/consolidations bilaterally.

【0】HISTORY:  Cough.

【1】COMPARISON:  ___.

【2】FINDINGS:

【3】PA and lateral views of chest demonstrate clear lungs.  The aorta is very
tortuous.  There is no pneumothorax or pleural effusion.  There is no
pulmonary edema.  Lung volumes are lower today and then 2 days prior.  Minimal
left lower lobe atelectasis is again present.

【4】IMPRESSION:

【5】No evidence of pneumonia.

【0】INDICATION:  ___ female with infective endocarditis, CT head of
___ exhibits a questionable new focus of cerebritis versus early abscess,
further evaluation is needed by MRI.

【1】TECHNIQUE:  Multiplanar, multisequence MRI of the brain was obtained before
and after the administration of IV gadolinium as per departmental protocol.

【2】COMPARISON:  MRI of ___ and CT scan non-contrast of ___.

【3】FINDINGS:  When compared to the prior MRI examination, again noted are
multiple T2/FLAIR foci throughout the brain, however, the majority of them
have had an interval decrease in FLAIR signal, a few of them have almost
resolved.  Their difference in FLAIR signal particularly in the focus along
the splenium of the corpus callosum suggests different acuities with some foci
more recent than others. A few of them demonstrate more intense high signal in
the gradient echo sequence with associated high signal in the T1-weighted
images consistent with late subacute blood products.  

【4】The area of concern in the recent CT scan correlates to one of the abnormal
foci of high FLAIR/T2 signal in the left cerebellum consistent with evolving
encephalomalacia. This focus also exhibits decreased FLAIR intensity when
directly compared to the prior examination.  There is no evidence of new
lesions.  There is no evidence of abnormal signal in the ADC map or abnormal
enhancement.

【5】The paranasal sinuses are well aerated.  There is partial fluid within both
mastoid air cells, mildly improved since the prior examination of ___.  

【6】IMPRESSION:

【7】1.  Evolution of multiple abnormal FLAIR foci, in keeping with infarcts,
throughout the brain parenchyma with some of them demonstrating more apparent
hemorrhagic components.  Different degrees of decreased FLAIR intensity
involving some of the multiple infarcts.  No evidence of acute infarct.

【8】2.  The area of concern corresponds to expected evolution of a focal infarct
within the left cerebellum. No evidence of abnormal enhancement.

【0】CT ABDOMEN AND PELVIS ON ___

【1】CLINICAL HISTORY:  UTIs, question hydro.

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Helical acquisition of CT images performed from the lung bases
through the ischial tuberosities following the administration of both oral and
approximately 130 cc of intravenous non-ionic contrast.  Comparison made to
prior study of ___.  Coronal and sagittal reformats also provided.

【3】FINDINGS:

【4】ABDOMEN:  Visualized lung bases are clear.  Visualized heart size is within
normal limits.  There is a small hiatal hernia.  A gastrostomy tube is
appropriately located.  There is a large gallstone within a non-dilated
gallbladder.  Liver, spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands remain normal in
appearance.  Vascular structures are patent with extensive atherosclerotic
calcifications of the aortoiliac system.  There is an IVC filter within the
infrarenal IVC.  Kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically.  There is
a left renal cyst measuring approximately 1.7 cm.  Small, subcentimeter right
renal hypodensity too small to thoroughly characterize.

【5】PELVIS:  The bowel loops are unremarkable, with a normal appendix seen in the
right lower quadrant.  There are no dilated loops or bowel wall thickening. No
suspicious lymphadenopathy is seen within the abdomen or pelvis.  Foley
catheter is seen with its balloon inflated, at the bladder base, or perhaps
slightly proximal within the urethra.  Verification of proper placement is
advised.

【6】There is soft tissue anasarca within the lower extremities and the ischial
region, with soft tissue defects and more focal areas of inflammation in both
the sacral region and the right ischial tuberosity, which are likely related
to decubitus ulcers.  There is induration of the underlying skin and
subcutaneous tissues, but no gas in the soft tissues.  Additionally, there is
bony demineralization, and although there is no frank erosive process, there
are areas of possible cortical erosion seen within the right ischial
tuberosity and femoral head, best seen on series 3, image 76.

【7】IMPRESSION:
1.  No significant abnormality within the abdomen or pelvis.  Cholelithiasis.
2.  Sacral decubitus and right ischial tuberosity ulcers with underlying
induration and edema within the soft tissues.  Suggestion of cortical erosion
involving the right femoral head and ischial tuberosity.  If there is a
clinical concern for osteomyelitis, MRI would be advised for further
evaluation.

【0】PA AND LATERAL CHEST, ___

【1】HISTORY:  Chest tube pulled.  Evaluate for possible new pneumothorax.

【2】IMPRESSION:
PA and lateral chest compared to ___ through ___ at 5:17 a.m.

【3】Tiny volume of right apical pleural air, and small if any right pleural
effusion have not changed since ___ following removal of the right
apical pleural tube.  Greater atelectasis at the lung bases is stable since
earlier in the day.  The heart is top normal in size, and there is some mild
pulmonary vascular engorgement, though no frank pulmonary edema.  Mediastinum
and trachea have a normal postoperative appearance.

source_info.text:
【0】INDICATION:  Pain evaluation.

【1】COMPARISON:  ___.

【2】PELVIS AND RIGHT HIP, THREE VIEWS:  Again seen is diffuse multiple sclerosis
of the visualized lumbar spine, pelvis, left proximal femur and remaining
right proximal femur.  Again seen is a right hemiarthroplasty.  There is no
periprosthetic lucency.

【3】IMPRESSION:  Essentially unchanged radiographic study of the pelvis and right
hip demonstrating extensive diffuse osseous metastatic disease and right
hemiarthroplasty with no apparent hardware complication.

【0】EXAMINATION:  CHEST (PA AND LAT)

【1】INDICATION:  ___ with R shoulder and chest wall pain, s/p fall

【2】COMPARISON:  None

【3】FINDINGS: 

【4】PA and lateral views of the chest provided.

【5】There is no focal consolidation, effusion, or pneumothorax. The
cardiomediastinal silhouette is normal.  Cortical irregularity along the
superior margin of the right clavicular midshaft is compatible with a
minimally displaced longitudinally oriented acute fracture better assessed on
same-day CT C-spine.

【6】IMPRESSION: 

【7】Fracture involving the right clavicle.  No acute intrathoracic process.

【0】INDICATION:  ___ male with APL on ATRA and steroids, now with two days
of sharp shoulder pain and decreased range of motion, most prominently at the
supraspinatus insertion.  Please evaluate for tendinitis or avascular necrosis
of the humeral head.

【1】COMPARISON:  Chest radiograph from ___.

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Multiplanar T1- and T2-weighted imaging of the right shoulder was
performed on a 1.5 Tesla magnet without intravenous contrast.

【3】MRI OF THE RIGHT SHOULDER:  There is thickening and high signal surrounding
the distal infraspinatus, and there is focal tear in the posterior aspect of
the infraspinatus tendon.  Edema extends from this area along the teres minor,
and into the quadrilateral space, and there is also a tear along the distal
insertion of the teres minor.

【4】There is also thickening and globular high signal in the distal aspect of the
supraspinatus tendon, most consistent with tendinopathy.  The subscapularis
tendon is intact.  There is a minimal amount of fluid surrounding of the long
head of the biceps, which is intact.

【5】There is a small amount of fraying in the superior glenoid labrum, most
consistent with degenerative change.  There is no sign of displaced tear on
this non-arthrographic study.

【6】Visualized marrow signal is markedly heterogeneous, with fatty replacement,
most consistent with marrow stimulating therapy.  There is moderate
osteoarthritic change at the acromioclavicular joint, with capsular
hypertrophy.  There is also mild osteoarthritic change, with joint space
narrowing and cartilage thinning at the glenohumeral joint.  Other surrounding
soft tissues are unremarkable.

【7】IMPRESSION:

【8】1.  No evidence of avascular necrosis.

【9】2.  Tears in the infraspinatus and teres minor tendons near their insertions.
Distal supraspinatus tendinopathy.

without contrast material.  Next, rapid axial imaging was performed through

sulci. There is a stable minimal midline shift towards the left by
approximately 3 mm with minimal mass effect and effacement of the frontal horn
of right lateral ventricle, unchanged.  There is slight interval decrease in
the amount of extra-axial pneumocephalus.

【7】No acute intracranial infarct or mass is seen.

【8】The visualized portion of the paranasal sinuses,mastoid air cells, and middle
ear cavities are clear. The visualized portion of the orbits are unremarkable.

There is atherosclerotic calcification of bilateral internal carotid arteries,
especially of the supraclinoid ICAs bilaterally causing at least 50% stenosis.
Question approximately 2 mm left supra clinoid internal carotid artery
aneurysm versus infundibulum .  The vessels of the circle of ___
and their principal intracranial branches appear normal with no evidence of
stenosis, or occlusion. The dural venous sinuses are patent.  Incidentally
seen is prominent right vertebral artery.

【11】1. Interval accumulation of right frontoparietal subdural hematoma as
described, with stable approximately 3 mm right to left midline shift. 
Recommend clinical correlation and attention on followup imaging.
2. Stable postsurgical changes related to prior right frontoparietal
craniotomy.
3. Patent circle of ___.  No evidence of basilar artery thrombosis.
4. Question approximately 2 mm left supra clinoid internal carotid artery
infundibulum versus aneurysm as described.  Recommend clinical correlation and
attention on followup imaging.

【12】RECOMMENDATION(S):  Recommend clinical correlation and attention on followup
imaging.

【0】INDICATION:  ___ year old woman with long standing aggressive rheumatoid
arthritis  // RA changes

【1】COMPARISON:  Radiographs from ___.

【2】IMPRESSION: 

【3】Left hand:  There is extensive demineralization. There is severe subluxation/
dislocation at several of the MTP joints. However, there is no significant
erosions. There is joint space narrowing several of the MCP joints worse of
the first and third digits. No acute fractures are identified.

【4】Right hand: There is also extensive demineralization. Similar to the left
hand, there is also severe subluxation/dislocation of several of the MCP
joints. Degenerative changes of the first CMC joint and several of the DIP and
PIP joints are present, slightly progressed since the previous study. There is
a paucity of erosions ; however the MCP joints are narrowed. No acute
fractures are seen.

【0】CHEST RADIOGRAPH PERFORMED ON ___.

【1】Compared with a prior study from earlier today.

【2】CLINICAL HISTORY:  ___ with fever and chest pain.

【3】FINDINGS:  PA and lateral views of the chest are obtained.  A catheter
overlies the upper abdomen.  Surgical clips are noted in the right upper
quadrant.  The lungs remain clear bilaterally demonstrating no evidence of
pneumonia or CHF.  Cardiomediastinal silhouette is normal.  No pleural
effusion or pneumothorax is seen.  Osseous structures appear intact.  Gaseous
distention of bowel loops in the upper abdomen is noted.

【4】IMPRESSION:  No acute intrathoracic process.  Gaseous distention of bowel in
the upper abdomen.  Recommend clinical correlation.

【0】EXAM:  CT neck with contrast.

【1】INDICATION:  ___ male with a history of right vocal paresis.  This
examination is performed to assess for lesion along the right recurrent
laryngeal nerve.

【2】COMPARISON:  Chest CTs from ___ and ___.

【3】TECHNIQUE:  Multidetector axial CT images were obtained through the soft
tissues of the neck following the administration of intravenous contrast. 
Coronal and sagittal images were reformatted from the source data.

【4】FINDINGS:  There is no neck mass or pathologically enlarged cervical lymph
nodes.  The bilateral parotid glands, submandibular glands and sublingual
glands and spaces are normal.  

【5】Structures of the nasopharynx and oropharynx are symmetric.  There is slight
medialization of the right vocal fold, but partial effacement of the right
piriform sinus.

【6】Scarring is present at both lung apices.  Non calcified 4 mm left upper lobe
and 5 mm right upper lobe pulmonary nodules are unchanged since ___.
There is calcified and noncalcified plaque at the aortic arch.  Cervical spine
degenerative changes are noted.

【7】IMPRESSION:  
1.  No finding to explain right vocal cord paresis. No neck mass or enlarged
lymph nodes.
2.  5 mm right upper lobe and 4 mm left upper lobe nodules which can be
reimaged after ___ to confirm ___ year stability as previously
recommended.

【0】EXAMINATION:  ABDOMEN US (COMPLETE STUDY)

【1】INDICATION:  ___ year old woman 9+ weeks pregnant with N/V and epigastric, LUQ,
and L thoracic pain // please do upper abdominal ultrasound (include liver,
spleen, kidneys). eval for pyelonephritis, hydronephrosis, hepatobiliary
pathology

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Grey scale and color Doppler ultrasound images of the abdomen were
obtained.

【3】COMPARISON:  None.

【4】FINDINGS: 

【5】LIVER: The hepatic parenchyma appears within normal limits.  The contour of
the liver is smooth.  There is no focal liver mass.  The main portal vein is
patent with hepatopetal flow.  There is no ascites.

【6】BILE DUCTS: There is no intrahepatic biliary dilation.  The CHD measures 3 mm.

【7】GALLBLADDER: There is no evidence of stones or gallbladder wall thickening.

【8】PANCREAS: The imaged portion of the pancreas appears within normal limits,
without masses or pancreatic ductal dilation, with portions of the pancreatic
tail obscured by overlying bowel gas.

【9】SPLEEN: Normal echogenicity, measuring 9.3 cm.  A small amount of perisplenic
fluid is also noted incidentally.

【10】KIDNEYS: The right kidney measures 11.8 cm.  There is a small amount of
retroperitoneal perinephric fluid around the right kidney, which may be
sequela of forniceal rupture from prior hydronephrosis, although no
hydronephrosis is seen on today's exam.  The left kidney measures 12.3 cm. 
Normal cortical echogenicity and corticomedullary differentiation is seen
bilaterally.  There is no evidence of masses, stones, or hydronephrosis in the
kidneys.

【11】RETROPERITONEUM:  The visualized portions of aorta and IVC are within normal
limits.

【12】IMPRESSION:

【13】1. Small amount of retroperitoneal perinephric fluid is seen surrounding the
right kidney, which may be sequela of forniceal rupture from prior
hydronephrosis.  However, no definite hydronephrosis seen on today's study.
2. Small amount of nonspecific perisplenic fluid is also noted.

【14】RECOMMENDATION(S):  If symptoms persist, an interval follow up ultrasound
could be obtained for further evaluation.

【0】INDICATION:  ___ w/ PMHx significant for HTN, HLD who presented to ___ with
a SAH ___ ruptured left supraclinoid carotid ophthalmic aneurysm now s/p
angio-embolization and who is admitted to the SICU for further monitoring. Her
early postoperative course has been complicated by traumatic posterior optic
neuritis.  Now with evolving strokes and persistent vasospasm.  // eval for
free air/sbo

【1】TECHNIQUE:  Portable supine abdominal radiograph was obtained.

【2】COMPARISON:  None.

【3】FINDINGS: 

【4】Gas-filled loops of mildly distended small and large bowel are consistent with
mild ileus.  Within the limitations of the supine assessment, there is no
gross pneumoperitoneum.

【5】Osseous structures are unremarkable. There are no unexplained soft tissue
calcifications or radiopaque foreign bodies.

【6】IMPRESSION: 

【7】Mild ileus. No obstruction.  No free air.

【0】EXAMINATION:  MR HEAD W/O CONTRAST

【1】INDICATION:  ___ year old man with good health but recent cognitive decline. 
Progressive memory and other cognitive impairment.

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Sagittal T1 weighted, sagittal MP RAGE with multiplanar
reformations, and axial T2 weighted, FLAIR, gradient echo, and
diffusion-weighted images of the brain were obtained.

【3】COMPARISON:  None.

【4】FINDINGS: 

【5】There is extensive susceptibility artifact from the region of the oral cavity,
presumably related to dental amalgam, which limits evaluation of the inferior
frontal lobes on diffusion weighted and gradient echo images.  Elsewhere in
the brain, there is no evidence for diffusion abnormality or blood products.

【6】There is no evidence for edema or mass effect in the brain parenchyma.  There
are scattered T2 hyperintense foci in the subcortical, deep, and
periventricular white matter of the cerebral hemispheres, which are
nonspecific but likely sequela of mild chronic small vessel ischemic disease
in this age group.  There also prominent perivascular spaces in the basal
ganglia and deep white matter.

【7】There is moderate global parenchymal volume loss with associated prominence of
the ventricles and sulci, which appears age-appropriate.  No disproportionate
medial temporal volume loss is seen.

【8】Major intravascular flow voids appear grossly preserved.

【9】There is a small focus of dependent mucosal thickening versus a mucous
retention cyst in the inferior left frontal sinus.  There is mild mucosal
thickening in bilateral anterior ethmoid air cells.

【10】Sagittal images demonstrate apparent narrowing of the included upper cervical
spinal canal at C2 and C2-C3, incompletely evaluated, with an apparent
lordotic curvature of the cervical spinal cord at C2.

【11】IMPRESSION:

【12】1. Moderate global parenchymal volume loss, which appears age-appropriate.  No
disproportionate medial temporal volume loss is seen.
2. Mild supratentorial white matter signal abnormalities are nonspecific but
likely sequela of mild chronic small vessel ischemic disease in this age
group.
3. Apparent upper cervical spinal canal narrowing, incompletely evaluated.

【13】RECOMMENDATION(S):
If clinically warranted, the cervical spinal canal could be assessed by
dedicated MRI of the cervical spine.

【0】INDICATION:  ___ male with brain mass, status post stereotactic
biopsy.  Please evaluate post-operative appearance.

【1】COMPARISON:  CT from ___, and MRI from ___.

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Non-contrast head CT.

【3】FINDINGS:  Patient is status post left frontal craniotomy and stereotactic
biopsy, and small amount of pneumocephalus and expected post-surgical change
is seen in the region of the biopsied left frontal hypodense lesion.  There is
no large intracranial hemorrhage.  There is no new edema or mass effect. There
is no evidence of acute vascular territorial infarction.  Ventricles and sulci
are unchanged in size and configuration. Small focus of coritcal discontinuity
in the right jugular foramen is unchanged since ___. (series 3a,
im 7) Paranasal sinuses are normally aerated. Mild soft tissue swelling
overlies the craniotomy site in the left scalp.

【4】IMPRESSION:  Status post stereotactic biopsy of left frontal hypodense lesion,
with expected pneumocephalus and mild post-surgical change.

【0】STUDY:  Abdominal ultrasound.

【1】INDICATION:  ___ male with a history of nephrectomy for RCC.  Patient
presenting with weight loss.  Assess for recurrence.

【2】COMPARISONS:  Ultrasound report from ___.

【3】FINDINGS:  The liver is normal in echotexture.  No focal lesions are
identified.  The head and body of the pancreas appear unremarkable.  The tail
is obscured secondary to overlying bowel gas.  The aorta is of normal caliber
throughout.  There is a small amount of isoechoic material present within the
gallbladder that appears dependent on real-time scanning and most likely
represents sludge.  The gallbladder is not distended and the common bile duct
measures 3 mm in diameter.  The patient is status post right nephrectomy and
views of the nephrectomy bed are unremarkable.  The left kidney measures 9.4
cm.  There are several, irregularly shaped hypoechoic areas within the left
kidney.  The largest of these irregularly shaped hypoechoic areas is located
approximately in the mid pole of the left kidney and measures 2.2 x 1.7 x 1.4
cm.  Another hypoechoic area located in the upper pole of the left kidney and
measures approximately 1.6 x 1.0 cm and contains a small focus of abnormal
color flow.  By report, these cystic, hypoechoic areas appear new or larger.
There is no hydronephrosis or renal stone present.

【4】IMPRESSION:  Multiple irregular cystic structures present throughout the left
kidney that appear increased in size and number compared to the written report
from ___.  This examination will be requested to be uploaded to PACS and a
comparison more directly could then be made.  As at least one of these
irregularly shaped areas contains abnormal blood flow, given the patient's
history of renal cell carcinoma, these findings are suspicious for disease
recurrence within the left kidney and further evaluation by MRI or CT is
recommended.

【5】These findings were discussed with Dr. ___ at approximately 4:15 p.m. on
___ by Dr. ___ the telephone.

【0】INDICATION:  Patient with history of renal stones.

【1】COMPARISONS:  CT abdomen and pelvis of ___.

【2】FINDINGS:

【3】The right kidney measures 10.7 cm and the left kidney measures 11.8 cm. 
Moderate right hydronephrosis seen on the ___ CT exam has resolved. 
There is no left hydronephrosis.  There is no evidence of nephrolithiasis. 
Renal echogenicity is slightly increased bilaterally.  Bladder is

 Total DLP (Body) = 599 mGy-cm.

【0】ULTRASOUND-GUIDED CORE BIOPSY

【1】CLINICAL INDICATION:  ___ woman with history of potential fatty liver
disease, left lobe infiltrative mass concerning for HCC with potential mets.

【2】COMPARISON EXAM:  MRCP on ___.

【3】TECHNIQUE:  The risks, benefits and alternatives to the procedure were
described to the patient, who gave written informed consent.  A preprocedure
timeout was performed using three patient identifiers.  A suitable site for
biopsy over the left lobe was chosen, where there is a large, heterogeneous
predominantly hypoechoic mass.  The skin was prepped and draped in the usual
sterile fashion.  Lidocaine was infiltrated into the skin and subcutaneous
tissues for local anesthetic.  Under ultrasound guidance, two 18-gauge core
biopsy specimens were obtained through the heterogeneous mass in the left
lobe.  Adequate tissue sample was obtained as per the on-site cytologist.  The
patient tolerated the procedure well, without immediate complication.

【4】MODERATE SEDATION:  Moderate sedation was provided by administering 50 mcg of
fentanyl and 2 mg of Versed throughout the intra-service time of 30 minutes
during which the patient's hemodynamic parameters were continuously monitored.

【5】The patient tolerated the procedure well.  The attending radiologist, Dr.
___, was present throughout the procedure.

【6】IMPRESSION:

【7】1.  Successful targeted ultrasound-guided core biopsy of the heterogeneous
mass in the left lobe of the liver.

parasagittal right parietal lobe, and posterior right temporal lobe, with foci
of hyperdensity on the pre-contrast scan, which could indicate mineralization
or blood products.  Smaller masses with slightly heterogeneous enhancement are
seen abutting the body of the left lateral ventricle, in the inferior left
temporal lobe abutting the tentorium, and in the left cerebellar hemisphere. 
Allowing for differences in modalities, the masses appears stable compared to
the MRI dated two days earlier.  The amount of edema surrounding the larger
masses is stable.  There is no evidence of new hemorrhage, edema, or acute
major territorial infarction.  The ventricles are stable in size and
configuration.  There is no evidence of lytic or sclerotic bone lesions
suspicious for malignancy.  The imaged paranasal sinuses and mastoid air cells
are well aerated.  Small osteomas are noted in the inferior left frontal
sinus.

【4】IMPRESSION:  Unchanged appearance of multiple intracranial metastases,
allowing for differences in modalities.  No evidence of new acute
abnormalities.

sulci, suggestive of ischemic infarct.  There is relative loss of gray-white
matter differentiation in this region.  There is no intracranial hemorrhage. 
Mild effacement of the right lateral ventricle is most pronounced in the
occipital horn.  Suprasellar and basilar cisterns are patent.   

【4】Paranasal sinuses and mastoid air cells are well aerated.  Vascular
calcifications are seen in the cavernous carotid arteries.  Globes and soft
tissues are unremarkable.

【5】IMPRESSION:  Findings highly concerning for ischemic infarct in the right PCA
territory.  No intracranial hemorrhage.

___ RF SPINE

【1】INDICATION:  ___ year old woman with clinical concern for cauda equina syndrome
// rule out cauda equina syndrome

【2】TECHNIQUE:  After informed consent was obtained from the patient explaining 
the risks, benefits, and alternatives to the procedure, the patient was laid 
in prone position on the fluoroscopic table. A pre-procedure time-out was
performed confirming the patient's identity, relevant history, procedure to be
performed and labs.

【3】Puncture was performed at L3-4.

【4】Approximately  5 cc of 1% lidocaine was administered for local anesthesia.
Under fluoroscopic guidance, a 20 gauge, 8.9 cm spinal needle was inserted
into the thecal sac. There was good return of clear CSF.

【5】12 mls of Isovue M 200 contrast was administered intrathecally.  Myelographic
images were obtained.

【6】Following performance of the myelogram, the patient was transported to CT. CT
images of the lumbar spine were then obtained.

inferiorly to the L4 vertebral level.  No further myelographic images were
obtained secondary to patient intolerance.

the L3-L4 level

intrathecal injection for further details.

source_info.text:
【0】INDICATION:  ___ male with renal mass.  Evaluation.

【1】TECHNIQUE:  Multidetector helical CT scan of the abdomen was obtained before
and after the administration of 100 cc IV Visipaque contrast.  Delayed imaging
of the abdomen was also obtained.  Axial, coronal, and sagittal reformats as
well as volume-rendered and MIP reformats were constructed.

【2】COMPARISON:  CT chest dated ___.

【3】FINDINGS:

【4】CT ABDOMEN WITHOUT AND WITH CONTRAST:  The lung bases demonstrate mild right
lower lobe atelectasis with pulmonary nodules (3:10, 29) which appear similar
to the CT of the chest from ___.  There are no new concerning
lesions or nodules within the lung parenchyma.  There are aortic
calcifications.  Otherwise, the heart and great vessels are unremarkable.
There is no mediastinal lymphadenopathy.  There are no pleural effusions.

【5】There is a large heterogeneous enhancing hypervascular mass within the right
kidney which contains calcifications.  This measures approximately 81 x 52 mm
(5:35) x 70 mm (400B:19). There are multiple enhancing nodules surrounding the
right kidney with feeding vessels, possibly representing lymph nodes or
adjacent metastases.  The hypervascularity, heterogeneity of the mass, and
calcifications are consistent with renal cell carcinoma.  The right adrenal
gland appears normal. The left kidney contains hypodensities too small to
characterize.  A larger hypodensity (3:61) within the left kidney does not
appear to enhance and most likely represents a cyst. The spleen contains two
areas of hypodensity, a more triangular-shaped anterior hypodensity (5:16) and
a more rounded posterior hypodensity (5:18). While these could possibly
represent splenic infarcts, metastasis cannot be completely ruled out.  The
left adrenal gland, pancreas, and gallbladder are unremarkable.  The small and
large bowel are unremarkable.  There is no free air or free fluid.

【6】CTA ABDOMEN:  There is some narrowing of the celiac axis at the origin.  The
origin of the right renal artery demonstrates calcified plaque; however, there
is no significant stenosis.  Again noted is the hypervascularity of the right
renal mass.  The renal vein does not appear to be involved by this mass.  The
renal vasculature appears normal.

【7】IMPRESSION:
1.  Large heterogeneous hypervascular right renal mass with calcifications
most consistent with renal cell carcinoma.
2.  Multiple surrounding hypervascular peripheral nodules could represent
metastatic tumor nodules or lymph nodes.
3.  No evidence of extension into renal vein.
4.  Two splenic hypodensities possibly representing infarcts; however,
metastasis cannot be completely ruled out.
5.  Pulmonary nodules within the right lower lobe as previously described.
6.  Left renal hypodensities, most likely represent simple cysts; however,
recommend continued attention to these areas at followup.

【0】INDICATION:  Followup right ovarian cyst.

【1】The patient is postmenopausal.

【2】COMPARISON STUDY:  ___.

【3】FINDINGS:  Transabdominal and transvaginal examinations were performed, the
latter for optimal visualization of the endometrium and adnexa.  The uterus is
retroverted measuring 5.9 x 3.7 x 4.1 cm.  Again seen is a posterior
intramural fibroid measuring 3.0 x 3.0 x 2.8 cm which is unchanged from prior
scan.  The endometrium is displaced by this fibroid and measures 3 mm where
visualized.  The left ovary is normal.  Again seen is a simple appearing
anechoic cyst in the right ovary measuring 1.0 x 1.1 x 0.9 cm, essentially
unchanged compared to the prior measurements of 1.0 x 0.8 x 1.1 cm. Neither
kidney demonstrates evidence for hydronephrosis. There is no free pelvic
fluid.

【4】IMPRESSION:
Stable 1.1 cm simple-appearing right ovarian cyst.  Although simple cysts are
common in post-menopausal patients, continued followup in six months is
suggested to demonstrate long term stability.

【0】INDICATION:  ___ male patient with history of esophageal cancer,
status post transhiatal esophagectomy, here for adenocarcinoma surveillance.

【1】COMPARISON:  CT torso with contrast, ___.

【2】TECHNIQUE:  Contiguous axial images were obtained through the chest, abdomen,
and pelvis with the administration of IV contrast.  Multiplanar reformats
(axial, coronal, sagittal) were generated and reviewed.

【3】CT OF THE CHEST:  There are stable postoperative changes, consistent with
esophagectomy and gastric pull-through.  An 8-mm nodule at the anastomotic
site is unchanged in size and appearance since ___, previously 8
mm 通用删除7(英):<u>(2, 16)</u>.  An 8-mm mediastinal lymph node in the AP window is slightly
increased in size compared to ___, previously 7 mm.  Otherwise,
mediastinal, hilar, and axillary lymph nodes do not meet CT size criteria for
pathologic enlargement.  There is scarring and bullous disease, most prominent
at the left lung base.  No pulmonary nodules are noted.  The heart and
pericardium appear unremarkable.

【4】CT OF THE ABDOMEN:  A stable 7-mm hypodensity within segment V of the liver
通用删除7(英):<u>(2, 72)</u> is unchanged in size and appearance since ___, previously
7 mm.  No new liver lesions are noted.  The gallbladder, spleen, pancreas, and
bilateral adrenal glands appear within normal limits.  Both kidneys enhance
and excrete contrast symmetrically with no hydronephrosis or focal masses
noted.  Intra-abdominal loops of large and small bowel appear within normal
limits.  Retroperitoneal and mesenteric lymph nodes do not meet CT size
criteria for pathologic enlargement.  No free air or free fluid is noted
within the abdomen.

【5】A small midline ventral hernia containing loops of bowel with no evidence
obstruction is stable since ___.

【6】CT OF THE PELVIS:  The bladder, distal ureters, and rectum appear
unremarkable.  There is evidence of sigmoid diverticulosis but no
diverticulitis.  The prostate is markedly enlarged, measuring 73 x 59 mm. 
There is no free pelvic fluid.  Pelvic lymph nodes do not meet CT size
criteria for pathologic enlargement.

【7】OSSEOUS STRUCTURES:  Multilevel degenerative changes including vacuum
phenomenon are noted within the thoracolumbar spine; however, no focal lytic
or sclerotic lesion suspicious for malignancy identified.

【8】IMPRESSION:
1.  Patient with known esophagectomy and gastric pull-through with stable
nodule at the site of anastomosis.
2.  Sigmoid diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.
3.  Stable hypoattenuating lesion within segment V of the liver is too small
to characterize.
4.  Markedly enlarged prostate.
5.  Soft tissue density at the right inguinal region may represent old hernia
repair.
6.  Stable bullous changes in the left lower lobe of the lungs.
7.  Stable ventral hernia with loop of bowel with no evidence of bowel
obstruction.

【1】INDICATION:  ___ year old man with decompensated heart failure  // Please
evaluate for PA catheter placement, pulmonary edema

【4】As compared to the previous radiograph, the monitoring and support devices are

cm, given its very peripheral location in the left lower lobe artery.  Mild

【0】PELVIC ULTRASOUND

【1】COMPARISON:  None.

【2】HISTORY:  Rising hCG in the setting of possible miscarriage.

【3】FINDINGS:  The uterus measures 5.9 x 3.4 x 4.0 cm.  The endometrial lining
measures 6 mm.  There is no visualized intrauterine pregnancy.  The ovaries
are normal bilaterally.  The left ovary measures 3.2 x 1.7 x 2.3 cm and

cm and contains a corpus luteal cyst.  There is appropriate color flow and
waveforms within both ovaries.  There is a small amount of simple free fluid
identified in the cul-de-sac.

【4】IMPRESSION:  No definite IUP.  The differential diagnosis includes early
pregnancy, too early to visualize, miscarriage and cannot rule out ectopic.

【5】Repeat serial hCGs and pelvic ultrasound is recommended. Findings were
discussed with ___ resident on call.

【0】CHEST RADIOGRAPH PERFORMED ON ___

【1】COMPARISON:  None.

【2】CLINICAL HISTORY:  ___ man with rapid AFib, question CHF.

【3】FINDINGS:  Upright AP portable view of the chest is obtained.  Low lung
volumes and overlying EKG leads somewhat limit evaluation.  There is linear
opacity at the left lung base likely representing atelectasis, though an early
pneumonia cannot be entirely excluded.  Left CP angle is partially excluded. 
Heart size is normal.  Mediastinal contour is unremarkable.  There is no
evidence of congestive heart failure.  No pneumothorax is present.  Osseous
structures are intact.

【4】IMPRESSION:  Left basilar opacity, most compatible with atelectasis, though
early pneumonia cannot be excluded.

【0】INDICATION:  Emergent request for intraop guidance and questionable uterine

【1】FINDINGS:  Sonographic guidance was requested in the OR by Dr. ___

into the endometrial cavity to be further evaluated with a hysteroscope. 
During real-time ultrasound observation the hysteroscope was visualized in the
endometrial cavity with the introduction of saline.  Fluid was observed to

intruments in the uterus.  This finding was conveyed to the surgeon.  

【3】Further details of this procedure and findings are available in the operative
notes.

【4】FINDINGS:

consistent with cirrhosis. There are at least 2 round echogenic lesions in the

hepatofugal flow.  There is hepatopetal flow in the left portal vein.  There
is small volume ascites, new since prior MR.

the fundus consistent with adenomyomatosis.  There no evidence of
cholelithiasis or acute cholecystitis.

of the pancreas.  The imaged portion of the pancreas otherwise appears within
normal limits, without solid masses or pancreatic ductal dilation, with
portions of the pancreatic tail obscured by overlying bowel gas.

echogenicity.

cm.  There is a homogeneously echogenic lesion in the mid renal cortex which
has previously been identified as angiomyolipoma on prior MR. ___ is no
evidence of hydronephrosis bilaterally.

limits.

of the main and right portal veins.

4. Gallbladder adenomyomatosis.

suggested in ___ year.
